Reviews.Title: “Great service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dianae05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aventura Mexicana two and a half years ago for the first time and were so greatly impressed that we decided to come back this year with our two little boys. Spent a couple of weeks this time from the end of February til March 7, 2012 and had a lovely, lovely time again!! The whole team at Aventura really knows how to make you feel at home. We could stay there for ever!! Rooms are very comfortable, loved our breakfast and the smiles from everyone at the Bistro every morning, food is great and location is excellent too (just around the corner from the 5th avenue and a few blocks from the beach). Mainly, we loved the fact that is a relatively small hotel that has everything you need to have a wonderful time! Very family friendly so mil gracias tambien por su paciencia con mis peques... Abrazos desde Uk a los chicos de recepción, Bistro, habitaciones, etc, etc. Esperamos volver pronto!! Noel, Diana and boys M.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: marta784
Reviews.Content: Wow was I impressed. I was there last year with my mom. I speak a little bit of Spanish which was helpful and very appreciative. The breakfast was very basic but for the price you pay, you can't really complain. Just go to Wal-Mart and get to go food over there. It is probably 10 min walk there. 5Avenide, this is where you should stay, this hotel is like 30 sec away from 5Avenida and all the attractions. The walk to the beach is about 10 min. We got a really nice room, and huge too. Very nice open shower, which I did not mind, the people working there were so nice too. My mom and I had a great vacation. P.S. I stayed in Playa del Carmen 3 times already, this was my favorite hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: harpduke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a night here in February. Location was great, close to beach, 5th Ave, restaurants,etc. Nice rooms,clean property, great service. I would stay here again and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Charming!”
Reviews.Author: LawJunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aventura Mexicana from March 2 through March 6, 2012. First time here and first time in Playa. The grounds were serene and charming. We stayed in Room 1105, ground floor, corner, so the room was like an L. What a great place! Thanks to everyone who made us feel at home. Gracias Aldo and Mosquito - you do a great job. My only minor negative was I wish they would have had one English-speaking news channel, like CNN or HLN. But then, you're on vacation, so who needs news! Nice to be off the grid once in a while. If we go back to Playa, we will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: laragazzina
Reviews.Content: This place is a hidden gem. Two small hotels converted into one, which means it has a nice quiet courtyard with everything you need. At the same time your are less than 10 metres from 5th avenue. Nice reception area, free wifi, two small swimming pools, plenty of sun beds and a nice restaurant. The staff were very friendly and helped us took book transfer as well as a trip to Chichen Itza. Prizes were the same as the cheapest we could find on internet. Some complain about the breakfast, but the rooms are very cheap and if you pay $10 you get a lovely fruit plate or omelette cooked to your taste. We ate at the restaurant in the evening as well and the food was the nicest we had in Playa del Carmen. KOOL beach club as well as beach towels are included. We thought it was good value for money and would happily go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Fboygan
Reviews.Content: What a great week we had. Mgr. Rob made sure everything was top notch. Service and accommodations were better than expected. Chef Marco and the staff at the Mayan Bistro supplied the best food and service of our whole trip. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mark Sheila N
Reviews.Content: Been home one week now and finally taking a minute to write a little review. This was our first time in playa and we think we got it right! A great place with a great location within walking distance to everything. We always looked forward to returning to our rooms after being out all day to see what kind of whimsical towel art the girls had left for us. If you,re looking for top notch dining, look no further than their own `Mayan Bistro`. Chef Marco is second to none. Dora(always smiling), Aldo. Misquito,Nino and Danielle, looking forward to seeing all of you again next year, Good Times!

Reviews.Title: “Fit the bill.”
Reviews.Author: joe l
Reviews.Content: The wife and I were looking to getaway for a quick, budget friendly vacation in Playa and this place was exactly what we were looking for. The positives; Location was right in the heart of everything without knowing it. 1/2 block from 5th ave and shops and restaraunts but you would never know it. The hotel itself is a charming little oasis and the beach is a short 10 min. walk. The staff couldnt be any friendlier and were very helpful with any questions we had. The negatives; Our room was a little "rustic" with only a wall separating the bathroom so if youre uncomfotable with that, you might want to get a different room. As I said the rooms dont have any frills if thats important look elsewhere. The "free breakfast was nothing more than bland pastries, toast, coffee and juices but you could order off the menu. We did not eat at the hotels restaraunt "mayan bistro" because had all a list of places we wanted to try before hand but the smells coming from the bistro were wonderful and I heard nothing but good things about the chef. Definately next time. If youre going on your honeymoon maybe you wanted to spend more $$$$ and go all out on a big, fancy resort but if you just want to experience Playa without breaking the bank, look no further. Cant wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “The only place we will stay”
Reviews.Author: Rusnak51
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th year staying here. We love it. It almost feels like a family atmosphere. You cannot beat the location to the main street and the beach. My husband loves the gym right across the street. The grounds are very well maintained including the pools. The staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Everybody”
Reviews.Author: WillyDoug
Reviews.Content: We booked a all inclusive package advertised on trip advisor for $149 us per night. It was billed to us before credit card fees at $157 us supposedly because of fluctuations in the mexican peso. We noticed every business in Playa had a different exchange rate but when they advertise in US dollars it shouldbe billed in that currency. Shows you can't always trust what you read on trip advisor. All the other trip advisor reviews on this place were accurate though. They have tried to think of everything here. They have a small table and two chairs for smokers outside each room in the hallway but non smokers have to walk by all of them to get to the exit. You get to meet all your neighbors though. The rooms look spacious because there are only half walls and no doors to the bathroom. Fine if you are an old married couple and used to your partners farts. Others mind find it uncomfortable. The key to the sliding glass entrance door and the room safe are tiny 4 sided affairs that are difficult to use sober and impossible when drunk. So stay sober here. Which is hard if you are on the all inclusive plan as dinner service is very slow but the included wine is excellent and free flowing. Food is excellent. Very good gym next door. Laundry service nearby. Internet is free but only one terminal in a hallway. Two pools but both are small and chilly. Check in staff speak english and are very knowlegable. Rooms back on to a busy street but other than that muffler less 3 am street sweeper all was quiet. Nice landscaping. All in all we had a good 3 days here and would return for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “WE WERE IMPRESSED!”
Reviews.Author: Carlo T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aventura Mexicana for 2 weeks in early February. It is a very nice, cozy, boutique hotel, half a block from 5th avenue. As far as the rooms are concerned, you should specify your needs and reserve accordingly, since there are many options. We chose the VIP plan and it was well worth it. Even though it was not on the menu, Chef Marco prepared penne & shrimps with Alfredo sauce that was to die for. Drinks prepared by Aldo & Daniele were always excellent. Kool Beach is a 5 min. walk from the hotel and is the nicest beach in PDC, during our stay we found the music to be loud and annoying. Luis & Antonio at reception were always helpful. The grounds are beautiful and very clean. Rob, the manager, was extremely attentive to our needs and made sure we did not miss anything. We found the Wi-Fi to have a rather weak signal. We will most likely return next year. C. & D. Terenzi

Reviews.Title: “Oasis of calm in the middle of Playa”
Reviews.Author: The_Bogtrotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights at the end of a two week trip. The hotel is well located in the centre of Playa Del Carmen, just one block from 5th Avenue. However once within the hotel it is serene and feels a world away from the noise outside. The hotel has a small-scale "boutique" feel, with most rooms set out around two courtyards that have the two splash pools (I call them splash pools rather than swimming pools as they are not big enough to swim in). The room was clean and tidy, and was adequate in size although nothing special. The bathroom area was separated by a three-quarter height wall ratehr than being a separate room with door. I wouldn't call it a bargain but it was good value for money given the location. The hotel offers free wifi in the open areas (which I could access from our room), free beach towels on request, and a basic inclusive breakfast. There is an on-site bar/restaurant but we prefered to head into town instead. They also offer tours and trips, although we found better deals by haggling with the vendors on 5th Avenue. If you want to be in town, I don't think you will find a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal but not so excellent”
Reviews.Author: Martin G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel first week of February 2012 for a full week. A nice and very clean superb tiny hotel I have to admit. We booked through Expedia and got a very good deal to be honest. Our low end room was facing this small pool shown on the picture, on the first floor. We felt like the rooms upstairs were much nicer and one should ask to see if they are available. The mattresses in the rooms are really bad, the shower leaks (no fan), the room door is in fact a patio door. We asked twice to have it changed. Lucky us we could purchase back muscle relaxant pills at the friendly neighborhood Walmart or MegaMart. Breakfast : pastries only for two days (no cook), basic order of toasts and juice/coffee. We did order full breakfast on two occasion and it was good. Even though they are included, the plastic chairs at the Kool beach club are not comfortable and they don't give a credit for better quality chair. Food at the Mayan Bistro is good as well as their basic selection of wine. The location is perfect however.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Bola2218
Reviews.Content: For the price and location, a good deal. The hotel is tiny/cozy. Our group stayed over 5 nights. It's clean and makes for a nice ambience for a group since you will pretty much be the entire hotel. We rented a car and they had parking, so that was great because we could get around (just don't rent budget). It's about a block from the main pedestrian street 5th ave. and for the most part is not too noisy. Although, if you get a room facing the hotel Reina Roja when they have events, you may not get too much sleep (you'll know which one I'm talking about). The other thing is one of the honeymoon suites, suite 1400 or 400 is on the ground level next to the unloading dock of the kitchen. Let's just say deliveries are early in the morning. The breakfast are some stale toasts, some sweet breads, coffee and juice from a box. For some extra $ you can order eggs etc. My impression is the chef is prouder than the quality of the food. So don't get too happy when you hear the free breakfast, the coffee is the best part. Lot of european crowd so smoking on premises. One thing that struck us badly was the fact that one night we were sitting near the pool and they began spraying for bug control right on top of us. This is extremely bad practice and management should warn the guests about this and make sure no one is inhaling the pesticides. There were never any notices about this and this would definitely be something that guests should hear about it before and after so they are not in the midst of it. I'm sure management can deal with this fairly quickly which is why we didn't lower our review. We heard the beach club Kool had a good breakfast but that is additional. We went in February and the pool is very cool and has limited sun. Free internet. The beach club is definitely not a quiet place, so keep that in mind if you were thinking of relaxing on the beach, and the beach is fairly crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Private, Yet Not Expensive Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: Bvoboril
Reviews.Content: We loved staying here during our trip to Playa. The trip was our last before having kids so it was really important it be great. We chose this over an all inclusive and I'm so glad we did. It was comfortable with good sized rooms but very affordable. Great breakfast and bar drinks. Wireless worked great. Rooms were very clean. You can't go wrong! Location is perfect if you are planning to hit the road in a rental car -- head down to Tulum and Akumal Beach. It's just off 5th Ave so you can walk everywhere but aren't in the middle of craziness. We just loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot, Great Amenities”
Reviews.Author: UnkleMark
Reviews.Content: This place is great, stayed for 3 nights last week. Just off the busy avenue but quiet and pretty. Everything worked properly in the room and the breakfast was great. They have an agreement with a hotel on the beach where you can use the lounges for free and its one of the better beach spots in my opinion. Great boutique vibe to the place.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a Family Group”
Reviews.Author: MontytheMouse
Reviews.Content: Overall, excellent. The attitude of the staff is what makes any hotel from the most modest to the most grand. Aventura Mexicana is not a grand hotel, but it is clean, comfortable and - given the location between 5th & 10th Avenue - pretty quiet. The staff, on the other hand, would grace any hotel. Nothing was too much trouble. Travelling with three children, could we possibly have adjoining rooms? Well, of course we could! Could they find us a small space to park the hire car? No problem! The rooms were perfectly serviceable and a very nice touch was the little basket of "organic" soaps and shampoos. I loath air conditioning and it was nice to be able to turn this off and rely on the ceiling fan instead. There was a fridge in the room which allowed us to have a little minibar all of our own at a low cost and the rooms we were in (2202 & 2203) were close enough to the reception to have wifi on tap. If I could improve one thing it would be to change out the sheets from poly cotton to cotton, but this is really a very minor point. The courtyard and little swimming pool is charming and gave us a nice spot to cool the children down after hot session on the beach. We didn't eat any meal except breakfast in, so I can't really comment on the restaurant. Given the location and value this hotel represents, quite why anyone would go all inclusive in PDC escapes me. Thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: WashDCD_C_Grl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in February 2012 on the recommendation of my husband's cousin who had stayed here before. It's a nice small hotel with a terrific location for enjoying the beach, Cozmel and the thriving commerical/resturant/shopping area. The rooms are clean and servicable, with bottled water included. There was plenty of hot water and the A/C worked very well. Our room had a window towards the street (we were on the 3rd floor), that was double-paned so no street noise came through. Our room had an open floor plan with a bath alcove. I would inquire about the layout of the larger rooms if planning on bringing children. The common areas are kept tidy and are attractive to sit or sun yourself. They had a pool for children and adults. I would not go for an all-inclusive package here because there are so many excellent resturants in the commercial area. The included breakfast -coffee, juice, bread/roll- was quite basic. The coffee was stellar, does anything much else matter? We needed a bigger breakfast so we could have a late lunch after snorkling so we also ordered eggs/fruit off the menu. They were moderately priced with portions to suit an American (another day we split a breakfast burrito) and quite good. We had dinner one night at the Cafe, seafood paella, which was what we expected. The menu has a good variety of items typical of the area, but as I said, many other resturants are really excellent so the small cafe has a lot of competition. For breakfast or a snack it's tops. All in all I would recommend this for those who do not want an isolated resort experience. The location in the town is key to it being an interesting place to stay. I felt for the money it was an excellent value and a good location for beach, shopping, snorkling and site seeing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved it here! Going back in October.”
Reviews.Author: batkids
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 7 nights in September. We couldn't have been happier with our decision. We were on a budget and for us, this was perfect. The grounds are beautiful and feel very "Mexican"; very green and lush. We did the all-inclusive plan and felt it was WELL worth the money. The food was good, as was the service. Our room was very clean and spacious and had a small balcony overlooking the street. It was fun to watch the locals go about their lives. We tipped our maid a couple of dollars a day and we always had clean towels, bottles of water, etc. Our bathroom had a door, though I've read that many rooms don't. There wasn't a bathtub but the shower was extra large (plenty of room for 2 :) ) and we had plenty of hot water and the water pressure was fine. The pools are small but perfect for cooling off or laying by them and I rarely saw anyone in them. The beach was no more than a 5 minute walk and the water in the ocean was so warm! We used the Kool beach club because it was free and had no problems. The waiters walk around often asking if you want drinks but not overly annoying. The most annoying were the locals asking if you want a massage, but a firm no is all it takes and they move on. The hotel arranged an excursion to Coba and that was amazing and well done. We also had them arrange for a taxi when we left and it was there waiting for us 10 minutes early. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We even went out to dinner one night with Andrea, the bartender, (who is WONDERFUL by the way) to a local restaurant down the beach that she recommended. My husband and I are going back in October so that should really say it all!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Mexico, first time doing all inclusive”
Reviews.Author: WChvrs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 11 nights at this hotel. My partner and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this small hotel. The location is excellent and we didn't need to rent a car. The rooms (we had to move our last night since we added one more night) were clean, clean and comfortable. AC worked well in both rooms. WiFi available in a couple different common areas but in our first room we had for the majority of our stay we had no trouble with wifi in the room. Water pressure in the showers was good. Toilets flushed fine. Beds are a little firmer than we prefer but we were able to sleep fine. We opted for all inclusive which was new for us and other than a couple of very minor hiccups it was great! We definitely felt like we got our monies worth. We went to both beach clubs the hotel has passes for. Kool Beach was closer but busier and like others said the pass relegates you to the plastic chairs versus the nicer wood ones but honestly it wasn't a big deal. Indigo beach club was smaller and quieter though a little further from the hotel. We liked the feel of Indigo but the beach at Kool was nicer in our opinion. The menu at the hotel restaurant which is the one you go to for the all inclusive had a good amount of offerings including pasta, seafood and mexican. Lunch menu was a little small but okay. They make a great burger at lunch time! We generally found the food very good with an occasional inconsistency but nothing horrible. The servers are very nice though service is a little slow so do not be in a hurry. Clientele was very mixed with regards to age and gender though we noticed many couples and just a few families with kids. They have two small pools but they are adequate for lounging in and around and are kept clean. Grounds are very well kept. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Such a pleasant place!”
Reviews.Author: jasonhoward7
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights and enjoyed each one. We had a lovely, clean, room. Perhaps it needed a little redesigning, but it was very comfortable and suited us perfectly. The grounds are impeccably kept and are just so easy on the eyes. The location is 1/2 block from the main strip, though our interior room was quiet. I think a room on the exterior of the hotel would be quite noisy.

Reviews.Title: “A oasis in the center of town”
Reviews.Author: Strandlat
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a real oasis in center of the town. 50 meter from the 5th Avenu. The garden is a tropical paradise. Two swimming pools and two restaurangs with good food. We had a continental breakfast included, and it was ok. The staff very helpfull and happy as all Mexicans. The rooms are big and modern and we loved it. First floor is the best, you have the garden just outside you doors. Only negative was the beds. Hard and with a plastic cover to protect the matress. If we come back, we will choose this hotell again.

Reviews.Title: “Here now and loving it!”
Reviews.Author: Sunsequitur
Reviews.Content: We have been here 4 days, halfway through our vacation and we couldn't wait to write a review. We have stayed at hotels, all inclusive resorts, and cruised and this has been absolutely one if the best ever. Aventura Mexicana is intimate, pretty, well located and the staff and rooms are very nice. No one believes a perfect review so here's my only negative - the beds. They are not as comfortable as I would prefer because the memory foam topper is very warm and I have a back issue as well. But I have had worse in exclusive 5* resort. The take away is I am confident if That if I were mention it to manageme t they would try to rectify it. It is just not that big an issue. Would I recommend this place to friends and family? - in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “You Will Be So Impressed with This Hotel!!! Perfect Boutique Hotel in Playa ...”
Reviews.Author: wahmsuzanne
Reviews.Content: You will be IMPRESSED if you book this hotel!!! We loved this place! Especially for the price! My husband and I have made several trips to the Riviera Maya area and this was by far one of our most favorite places to stay. We typically stay at the larger all inclusive commercial type resorts so I was a little skeptical when my husband told me he was researching “boutique hotels in Playa.” I must have complimented him and thanked him no less than 50 times for his selection – “he did good!” The entrance alone sets the tone for the place. Traditional Mexican colors, furniture and décor … lush gardens and pretty pools throughout – with a courtyard type feeling. We had an upstairs room at the end of the “adult pool.” It was pretty basic but very clean and perfectly comfortable for us. I did notice right away that that there isn’t a door on the bathroom area so if this is a concern for you remember to ask for a room with a bathroom door (it was never a problem for us – but I want to point it out for others who might find this uncomfortable). The grounds were very clean and well kept as were the pool areas and all of the terrace areas. Again, just very charming and what I envision for a “boutique Mexican hotel.” The entire staff was very nice and accommodating. Rob is the onsite manager and he and his fiancé, Ann, were so good to us! We enjoyed visiting with them and they were able to answer questions about the area. They also turned us on to some local places to check out (Canibal Beach Club being our personal favorite). The front desk and restaurant/bar staff were wonderful as well. We chose the all inclusive plan and I’m sooooo glad we did! The Mayan Bistro restaurant is very cute/quaint and the food was ALL AMAZING! The breakfasts, lunches, and dinners that we ate were all very good. My favorite turned out to be the last thing I tried which was the shrimp and steak skewers. Yum! The location was just perfect for us. Far enough away from the hustle and bustle ... yet close enough to walk to anything and everything we wanted to see. We never took a cab the entire trip (except to the airport which they were happy to arrange for us). It was about a one minute walk to the main downtown/5th street area, about a five minute walk to Kool Beach Club (which is very nice and one of the two complimentary beach clubs included with the hotel), and about a 15 minute walk to the ferry to Cozumel. Important to note: we also felt VERY safe at this hotel and in Playa in general. There was a very good mix of people staying there. I’m sure they accommodate kids just fine although we left ours at home and we saw very few kids at the hotel. We met a lot of very nice people from all over the world. There were couples, groups of couples, single girls there for a birthday party … like I said a good mix so all should feel comfortable at this hotel. I could honestly go on and on ... we LOVED it so much we didn’t want to leave and we will be booking again in March! I will be counting the days! Thank you Hotel Aventura Mexicana! You far exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “In love with Adventura Mexicana!!”
Reviews.Author: Mamalysa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly what we were looking for for our large group. We had the entire 3rd floor to ourselves! Beautiful grounds, great pool, Clean rooms,close to everything. The staff is amazing! Everything from the organic soap and shampoo to the the amazing cuisine in the restuarant and of course Aldos delicious cocktails were perfect!!! Luis is amazing at planning group or solo excursions.I really can't think of a single thing I would have changed about this hotel! Can't wait to return to this lil gem in paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but NOT a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: Lino I
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 9 nights in early January 2012. Its a typical small hotel you'd find in the heart of Playa and while quaint, it is not worth the $125 night we paid; certainly not by Canadian/American standards. I agree that the grounds were immaculate and the cleaning staff did a great job of the rooms every day. The front desk staff was helpful when req'd. The pools are tiny and better suited for children. We had a deluxe king room. The bed with its apparent "new" pillow tops were still quite firm and uncomfortable. The bathroom was not a private room but separated by a pony wall. Get used to flushing 2-3 times; the toilets never cleared on 1st flush. Hot water was sometimes only warm water. The free continental breakfasts were paltry but there if you want it. Try Celine's french bakery on 5th; amazing for Playa! The access to Kool Beach Club & free chairs meant you were relegated to the inferior lounge chairs at the back of the club. The comfortable loungers used up front cost 70 pesos/day but it is a nice club with a decent restaurant, friendly staff and acceptable washrooms (use the restaurant's washroom - much cleaner). The beach is not 50 meters away- its more like 3 blocks away. Be careful of the ironing board/irons offered; poor quality. Our iron leaked and was leaving sticky residue on our clothes. Generally a quiet hotel unless the hotel across the street has its roof top disco going late into the night but even with that it wasn't so bad. No comment on it's bistro; did not eat there. There wasn't much storage space in the room. Luggage had to remain on the floor. There was a small built in closet with a few hangers. The built in counter was mostly used up by the flat screen TV. Seeing as most visitors speak english, a better attempt at english programming would be welcomed. I don't go to Playa to watch TV but its nice to have while laying in bed or when we stayed indoors whilst it rained all day. The small fridge was handy but the coffee machine was scary looking; we didn't use it. There are great cafes all over the strip. Overall it was decent but I have stayed in less expensive places in Playa with the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: lior n
Reviews.Content: We are used to choose our hotels based on tripadvisor reviews and it's a first time, our own experience is completely different. I'll start with a good side: the hotel looks great and the location is good. As for the service - definitely not the strong point of this hotel. 1) we didn't have a hot water during our entire stay (maintenance guy promised it will be fixed. it wasn't) 2) after the check-out, I've told the reception guy that we didn't have hot water during our stay. I expected to hear "sorry" but didn't get no reaction at all. I guess this is the main reason I'm writing this review. For me, the bad service is worst then absence of the hot water.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Redux”
Reviews.Author: JKoz
Reviews.Content: Our return visit to Playa, after a week in Cozumel. We booked a deluxe King and it was like having an apartment. Helpful front desk service, cleanliness, and beautiful grounds continue to make this our favorite Playa choice. Going down to Tulum beach to spend the night they were willing to store our travel bags. Being a block away from Avienda 5 makes this an excellant and quiet location. Many very good restaurants are in easy walking distance. If driving, its easy access to the Federal highway. Its a quick cab ride from here to the COZ ferry, or to the ADO bus station. A great place to stay in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless rooms and immaculate grounds”
Reviews.Author: DOTIAINEDINBURGH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights at the end of our holiday. Grounds were kept immaculate. Seemed to be someone somewhere working on them all day. Rooms were also kept spotless. Jackhammer was also going on when we were there but windows are double-glazed so didn't really affect us and we're usually up about 0730. Kool beach club fine as well. The free sunbeds you get are actually the cheaper, plastic sunbeds and we paid for our own a couple of days as the others were much more comfortable. Breakfast was a bit bland. Couple of pastries each and some toast and fruit juice from a carton which is fairly unusual with all the fresh fruit around. Did pay for breakfast one morning which was lovely. Staff were all friendly and I can't quite put my finger on it but it was as if they were a bit unmotivated and didn't really enjoy working there. Sorry if that sounds a bit vague but we work in the hotel industry and that's just how it came across. Not unfriendly but not quite full of enthusiasm for their job than we have experienced in other hotels during this trip. Have also eaten in the Mayan Bistro which is attached to the hotel. Not this year but last year, while we stayed at a hotel nearby. Good service and good food. Would recommend people give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Car0linian
Reviews.Content: Let me first say that the hotel itself is very nice, immaculately clean and grounds are stunning, especially at night. The location couldn't be better. There is a nice gym across the street and you get a discount if you are staying at the hotel. Beach club is two blocks and it is free for hotel guests. Food on all-inclusive plan is really great. A chef prepares the dishes individually and he really knows what he is doing. It is a bargain for 400 pesos per day (about $30 USD). You can't feed yourself and have drinks, even wine and liquor, in the town for that amount of money. No way! so do get the meal plan unless you are a serious foodie who wants to sample around town, which is understandable. The staff are so cordial and welcoming. I cannot speak highly enough of them, really a pleasure. Only one thing strikes me as a negative right now, and it is temporary, is that they are building a gym across the street and there is a jackhammer running from 9-5. This is not the hotel's fault (I didn't deduct points for it here) but I found it disturbing as I do like to sleep past 9 when I stay out late and this is impossible as the construction is literally outside the back of my room. Sleep is impossible even with earplugs. I hate to have to say that here and maybe it will stop tomorrow. I mentioned it to hotel staff just to ask how long it would be going on. They said thank you for understanding and that the construction company actually planned to start at 6 AM until the hotel objected. Are they crazy?? there are 10 hotels on the block!! Probably I should complain to the construction workers themselves, but I can't imagine this would make a difference. But if this stops I assure you'll have a wonderful stay. Really you will, and I'm picky about hotels. This is a really great one!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Aventura Mexicana for a trip to Playa to celebrate my 40th birthday. We were a group of nine which isn't an easy number to travel with but from the very start of booking the rooms the folks here were incredibly helpful and friendly. They put up with multiple e-mails from me before the trip and answered all my questions promptly and thoroughly. When we arrived they had a hand written birthday wish for me which included a lovely dessert from their amazing restaurant. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the staff are friendly and helpful. We chose to take advantage of the all inclusive deal for meals and drinks and we weren't disappointed. Our group are all from the Northern California Bay Area and so we have a high expectation for food and we raved about the restaurant the entire time. In fact, I think we only ate outside of the hotel twice. One of the best parts of our stay was the help that we got from the guest services manager- he listened to all the activities we hoped to do on the trip and then he coordinated all our day trips. We experienced some really amazing stuff thanks to him! We aren't an easy group of people, most of us have travel a lot and have high expectations, wanting to have some luxury as well as an authentic experience, and we got both! No better place to stay, I will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the New Year”
Reviews.Author: nudge63
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to Playa del Carmen and we stayed at the Aventura Mexicana hotel. We stayed in the Honeymoon suite, it was very large, spacious and comfortable. The cleanliness of the room was impeccable , all was great, one suggestion maybe you can upgrade the breakfast fare it is pretty basic and gets boring iof you are there for a couple of days. Overall great place

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in ideal Playa del Carmen downtown location”
Reviews.Author: B.M.Miles
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed for 3 nights during the X-mas holiday. The staff was very professional and was eager to please. The location of the hotel is ideal for exploring Playa and the Cool Beach complimentary access was great. The hotel provided private parking right outside the front door which was a plus. We were able to get a room to accommodate 2 adults, 2 teens at no extra charge which was appreciated. We also selected this hotel because it was one of the few we found that did not require a 7 night stay during the holidays. The hotel is not the Ritz but it does offer comfortable, clean rooms at a fair rate. Web photos are very representative of what to expect. The grounds are very beautiful and well-maintained -- it was a quiet oasis from the bustle of 5th Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chris K
Reviews.Content: Five of the past six years we have stayed at the Aventura Mexicana and it is always a terrific experience. The grounds, location and service are all highest level.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis in Playa”
Reviews.Author: fishmart22
Reviews.Content: My family (23 of us) just returned from Mexico after a week long stay at Hotel Aventura Mexicana. The hotel is an oasis in the center of Playa Del Carmen. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff could not have been nicer. We paid for the all inclusive meals and were served from 7 am - 10 pm daily from the menu. We were asked to order the day before, one appetizer, one entree and dessert. While this was an enormous amount of food, we were told we could order more if we wanted. The food was consistently delicious and there was plenty of variety. The chef, Marcos, prepared everything from native fish, vegetarian flautas and ceviche to caesar salad, chocolate mousse and flan. The restaurant staff - Aldo (the bartender), Daniel, nicknamed "Mosquito" and Silvieri (along with a female wait person) were all friendly and worked tirelessly to make our vacation special. The front desk staff (Luis and Antonio) were helpful and always pleasant. Unfortunately one of our family members had an accident the night before our trip and she and her husband had to cancel at the last minute. Because it was the busy season, we were told that their room could not be refunded. This was the only drawback to our stay at this cozy, boutique hotel. We all had a wonderful time and I would definitely consider another visit to Hotel Aventura Mexicana!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: Karim J
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 3 kids) just got back from a week visit at Aventura Mexicana in late December 2011. This is a boutique hotel in a fantastic location - close to the beach, the 5th Avenue shopping district, and some fabulous restaurants serving authentic mexican food. The best part however is the friendly and personalized service. The staff get to know you, and go out of their way to accomodate your needs including taking time off to help you get to places, print or photocopy items and take care of any need you have. You get a feeling that the staff know you and value having you there. We got great advice on places to visit, shop and eat. its a real gem and we recommend it most highly. We will definitely go back to this hotel again. The great service made our visit most enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat what you get for the price”
Reviews.Author: ggg212121
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel on 3 seperate occasions spanning from sept 2010 to the most recent time in December 2011. I love the decor and smaller boutique feel. It is right next to 5th avenue for your shopping and specialty restaurants and is close enough to walk into town for more authentic food. The staff have always been extremely helpful and I have never had a problem. The restaurant, Mayan Bistro, is good too. The beach is about a two block walk and you get free lounge chairs at the Kool Beach Club. If, your idea of a vacation is to stay at a resort where you hardly leave and want huge pools, numerous restaurants on premise etc then this hotel is not for you. If you want a tastefully designed hotel that is an unbelievable value then this hotel is for you. They use only organic supplies in the rooms. It is a nice place at a great price. Check them out.

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow Wow!!! Best Hotel EVER”
Reviews.Author: carmamarie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 nights here. I travel for business often all over the US and have also traveled outside the US. This was the best hotel experience I've ever had. The grounds, staff, food everything was flippin awsome! do get the all inclusive because the chef there makes some of the best food I've eaten EVER... We only ate 2 meals outside the hotel the entire time we were there and they didn't compare.. LOVE this place and will come back again and again. It's not on the beach but and easy walk to it.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique beauty, Gourmet grub, Economical price”
Reviews.Author: samueljohn
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana is a great botique hotel in the heart of Playa Del Carmen. Although you are within walking distance of everything you need (including Mega Mart), this hotel is cozy and rather calm, even in the evening. Our only complaint was that our room was right next to the restaurant, which plays fairly loud music until around 11PM at night. But, with our door shut and the AC on, it was hardly noticable. Restaurant: Amazing food at good prices. ALL-INCLUSIVE WARNING: There are menu items, especially drinks, that are not available to all-inclusive guests. In addition, the menu is not varied enough to support too much variety. We did the all-inclusive for only a couple days, and it was perfect. Room: Although not 5-start quality, the hotel's cleanliness and tidiness was above average from comparable places we've stayed at in the past. We had a nice flat-screen, but no US Cable. The fridge and AC both got FRIGIDLY cold. The bed had a nice memory-foam top. Amenities: The pool was cold, but cleaned daily. The best amenity was the free passes to TWO DIFFERENT beach clubs. It's great. You don't have to pay beachfront prices for your room, but you have access to chairs, umbrellas, and waiter-service on the water. We suggest the Indigo Beach Club, as the chairs (and service) were of higher quality. Overall, this hotel is great, and we highly recommend it. Try taking advantage of their deals and promotions, as that helped our budget a lot. In addition, we HIGHLY RECOMMEND taking advantage of their discounted taxi service to/from the airport, as it was as effortless as limo service. Very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: kikoMarbella
Reviews.Content: While I cant compare it to the other hotels in Playa, I had just driven down from Marriott CasaMagna Cancun so I have to use that hotel as benchmark... I should say that the price of the room was practically the same but the hotel facilities and services were poorer in comparison...Ill be brief: MT for Marriot & AM for Aventura Mexicana MT: Frontline beach, 5 star room, 5 star service, large pool with pool attendants, feeling that place was spotless... negative---food and drink + internet prices were too high! AM: small pools (1 for adults only), not a nice bedroom, looks old, noisy aircon, noisy minibar...3 star service, room wasnt as clean or at least that was the feeling we got due to the oldish style of the bedroom... Breakfast was ok however the service wasnt... We did like the location and didnt mind so much walking down to the beach, by the way we also liked the beach club offered free of charge to AM guests and also the free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with great staff, really felt looked after”
Reviews.Author: LondonJames2050
Reviews.Content: . Great restaurant the food was excellent with a wide range of food available. We enjoyed the all-inclusive deal 400 pesos each a day. Great location near 5th Avenue and we were given beach towels and a voucher for a beach chair. We were told we booked through Expedia and we were upgraded (which was a first as normally it works against us). The Room 2400 was huge with a sofas, table and chairs and kept clean. The bed was enormous but the plastic under sheet made it uncomfortable. WIFI was unusable in the room but good at the Restaurant, pool side and reception. There is a big gym in the street. Good parking.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME...I AM SPEECHLESS!!!”
Reviews.Author: devildog0800
Reviews.Content: The location is the bomb! Right on calle 5 and the beach. I was there with my wife and 3 kids and we loved it! The trip started rough. They forgot to pick us up at the airport, but later refunded us and took us back for free! We had the 2401 room which is like the suite and it was spacious and very clean! The staff was awesome, always willing to help. The beach is 2 blocks away and very clean. They give you free passes to a restaurant on the beach so you can get a cabana with lawn chairs like 10 feet off the beach. There you have waiters that bring beer, food etc to you. The view was great (women), the ocean was good too lol. It is a topless area, so keep that in mind if you have kids, or prude wives! Back to the hotel, it had a pool which was small, but adequate. The breakfast was nice and yummi, it consisted of coffee, juice and sweet breads.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobynC03092011
Reviews.Content: I've only been to Mexico twice, but I'm not a huge fan of Playa del Carmen (I dislike super touristy places...Cozumel is much better or even further down the border to Akumal or Tulum...if you feel the same!). All that being said, this great hotel was a real gem to find in Playa. The pool is lovely....expecially at night, both rooms were spotless (we stayed here two different weeks, each time for one night during our honeymoon), staff were always accommodating and helpful...it really was a terrific little place! They even have a washroom you can freshen up in before leaving (if you have a late flight and you had to check out hours before you leave). Very thoughtful! It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the beach (very sad for me, but for the amount of $$ saved, well worh it!) The food was decent, not amazing, but good. The free breakfast is like most free breakfasts...sweetbreads, juice, coffee or tea. Nothing spectacular, but ok. We ordered breakfast on top of the free sweet breads and billed it to the room, because we needed the nourishment to usually keep us till 3 or so in the afternoon, when we actually had time to eat again! If you are looking for a non-traditional, money-saving, yet clean hotel, this is it! This place was BY FAR, our favourite place we visited in Playa del Carmen (aside from the Ocean ;)!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent restaurant, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: ladyjade28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very pretty once inside and the front desk service and the food at the restaurant are both excellent. I booked through Expedia only a week before going and wasn't sure what I was going to get, but it turned out to be an excellent decision. It's right up Calle 24 between Calle 10 and Quinta Avenida (5th Avenue) but at the northern end, so I took a taxi to the bus station when I had all my bags. There's a small parking lot for people who have rented cars and I saw the front desk staff actually tell people to move when they had no business being parked there. Jose at the front desk took care of me from the start, explaining all the rules and answering all my questions. The hotel itself is beautiful with two pools, one for adults and one for anyone. They have a open-air restaurant with the best food - Mexican, Italian, seafood, breakfast - and bar. The bar service varied a bit - some waiters did not seem interested in serving you, others were very attentive, but the drinks were always strong, and the price of both drinks and food was very reasonable for the excellent quality. If I ever return to Playa, I will be sure to eat here again. Continental breakfast was pretty good too, with different juices each day (mango, apple, pineapple) and whole wheat toast along with pastries. The room itself was sparklingly clean. The maid made different towel art every day which was a nice surprise upon returning to the hotel. I had a room that faced an exterior street, so there was a bit of street noise and it was actually a bit dark, but this was the only detraction. The bathroom was impeccable and my room happened to have some serious water pressure - you had no doubt all the sand and salt were washed away. They have organic lotion, shampoo, conditioner, and aftersun gel you can use. The a/c was so powerful that I ended up turning it off most nights or it would be too cold. There is also a ceiling fan you can use, and the flatscreen tv had something like a hundred channels, most in Spanish but some in English or French. The bed was somehow both firm and soft - I have slept on some VERY hard beds when in Asia and so to me this bed was quite comfortable, although Americans who may be used to softer mattresses may want to know that mattresses in Mexico are firmer than back home. The hotel has free Wifi in the lobby and in the restaurant/bar. My room was too far away to receive it, but in the end having it in the lobby meant that I was able to ask the front desk staff questions as I did research about what to do in Playa. When you check in they give you a towel card which you can turn in to receive a free beach towel for the day, and you get back when you return the towel in the afternoon. They have passes for free beach chairs at Kool beach club - which is hipper, more crowded and busy, and has a staff that spends a lot of time (too much time) making sure you have everything you need; and also a beach pass for Indigo which is a little farther down the beach - it is much nicer with beach beds, more beautiful hotels, more upscale feel, and some very good food and drinks. The young men and women who worked at the front desk were very polite and helpful, one of them going to far as to take me to Tulum and Akumal beach on his day off so that I did not have to use public transportation, and also to the beach club Fusion where they have live music (salsa and belly dancing when we were there) while you have drinks right on the sand as the waves crash in. This was a very nice complement to my vacation and made it much more enjoyable. For sure I would return to this hotel if I come back to Playa and stay here. Truly a relaxing and beautiful place to come back to in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect small hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: candyGeorgia
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an amazing 4 night stay in Playa for our 1st wedding anniversary. We had been in touch with the hotel through email asking lots of questions and they always replied quickly with lots of information. We were very pleased upon arrival, the room was much better than we expected, clean and nicely presented with beautiful towel art and flower petals on the bed! The hotel is in a perfect location just off 5th avenue, 2 blocks to the beach (5 min walk) and easy to walk to all the action on 5th avenue. They give you tickets to use the sun loungers at Kool beach club which was nice, and they also offer massages right on the beach reasonably priced (I think it was $40 for a 30 min massage) The only downside to that beach club was the loud techno music, but you soon got used to it, and there were times it got a bit quieter, it was never a problem but if you want to hear nothing but waves then you may want to find a quieter spot. The breakfast at the hotel was good, 2 different juices everyday, coffee, tea, pastries and toast. Then you can pay extra for cooked food, we tried the 'Divorced Eggs' they were really good. Also, the hotel has happy hour 4-7pm (2 for 1 drinks) They make THE BEST pina coladas! Staff were great, especially Luis. They booked a trip for us to Tulum and Xel-Ha (highly recommend both places) The hotel was quiet, never heard any noise in the night or anything, no bugs! Nice outdoor decor, has a cool jungle feel, pools are nice, landscaping makes you feel relaxed. Cannot fault anything and would definitely stay here again in the future, and it wa great for the price. I have stayed in places that cost more per night but were nowhere near as nice. A great find! Oh, just an afterthought, if you are a couple and havent been together long, dont get the king room! There is no bathroom door, just a little alcove with a curved wall, so unless you are confortable hearing each other 'take care of business' then get a different room haha! (I think the other rooms were regular hotel style - the king room has kind of a nice open villa feel to it!) But dont let this put you off, the place is wonderful, especially if you love boutique hotels and not large clinical resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Ist visit to Playa del Carman”
Reviews.Author: Valguelph
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the aventura and had a great time. This small hotel was a real treat after all inclusive resorts. Check in was fast and friendly, It is very close to everything and the beaches are great. Our premium King room was large and very clean, however a mirror in the room would have been nice. Rooms were cleaned very quickly, often by the time we had returned from breakfast. Bar service could have been better, barman (tall) realy wasn't interested in serving you , One afternoon after sitting at the bar waiting for a drink we eventually left as he was busy eating. Never said hello.The rest of the staff are very helpful. We enjoyed eating out at the local eateries and there are plenty. Fifth Ave is a short walk away but we started to avoid it because of all the time share husslers. Overall a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Playa”
Reviews.Author: MeanGreen16
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in Mid November for a week with my wife. Grounds were nice. Great location!!! Just off of 5th avenue and close enough to the beaches. Chef Marco makes excellent food and is truly an artist in the culinary field. Everything was delicious and the staff equally as warm! I wouldnt hesitate to visit again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd Stay...just as wonderful as our 1st”
Reviews.Author: Ryannroxx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed here in July for 6 days and found it so amazing we decided to bring our daughter (4 yrs old) with us. This time we stayed for 7 days the week after the Thanksgiving holiday. Andy was quick to respond to my emails and made sure everything was right before we arrived. This time we stayed in a double room by the kids pool on the 1st floor. The bathrooms are in another room as compared to the King room we stayed in last time. Organic bath products and a very large shower in this room. The location is great. Starbucks is down a few blocks, a cambio and pharmacy are just around the corner. The agreement for free lounge chairs extended to include Indigo Beach Club as well as Kool, just ask the front for a ticket. Indigo is a very upscale beach club if that's what you are looking for. The staff is amazing! The Skype phone is super handy and the front desk delivered all our messages from back home promptly. Aldo the bartender is such an asset as was our waiter Mosquito (Daniel). Chef Marco makes wonderful food, try the Mayan Bistro out...they have great Mar y Monte pasta. . I personally think the breakfast (coffee, fresh fruit juice, toast and Mexican pastries) is enough but my husband would always order the breakfast burrito...he loved it and I will agree that thing is really good. Cute towel animals everyday from the maids. Rob, the Operations Director, is a really cool guy if you get a chance to talk to him. He goes out of his way to make you feel at home. Everyone treated my daughter special and we felt like family. This trip we had a late flight so we checked out, kept our luggage in the office, borrowed 3 towels and went to the beach. We used their shower room to shower before we headed to catch our flight. Perfect hotel. You will not be disappointed. It was perfect for a romantic trip and this time it was perfect for our family. We will stay here again...and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente!”
Reviews.Author: gggbme
Reviews.Content: I've traveled to Playa many times and this one is my favorite... a fantastic value. The rooms are neat and air conditioned with fridge and potable water dispenser. The grounds are very nice and well kept, and the service has been excellent. The Mayan Bistro serves up great food- I had a Chipotle Grouper with vegetables that was fantastic, breakfast nearly every morning. This place is great. A few gripes- particularly the erratic wifi, but that may be a Mexico thing more than a problem with the hotel. A great value. I found a new go-to place in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for 2 months and was thrilled every day”
Reviews.Author: kpcharlier
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7 years ago and decided to come back because they were so nice. They said the wifi is strong enough for work-related phone calls (necessary if we were going to stay for a month!). We stayed for all of September & loved it so much that we decided to come back in November for another month. The wifi is great & we had no problems whether we were inside our room or by the pools; the staff is very helpful and will give you the local's tips for dining & transportation, and the Mayan Bistro serves wonderful food every day & 2-for-1 happy hour from 4-7 with awesome drinks (esp coconut frozen margarita). The continental breakfast is toast, juice, coffee & tea, and a bread of your choice (sometimes chocolate muffins, corn muffins, pastries, mini croissants). You can always order more for about US $4-7. This is a boutique hotel. There are 3 floors of rooms and 2 pools plus a small kiddie pool, a massage area, and a yoga palapa. There's plenty of room to sunbathe in five different areas with umbrellas to provide shade if you wish. It is in the perfect location--just outside of the noisy area but still very close to all of the action on 5th Avenue; it's only a 5 minute walk to the beach. Every room has a tiny outdoor seating area to themselves. The air conditioning works great but there is a ceiling fan if you want the A/C off. Some of the rooms have bathroom walls which do not reach all of the way to the ceiling, so if you have a problem with that, request a room with full bathroom walls. There are plenty of hangers in the closet, a mini-fridge, & great complimentary soaps, organic shampoo/conditioner & aloe vera aftersun gel. The beds are huge (king) and have a tempupedic topping so we slept very well. There is a free computer with printer next to the lobby for guests' use. I couldn't recommend this place more highly.

Reviews.Title: “Short but very sweet !!”
Reviews.Author: Joe D
Reviews.Content: I actually found the Aventura Mexicana on 'Trip Adviser'. I booked with the hotel and immediately got email, info and conformation. I felt I already made new friends before I even got there. On arrival you cant help but notice the feel of being in a true Mexican villa. Cool pool shapes, beautiful tropical landscape, decor and colors. I opted for the VIP plan which is more than fare. I have been to Mexico many times, but I don't remember ever having such good, tasty fresh food. The restaurant is amazing. My stay was short as I had to continue my way down the Riviera Maya. But, this was the only hotel worth mentioning. You wont be disappointed. And by the way, I did make new friends there. Luis and Rob. Great staff !! I will be booking again when I can stay longer. I see they have obtained alot of 4-5 star reviews. I can see why first hand

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: andyweller1111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a week in Playa Del Carmen. We chose to stay at the Hotel Aventura Mexicana and were not dissapointed in our choice. It's an extremely charming boutique hotel located right in the heart of Playa. From the street it looks like all the other hotels. However, when you walk in, you feel like you are in a giant very beautiful Mexican Villa. The courtyard is gorgeous. We stayed on the third floor in a wonderful room which had a great view of the city as well as a great view of the beautiful courtyard. All of the staff were extremely kind and warm. Also there is a a great restaurant, Mayan Bistro, adjoined to the hotel with fantastic service and food. Overall fantastic experience. Will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jason N
Reviews.Content: We had a great time and loved this hotel! The room was spacious, the restaurant food was wonderful, and everyone was very nice. The location was convenient to 5th avenue and the beach. One big thing we look for in Mexico is a comfortable bed and our king was very comfy. Highly recommend and we WILL go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lissaco
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this boutique hotel! In the 18 years we have been going to Mexico, we have always stayed at beachside hotels. In order to extend our 2 week stay a little, we decided to try Aventura Mexicana for 3 nights. It exceeded our expectations! Our 2nd floor room was clean, quiet, and had a very comfortable bed. The staff was great. The grounds and courtyard are a tropical oasis. The hotel provides a daily pass to the Kool Beach Club a few blocks away which is on a beautiful part of the beach (close to where we stayed the other part of our trip). The food at the hotel restaurant (Mayan Bistro) was outstanding and Marco is truly a gourmet chef (see reviews)! Great happy hour (4 - 7 pm) with Aldo, our favorite bartender in Playa. I have become a convert. I now realize oceanfront hotels are not the only way to enjoy a beach vacation. We will definitely return to Aventura Mexicana again and again and again!

Reviews.Title: “love this place”
Reviews.Author: peter m
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week in oct. the place was clean friendly staff. we where expecting a hurricane and the staff was very helpful and kept us informed.One of the clesanest places i have stayed in all my travels will recommend it to all my friends and familt love this polace and will return to stay

Reviews.Title: “"I WILL BE BACK"”
Reviews.Author: dicksterDuncanB_c
Reviews.Content: allways a blast, staff allways willing to help. for all your needs just see the curly haired man [ luis ] at the front desk every morning sitting there with his big smile.he showed me were they have the best shrimp taco's in playa.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Good Room, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: skeletonbreath
Reviews.Content: This is a cute hotel and a hidden gem not obvious from the street. We stayed in room 1 (I think), the first room on the ground floor next to the restaurant and the "adults only" pool. There was no noise from either, and it was quiet at night as well. I liked the location of being steps from the pool and breakfast. After a long day doing fun stuff all over the coast, it was nice to come back to the two-for-one happy hour and hang with other hotel guests in the pool and relax before evening plans. The complimentary included breakfast was good. Coffee, juice and Mexican pastries, toast, jam, honey, etc. We usually also ordered 1 order of tocino (bacon!) for around 30 pesos to munch on with toast. Yum! A great and easy way to start our day before heading out for excursions. The location is great, walking distance to all, and especially lovely that the convenience store was on 10th avenue only another block up. The mini fridge was great, the room was clean, the bed comfy, the sheets clean, and the safe was convenient and you can self program it. All in all, a lovely and simple boutique hotel. The property is definitely safe at night too — there is a security guard and the open-air entrance is gated off and locked until morning. The bathroom area in our room is only half-separated from the room, with a soft-loft type of wall. Kind-of a half wall thing, partitioning off that area. So, if you have any stomach issues or want some privacy with your toilet functions, be aware of this for the standard room. During low season you can save a ton on booking here in combo with your airfare on travel engine sites.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and nice”
Reviews.Author: prychu
Reviews.Content: I ve stayed at Aventura Mexicana for a week. I highly recommend this hotel for the traveler that is thinking on: good prize, good location and good service. The staff is great and very helpful. The service was ok for the prize. The location was great: close to the beach and close to the main st. While I was there the hotel had a deal with a beach club which was great because they also had good quality service and the restaurant had convenient prizes as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Emma C
Reviews.Content: A very cosy hotel close to the 5th avenue and to the beach. VERY friendly staff. Good service. I recomend the hotel to couples, friends and the ones traveling solo. If I would complain of anything it would the cleaning of the room, it could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “you would never expect this from the outside”
Reviews.Author: dougthebarber
Reviews.Content: as you walk down calle 24 towards 5th avenue you see the name above a small entrance and it appears like a small little place in the middle of the block....We booked the aventura mexicana after reading trip advisor reviews with the intention of staying in a nice clean little inexpensive place for a couple of days so we could be centrally located near playa del carmen to go scuba diving, see xcaret, and do some shopping as well as give great start to our honeymoon before heading to excellence riviera maya for our wedding....We also used the all inclusive option offered only by booking directly with the hotel thinking we would only be eating breakfast and an occasional drink....well, to say we were pleasantly suprised would be an gross understatement....we booked the honeymoon suite, room 1401, which opened up to the adult pool and bistro, and it was as comfortable a room as anyone could want, with a price that couldnt be beat....The food was ordered right off a menu and cooked to perfection and after tasting it we decided to eat most of our meals here....there wasnt one thing on the menu that either my wife or i had that wasnt fantastic.....And the chef, Marco, took great pride in his preparation....Aldo, the waiter/bartender/information exec was right on top of everyting all the time....The grounds which you would never know were there from the street, were clean, comfortable, and groomed....the honeymoon suite was large and looked exactly like the pictures on the website......we only used the beach club once but it was nice althought it is a couple of blocks from the hotel.....check in and out was fast......this is not a large mega hotel, but neither is the price....it IS a very nice, clean, great food ,comfortable room,centrally located place to stay in pdc and a place i myself would stay again, without a doubt.......

Reviews.Title: “Good location, clean, and safe but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: farfalla818
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last week of Sept 2011. I chose the hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews. My son and I stayed here 7 nights and then spent 3 nights at an all-inclusive for a wedding. The hotel is on a quiet street (24) just west of 5th Ave (restaurant entrance off 22). It's the section of 5th Ave that I find less tacky then the most southern end. The lobby is open and it leads to the family pool, yoga, pavilion, and a fountain. We stayed on this side. You pass through an open hallway to the adults only side and the restaurant. It's very lush and pretty. I could never get the wifi in the restaurant nor lobby to work on my ipad nor iphone, but my brother could on his laptop. (I got wireless at the other hotel and at many restaurants to pick up on my devices so I'm not sure what the deal there was). But they have a pc to use downstairs, so that worked out ok. For the most part, we liked the hotel. We used the passes to club kool, but it sounds like from other reviewers we had a choice of another club but I was never told of it. Club Kool has pounding techno and the free passes are for the 2nd class loungers if it matters to you. We didn't care as the passes were free. I just would have preferred a club without pounding music or at least a warning that it has techno blaring over the waves. They give you cards for breakfast and towels. You must turn in the cards at check out or you will be charged an assortment of fees. We decided to use them minimally. The rooms were quite spacious and they have a basket of toiletries in the bathroom and we always had a towel animal on our bad. The toiletries are organic and honey-based. I liked the aloe, but the shampoo and conditioner didn't really work (conditioner was very runny) so bring your own. We had a fridge which was great. We didn't really have a proper balcony, but could at least open the doors and step out. We found it amusing that they bother to have a family/ adults only side of the hotel when you can smoke all around the family pool and off these balconies. Multiple times I had to pull my son from the pool because guests would decide to sit by the pool and smoke or smoke on their balconies. How is the family side family-friendly? Luckily we didn't spend a lot of time at the hotel. I had great instances of customer service at the hotel: such as when the guest services manager helped us get a van and driver when our rental car delivery failed to happen to poor the next morning when the front desk kid (late teens/ early 20s) spent time on his cell phone and put off calling my aunt's hotel to warn her not to wait outside for us because the van secured was running over an hour late. When I asked for help again, he was quite sarcastic and told me he was making sure our price was right and seeing who we needed to pay. That had had been worked out the night before and he was not doing any of those things by playing on his phone. On my first night there I asked how to get to Rio Secreto and could I take a collectivo as I had heard you could. I was told it was too hard and I should just take a taxi. So I tried again the next morning before we left and I was told by another person it was too hard for me, there was not a stop, and then told they would call me a taxi. I declined and they looked at me like I was nuts. I told them I would hail one off the street after we walked around. In the end, I felt lied to. There was indeed a collectivo stop. I was pretty mad about this-I had indeed hailed a taxi and when we arrived I saw the stop. I found out from Rio and Secreto where the collectivos leave from in PDC. The hotel didn't even volunteer that information. So I did the collectivos the hard way: I took one coming back. I got across the street off the highway where there is no stop and flagged one down. But getting there in a collectivo would have been easy and the difference of 15 pesos a person or 130 pesos for a taxi. I started to think the hotel gets a kickback. They were just as unhelpful about Xcaret and after the first day I didn't trust their advice. I think they stared at me, decided the American was helpless or wouldn't like the local options, and didn't offer up any help. What I did like about this hotel is that it was not full of Americans--there was a mix of Americans, Mexicans, and Europeans. The guests I found to be friendly. The breakfast at first I liked the first morning. They offer pan dulces, toast, coffee, juices, and a selection of hot tea. However upon observation, we watched them just add water to the coffee from the day before and the breads became stale over the week (they were buying too much and keeping it until it was gone instead of getting fresh bread). The breakfast wasn't why I was there so I just got over it. My parents who had a neighboring room ordered breakfast there off the menu and they had a less than satisfying experience too. We purposely were staying at a moderate hotel and eating restaurants off 5th Ave and where locals eat. I've spent a lot of time time in Mexico including studying at a Mexican University on the west coast of Mexico. And I read wonderful reviews of the hotel here, but I didn't get it. The hotel is very nice, but the people at the front desk really seemed irritated and flat out lied to me about how to get to Rio Secreto. Since they sell tours, I think they possibly were mad we didn't book through them? The final issue was when my brother checked out for us. I was out SCUBA diving. They added to our room a charge for my parents (who had their own room separate from myself, my brother, and my son) in another room for transport between the airport and the hotel, except that my parents' transportation was already included in the cost of their room. My brother was the only addition for transportation. When I booked both rooms in February, I included the transportation costs to the room for my parents in theirs and my son and I in ours. I paid 50% deposits for both rooms. And the other 50% were charged on arrival. So the transportation for my parents should never have been charged to our room as it was already included in the original booking for their room. My brother didn't know this and he offered up his credit card and unfortunately he paid. I think this is a good hotel option as it has a good location and it is safe, however it really needs to look at their service/ attitude approach. And probably food safety.

Reviews.Title: “Personable Employees”
Reviews.Author: awetravel
Reviews.Content: This is my husband and my third trip to Aventura Mexicana in Playa del Carmen. A wonderful quaint hotel. There are lovely gardens, and you are away from the noise of 5th Avenue and the beach. A short walk past Starbucks to the Kool beach, which you can have a recliner and umbrella for free just for staying at Aventura Mexicana. All employees are very friendly, rooms are clean and rooms include -- sort of -- a continental breakfast, coffee, juice and pastries. Happy hour is great, and the food is very good in the restaurant. If you want to work out, you can go across the street to Evolve and get a discount from Aventura Mexicana. Great massages. Definitely a thumbs up. We love it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: NikkiG1133
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Not sure how we won the cool room lottery but we sure did here. We had the cutest little cabana away from everyone with its own outdoor sitting area. Inside it had a small couch, what seemed to be an extra large bed, refrigerator,microwave, water dispenser, sink, and flat screen tv -- plenty of closet space and more space to put things in the bathroom. The bathroom was open which was somewhat odd for a extra shy person like myself but we seemed to make it work. We only had breakfast at the restaurant but it was very good when we ordered off the menu. The pools were nice and refreshing after a day at the beach. I always seemed to see someone working or cleaning the grounds - we could tell they really care about their facility. Hopefully we will have to chance to visit again in the future since I would like to try the all-inclusive option which seemed like a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both worlds!”
Reviews.Author: MPMechanic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are frequent travelers to Q-Roo and Playa Del Carmen, we have stayed in a wide variety of accomodations from the Royal, Royal Time Shares, the RIU and Real Chains. We fell in love with the Boutique style Hotels durring our last couple of trips, staying at La Tortuga and Cabanas Tulum 2 times, this time we decided to shop around. I happened upon this hotel and their VIP all inclusive plan and decided why not, I figured if we ate breakfast and a few dinners and had drinks after a day at the beach it would be worth it. Boy was it, we enjoyed the Mayan Bistro so much we ended up eating all but 3 meals there. Chef Marco has my vote for best chef in Playa. The Room: We booked a Honeymoon suite, it was large, well appointed, clean and the bed was comfortable. There were no problems with water pressure or temperature. There was only a minor issue with the A/C which was quickly rectified. The Grounds: The grounds are beautifully landscaped and well maintained Reservations: Andy was extremely helpfull and pleasant to work with, if you are not comfortable making online reservations email Andy. Guest Services: Everyone there was extremely helpfull. Maintenance: We only needed maintenance 1 time due to our A/C not staying on, they were there in a flash and recharged the unit in less then 1/2 hour, the room didn't even have a chance to get warm. The Wait Staff: Some nights Chef Marco was the one man show, tending bar, waiting tables and cooking. For breakfast Giavanni and Dora were awsom. Aldo the evening bar tender was also great. The Mayan Bistro staff is what made our trip so special. To sum it up, this hotel is a great budget deal with a great staff that makes it seem so much more personnal. It's the best of both worlds, The feel of a small boutique hotel with a great staff coupled with the money savings of an AI, and no buffets. We enjoyed it so much by the last 4 days we were emailing Andy again for a return trip in May.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service.”
Reviews.Author: Adrianstevan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for our honeymoon and found everything on our schedule easy to get to from the location. If you are a fun tourist this is the perfect spot, but if you are one of those needy and lazy guests then you should stay at the hotel zone in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: kenh4495
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in great condition, with beautiful grounds, rooms and the staff is wonderful. Everyone was very helpful as well as friendly and is in a great location. There is an on site restaurant which is nice and serves very good dishes. We really enjoyed the Mayan Bistro staff and special mention goes out to Giovanna and Marco. Luis in guest services was most helpful as well in assisting me in locating a camera battery after mine had failed. We enjoyed everything about our accommodations in Playa and highly recommend the hotel Aventura Mexicana!

Reviews.Title: “I'm so comming back!”
Reviews.Author: Fiorelina
Reviews.Content: Little cute hotel. Everybody is super friendly. Is clean and well located. It's a few blocks from the beach but they provide access to Kool beach club and it's perfect. Is not an expensive hotel and you get lots of benefits. I definitely woyld go back

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE! Would go back anytime!”
Reviews.Author: Chicky1984
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean, has an air conditioner which is a MUST! Staff is friendly and speak English, Close to the beach and 5th ave. ( where all the shoping goes on) Food is AMAZING! Great place all in all! Would go back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Good location -Close to 5 Av and Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Mish32
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana I stayed at the Aventura Mexicana in mid-August 2011. The hotel offers the European option which best suited me because as a non-drinker I could not justify the very high all inclusive fees on some properties that easily run into hundreds of dollars per day.
