The property itself is  well maintained, the room I was in was thoroughly cleaned. The grounds are well kept and the property has two small swimming pools that looked very clean. I liked the fact that there is a separate adults only pool and a children's pool and these are open 24 hours per day.My only gripe is with the rooms,  in that the room is like a "prison cell", the toilet is just behind a half-wall with that has no door. It was probably good I was on my own, I would have been very concerned "hearing or smelling some one doing their  very  " private business" from less than a few yards from the main living area. I do not understand why the bathroom does not have a full wall and a door. Secondly the  hotel somehow appeared to be on auto-run..maybe the manager was on vacation when I was there.  For example, the Internet was down the whole time I was there and nobody seemed to be actually accountable and doing something.  I also requested to be booked one of the tours that the hotel promotes, the front desk guy could not get through to the company that  provides the tours but he did not even bother to inform me that he had been unsuccessful and I forced myself to wake up early in anticipation of this trip and ooh that is when he finally told me that he did not manage to make the reservation plus a few lame excuses... Good job! The option I chose included "breakfast". Well this breakfast is almost fake, a few pieces of toast, a croissant and a cookie. So lower your expectations about the breakfast or just opt for the no -breakfast option and  go to any of the good restaurants on 5 Ave. I requested a late check out since my flight was at 10pm in the evening and they managed to accommodate me to 1pm, which was kind of cool.  The hotel is conveniently located close to the popular 5 Avenue. When it gets cooler in the evening this avenue is popular for it's restaurants, clubs or people watching.   I checked out Coco Bongo and it was very popular with other tourists.  My only regret is the whole of Playa del Carmen looked just like any other US town, I did not feel like I was in Mexico at all, everything is American. Next time I will try to actually go to a Mexican town or just head down to Miami. Random Tip: The food in their restaurant appeared somewhat overpriced compared to alternatives on 5Ave.

Reviews.Title: “Relief and realithy after plastic Cancun”
Reviews.Author: Oliver B
Reviews.Content: Having been at the luxury prison of the Cancun Marriott for a conference, moving down to Playa del Carmen and Hotel Aventura Mexico was a glorious relief. To have genuinely friendly staff make recommmendations that aren't just directions to spend yet more money with them. To be close to relatively reasonable prices and choice and not captive to exhorbitant ripoffs. So impressed that I'm and reviewing while I'm still there! The room is comfortable, cool, accessible, clean, quiet (for central PDC). A good base to actually see a bit of Mexico while in Mexico, given the difficulties of travel with an infant.

Reviews.Title: “Great find, would go back tomorrow”
Reviews.Author: pseudomonas1
Reviews.Content: My 15 yo and I stayed here in the adult section while attending Spanish school for the last two weeks. This is referred to as a boutique hotel but only when you compare it to the all inclusive monstrosities along the beach. It is a decent size property and is very peaceful with nice mature gardens. Making reservations was easy and the guy helping me, Andy was very informative. There were people at the hotel from all over the world. There are two smaller pools in the family side of the property and a sort of hot tub. On the adult size the pool was slightly larger than a home pool or one at a smaller hotel in the states. It was nice having adults only section. This hotel is one block from the beach and they give you free passes to two beach clubs one of which we really enjoyed-Cool Club. Adventura is right off 5th avenue but you hear no noise from that street or from 10th which our window overlooked. We were on the top floor having been upgraded since we stayed there so long-15 days. The room we had was large, stylish and the "open" bathroom did not bother us. The furnishings were nice. Mattress was firm but I slept well on it with no real complaints. The room had a microwave we used nightly for popcorn or heating up leftovers, plates and eating utensils, coffee maker, a mini frig where we kept all our refrescos and fruit, a large flat screen TV, and one of our big pluses unlimited drinking water from a large dispenser. The airconditioning worked well and we had WiFi in our room. Only issue with the room was that a couple of times the hot water was not very strong but if you waited five minutes it was perfect. I think it was just a high use time. The front office people and all the workers on the grounds were polite, nice, and helpful. I had read past posts about the breakfast being on the lean side in regards to what is offered. Most days I planted myself in the restaurant for about half and hour, watched the morning news or videos and had as much juice as I wanted, three or four cups of coffee and usually 3-4 pan dulces and sometimes toast. Couple of times had the regular breakfast you pay for which is very reasonable and good serving size. We met some people who were doing an all inclusive for I think $21/day each. Since we were going to school I had lunch at school and was not drinking much alcohol but the people doing the AI said it was a great deal with unlimited drinks and great food at dinner. I would defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: justrrcgy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for seven nights in August. We booked the hotel using Expedia, and were able to secure an excellent rate (approximately $60 a night) for a deluxe king room. Upon arrival we were assigned room 2400 - on the top floor facing Calle 24. The room was very generous in size, with a dining table, leather sofa, two chairs, flat screen TV, comfortable bed, fridge, microwave, filtered water container and large bathroom. The room was sparsely decorated, but very comfortable. The property includes two small pools, one for families and one that is adults only. The hotel grounds were impecably maintained and overall very clean. Breakfast was included, and consisted of coffee, juice and some rolls and toast. It's very basic, but was all we needed to start the day. The hotel has an agreement with Kool Beach Club - lounge chairs are complimentary. Overall, we had a great stay. Aventura Mexicana is just a half block from Avenida Quinta and about 10 minutes or so to the beach. We had an excellent meal at La Carboncita (on Calle 12) - authentic Mexican food at very reasonable prices for Playa. The flank steak burrito was outstanding. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: bluejeanfoodcritic
Reviews.Content: this hotel is the perfect place to hide out in playa. it's a half block off 5th ave, 3 blocks from beach, and for all purposes right in the middle of town so whatever direction you wanted to go for anything is within a 10-30 minute walk so not having to get a taxi ever. the staff here is top notch, from rob the hotel manager, luis the reservation manager, and all of the other staff who only had smiles on their faces. if you're looking for that big hotel experience with large places to eat, fancy gift shops, expenisve spa treatments, this is not the place for you. this is in the truest form a boutique hotel and a perfect boutique hotel. anything you want or need this hotel and location can provide it for you at a nice price and location as well as if you want smaller and friendly this is the place for you. if you want large, loud, and obnoxious go elsewhere and try and eat at more chain restaurants with your plain palate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place in Playa”
Reviews.Author: klaw032270
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week and could not have been happier. A quiet place but only a half-block from the 5th avenue experience. A 5-minute walk to the beach, where the free pass to the beach club is a nice perk. (The Kool beach club was much more laid back than we thought it was going to be and the food and service were better than expected.) The food at the hotel's Mayan Bistro was quite good, so much so that eating at the hotel was a treat rather than a choice of convenience. The staff was friendly and helpful. Tours to Mayan ruins, etc. can be arranged from the front desk and were reasonably priced. A new towel design (swans, hearts, etc.) on your bed every day. We could not think of any thing we would want that was not here. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back to this small hotel”
Reviews.Author: bluegrassriver
Reviews.Content: I wanted something off the beach but still nice. It is well decorated with tropical flora. It is very close to 5th Ave. which is the street full of shops and restaurants. It was quiet so you could get good rest for busy days. I thought guest services was excellent full of ideas, honest advice, and bi-lingual. The pools are small but well kept and clean. Maid service done well. Room clean and spartan but not large rooms. This is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise”
Reviews.Author: seaexplorer
Reviews.Content: We simply showed up with no reservations, tired from traveling, hungry, and grouchy, and to top it off we arrived late in the evening. We were expecting a hassle to check in, but the guy working the evening shift was so easy going, he gave us a great rate if we agreed to pay in cash and then he upgraded our room which was a very nice touch. We initially planned to spend just one night, as we were working our way down further south, but we wound up extending our stay for 3 nights. Very clean and well kept grounds, very friendly and helpful staff, and just an overall nice stay. Thank you for the hospitality and keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet gem that I would return to”
Reviews.Author: klbdmb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week with my Partner and friends. I'm usually the type of traveler that needs a luxurious big hotel chain, but I wanted to try a small boutique hotel. I was nervous after booking the hotel but when we got there I loved it. I have stayed in Cancun and just felt like I was still in the USA, but staying at this hotel and Playa del Carmen really made me feel like I was in Mexico. I was concerned that the breakfast was only pastries and toast (unless you chose to pay for something else), but it actually was sufficient with the juice and coffee. The rooms were nice and comfortable. The bathroom doesn't have floor to ceiling walls, more of just a divider. The room had a refrigerator so you can stock up on cold drinks and snacks. I can't think of one complaint while I stayed there - only that the trip had to come to an end and I had to come back home.

Reviews.Title: “Returning in December”
Reviews.Author: Riviera_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for one week in April 2010 (It says April 2011 on top but the selection only went as far as August 2010 - I should have done this review sooner!). We had travelled to the region several times before but had always stayed at all-inclusive resort. This time we wanted to try something different and spend more time in Playa del Carmen. The hotel exceeded our expectations. Rooms - Clean and very comfortable beds. Yes, it’s a little awkward that the bathroom has no door but we got used to it. Grounds and pool - Perfect little oasis! Breakfast - It consists of pastries, toasts, juice and coffee. Hungry for something more? You can also order from the menu and the prices are reasonable. We ordered from the menu for both breakfast and lunch and the food was very good. Internet – Worked like a charm. Can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: andruelott
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here and I'm not disappointed but not impressed. I'll start with the bad. The first thing we noticed when we got here was the bathroom is more like a cubicle. There's no door separating the bathroom from the main bed area. So I had to leave our room every time she had to poo. We eventually got use to it. The hotel is not a professional business, more like a very well maintained mom and pop hotel. They have a desk where sometimes a trip manager is present where they offer various types of activities and trips. All Hotels over charge for these and if you go to a street vendor you'll find a better deal. The water pressure for the shower constantly varies. I believe it's because of other people using the water at the same time and the more people using it, the weaker the pressure becomes. Then the less people using it, the stronger it becomes. The worst part of our stay was that we got charged for a bottle of water we never used. I tried to consult the person at the desk but he apparently wasn't high enough to make any decisions in regards to such matters. Our plain was leaving in 2 hours and the only way for me to check out was to pay. Then when we gave 50 pesos to pay for the 27 pesos it cost. They didn't have change for us. I was very upset and this is the reason I call it a mom and pop hotel. Any respectable hotel would have a register and not some kid with only pocket change for transactions. The time was 7:00 in the morning which is a very popular time for people to check out so I felt a person with some decision making power should of been there to handle our situation. Now the good Location, for the price the location is pretty top notch. Two blocks from the beach and right off of 5'th ave, which is a popular area for restaurants and stores. Very cool air conditioner...It kept our room very refreshing. Until the house keeping lady turns it up or off. If turned off it will take around two hours to cool off the room again. Well maintained...it was clean and didn't have the dirty quality cheap hotels give off where you're afraid to touch the sheets. In closing...Despite my bottle of water incident...I would recommend staying here if your looking to save on money. Also I believe some of the reviews here are phony when I don't see any negative feedback.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrsG_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in June 2011 and would highly recommend the hotel. It was great value for money. The rooms were spacious and clean and the staff were all friendly and welcoming. There was lots of places to relax and read around the pool area and on the terrace. It is only a short walk away from busy 5th Avenue, but much quieter and very relaxing. The restaurant served great food too. The only downside was that it could get quite busy at breakfast times meaning that there was often a long wait to be served.

Reviews.Title: “My Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: coach3415
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 2-week stay at the Aventura Mexicana Hotel and it was as great as it was last year. You are made to feel at home like a B&B and the minute you arrive you are greeted by Luis, Jose, or Antonio who can arrange your daily itinerary. The hotel rooms are pristine, the grounds are beautiful with manicured landscaping and two pools compliment the lush foilage. The hotel has a tremendous restaurant called the Mayan Bistro headed by world class chef Marco. Marco and his wonderful staff create some of the best Mexician, Italian, and European dishes you will ever put to your mouth. Marco greets everyone who dines there and is always willing to satisfy anyone no matter what you like to eat. They can cook vegetarian and have a variety of entrees to satisfy anyone's pallette. Aldo, who is one of the best bartenders in Playa, creates some of the most delicious drinks from his worldly experiences. The wait staff of Julio, Myrna, and Dora are the friendliest servers you will ever meet and their service is excellent. The hotel rooms are kept maticulous with daily service and no request is ever too much for them to handle. Rob Smearing is the manager of the hotel and is always around to make sure you are enjoying your stay. Rob meets everyone at breakfast, lunch, and dinner and offers tips on the best places to visit when staying in Playa. The addition of Rob to the staff this year has brought a personal touch to this boutique oasis and his professional touch is evident by the quality of the hotel's food and service. The hotel is situated a couple of blocks from one of the most beautiful beaches in the world, Mamita's Beach. The hotel works with the Kool Beach Club and offers free lounge chairs to Aventura Mexicana's guests. If you intend to stay in Playa del Carmen, the Aventura Mexicana Hotel is by far the best place to stay because of their outstanding service, outstanding restaurant, and the natural beauty of the hotel grounds. This will become your home away from home too.--- Greg March

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations - great hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: lou2109
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana is a great hotel for Playa. It might not be 5* or top of the range, but if you are looking for good value for money, great location and clean and comfortable rooms, look no further. Given the good reviews of this hotel, we had some high hopes, but when we arrived the hotel was even better than expected. Great things: free parking out front, lovely grounds, adults only pool, really nice spacious room, best shower we had all holiday (hot and powerful), lovely toiletries, A/C, TV, safe and fridge in the room, bar and restaurant on site (continental breakfast included), close to everything in Playa. Points to note: rooms do not have balconies and pools are smaller than they appear on the website. We booked online on the hotel website and got a king deluxe room for great value. Our room overlooked the adults pool - so was quiet - most of the families seemed to have rooms around the family pool which makes great sense. The hotel is just off 5th Avenue, the main street in Playa, and also close to the beach. The hotel offers beach towels at reception as required, as well as free passes to a nearby beach club (which we didn't have time to use). You are spoilt for choice for nearby restaurants. If you are looking for luxury there are plenty of places in Playa which cost more and may offer a more luxury experience. However chose Aventura Mexicana if you want an above average hotel that offers great value - would recommend this to anyone going to Playa, and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place and would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: ambrwavs41
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at the Aventura Mexicana I was escorted to my glorious room on the second floor facing the adult pool. This room was beautiful, clean, and elegant. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful at all times. I purchased the Mayan Bistro package which included my meals and drinks as well. I ate the finest fruits with 'pan dulce' every morning! I was part of a group for a wedding and did not eat at the restaurant each night, however, on the last night I dined there and had an incredible piece of fish that the chef prepared in the style of the Yucutan. I must say that the guacamole was the best here too! The pool was clean and had the perfect temp! There is a gym right across the street from the hotel which has all the state of the art equipemnt, and only costs 100 pesos to use! I cannot say enough about this hotel and next time I visit Play Del Carmen I will definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay and were happy with this find!”
Reviews.Author: rnzwsizrs1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aventura Mexicana for 5 nights in March 2011. What a terrific location! It is only about 1/2 block from the main shopping and about 2 blocks from the beach. The staff was very friendly and helpful and recommended a dive shop for us. Access to the Kool beach club was a plus. It was quiet in our room and very clean and housekeeping gave me extra towels when I requested them. The continental breakfast was adequate and you could get a larger breakfast for very little extra. We got WiFi in our room because we were close to the restaurant which was nice. There were very few negatives...1) you had to use the key to lock yourself INTO the room and you only have one key, 2) needs better lighting in the room, 3) I would love a more private bathroom. These negatives were minor and easily were easily outweighed by all the positives and we would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly Staff, good location but that was it”
Reviews.Author: beakyfish
Reviews.Content: The staff here are great, it is in a good location ,however the hotel for us was dissapointing We stayed here for 6 nites and in the first 2 days considered leaving Firstly we were overcharged at check inn, which was sorted. We were in a room which was next to the street and was noisey and i mean next to the street only metres ,when we first checked in, i discovered that the window did not lock and some one could have easily climbed in from the sreet.This was fixed. Water pressure was poor and only just warm on some days.The restaurant was closed for the first 2 days which resulted in breakfast in the foyer which was terrible.The internet is only in lobby and restaurant .I mean i can only go on our experiance at the time, at would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect escape!”
Reviews.Author: Ryannroxx
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love it here and plan to return. Check-in was prompt and we were shown to our room quickly, which was up a few flights of stairs outside. If you have bad knees or hate stairs, I would ask for a room in the courtyard. We loved our room and the stairs were fine for us. The room itself was basic, but for the price it was a fantastic deal. We had a Deluxe King room. There was organic products in the room which was a very nice touch. The room was equipped to the max. with a mini fridge, microwave, flat screen tv and large bottled water dispenser. There is ample closet space. The only thing needs to be mentioned it the bathroom doesn't have a door, but it is around a corner...so if you are not that comfortable with the person you are traveling with this might be a problem. For us, this was no big deal. We opted for the VIP plan which ended up being the most unbelievable deal ever. It was affordable enough that you didnt feel tied to the hotel, restaurant or bar. Everything was included food wise, except the Specials, but the food was amazing. We ate at the restaurant most meals because the food was that good. They even served us at the pool. The pools were an nice change from the Kool beach club, which free passes for lounge chairs were given at the reception. Also at the reception was a Skype phone which they allowed us free 3 minute phone calls to the USA. There were also a library of books you could read and return. Now finally for THE MOST IMPORTANT PART. The people there were amazing and we absoloutely love them. Aldo the bartender was the coolest ever. We were sitting @ the bar one night talking about different types of beer and Aldo went down the street and bought us a specialty beer that he thought we should try. The service was amazing...

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel just off avenida 5”
Reviews.Author: worldxperiance
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just one night on our way down the coast. Beautiful grounds and good beds. Decore was mexican and more than what I expected for the price. Pleasant staff. Rolls and coffee in the morning. Ask to stay in main courtyard. We were just steps to the main pedestrian avenida 5 with shops and restaurants galore. No noise heard other than a rain storm! Free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and hotel - we'll be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: tchili
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Playa for the past 20 years and feel like we outgrew the all-inclusives because they are so restrictive. We felt like after paying so much for meals, etc., we were tied to the property during the day and they were far from the quaint center of town, 5th Avenue where there are many shops and places to eat. Of the 5 boutique hotels where we stayed in the past, the Aventura Mexicana is definitely our very favorite of all. Sadly, today was our last day here (18 glorious days!), and wish it could be longer. The hotel and grounds are beautiful and very well maintained. The hotel staff are genuinely kind and helpful for anything you might need. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Every day our housekeeper, Rosie, made us cute town figures that were so creative and pretty. She really took a lot of pride in her work as does everyone here. Antonio, Luis and another kind gentleman that I am so sorry I can't remember his name, took time to get to know us and make us feel at home and comfortable. They went out of their way to help us in any way they could and were always friendly and accessible. Even though we had a balcony room facing the side street (24th), it was very quiet all day and night and close to the action on 5th. Just around the corner, is an amazing Italian restaurant. The hotel offered tours but didn't push anything on us. We took one trip to the Isle of Contoy and it was very beautiful and a nice day trip. The last thing, but very important to me was the wonderful shower and the fact that we always had a warm/hot shower. Some places we have stayed in Playa barely had warm water, but the Adventura Mexicana had wonderful warm water and good shower pressure every day. AC worked well and we had a small refrigerator for drinks, etc. There was a lock box in the room for money, etc. and we always felt very safe here. Can't wait until we can get a chance to come back because we will definitely want to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Get Sisters vacation”
Reviews.Author: Acmeflower
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my sister in May 2011, who had never been to Mexico. I found this hotel on trip advisor and stopped by to check in out while in PDC in February 2011 with my spouse. It seemed perfect. They were kind enough to show us a room. I am not sure how old the place is but it feels very new. It is totally respectably clean, neat and modern. Our room had 2 queen beds, a small refrigerator, hair dryer, shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, TV, nice towels, phone, clock radio and large bathroom with nice shower. There is internet access in the lobby but since we were on the first floor, we also got it in our room. The staff were FANTASTIC. The front desk helped me with my spanish. The breakfast staff in the restaurant were also very nice. Always acting like they were happy to serve you. The hotel has many nice statues, 2 pools. They can also arrange trips for you. We were surprised to get daily vouchers for use of the "Kool Club" beach area. This was nice but you cannot bring any other beverages (including water). You have to purchase everything from them. That being said, we had several drinks and ate lunch there several times and it only cost around $20.00 usd. The Kool Club has a very nice pool. Eventhough the Aventura Mexicana is not right on the beach, it is totally within walking distance and the area is very quiet. It is only 1/2 block from 5th avenue. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. If I wanted to find anything that wasn't good, I would say that the white tile floor in our room had some large gray stains. Looked like the tile needed to be cleaned with muriatic acid. It was not surface dirt, rather something deeper. If you stay here, you will be happy. I have stayed at many hotels in PDC and this is one of the best for a moderate price. You can find cheaper but you get what you pay for and of course, you can get many places more expensive but my question is "why"? Every person who stays in PDC gets to walk the same streets, hang on the same beaches. Don't pay a high price for nothing. Enjoy yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay at this boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Christypix
Reviews.Content: This was the first time i have stayed at a boutique hotel. I found this hotel to be very clean and the grounds was well taken care of. The staff was very nice and helpful. The hotel room was small but accomadated us well. Yes, the bathroom did not have a door. It was kind of wierd but it worked. I also didnt like the water pressure or temperature but that might be a mexico thing. All in all i think this a great hotel and worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in for the price in Playa”
Reviews.Author: GrittyKitty11
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth vacation in Playa Del Carmen and Aventura Mexicana has been my favorite hotel so far. This trip was a girl's trip. If you are looking for a moderately priced hotel close to the beach and to nightlife, I would recommend this hotel. Our room was a superior double double and was like having our own two bedroom apartment. It also had a little kitchenette with a microwave and refrigerator and a bathroom with double sinks. The Aventura provides towels and passes to the Kool beach club, a short 5 minute walk to the beach. The restaurant, the Mayan Bistro, has excellent food and daily food and drink specials. We did not opt for the all-inclusive option, but probably will the next time we stay as this is one of the only "boutique" hotels that offers all-inclusive and it seems like a good deal. Antonio at the front desk was always very helpful and friendly and I would also recommend talking to Luis who can book excursions for you and give you recommendations for things to do based on your interests. I will definitely choose the Aventura for my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. We'll do it again!”
Reviews.Author: StinkySandals
Reviews.Content: Please don't let the average rating fool you. There are no negatives to this hotel. It's just that compared to the very lavish accomodations offered in Playa del Carmen, it is just a basic hotel. I can't say enough about Luis at the front desk. He was always helpful and friendly. The rooms were spotless and didn't smell like mildew (like a lot of places off of the beach), the AC worked great, the location was central. The two best things about this hotel are the price and trhe fact that there are no surprises or people trying to get one over on you. Just good people willing to take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Playa, loved, loved, loved the hotel...”
Reviews.Author: etmjam
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hotel Aventura Mexicana. Our 21 & 18 year old sons had a deluxe double with a sliding glass door right at the pool, really great room decor and great location with a water fall right outside their room. My husband and I were in room 400 a deluxe king. Both rooms were very clean and the beds were comfortable. The only negative on room 400 is it has a mirrored door and on the other side is a storage room that the restaurant uses. The light shines through and at times it can be nosey wit the staff getting their supplies. The room is also right next to the kitchen and I would suggest they fill in the area with more plants so if you want to sit outside the room you are more comfortable and not looking at garbage cans. Just some constructive feedback - we loved, loved, loved this hotel! The grounds are beautiful, the pools, the upper decks, etc. just lovely. It is a peaceful and relaxing atmosphere but, close and convenient to beaches and 5th Avenue. Get a massage with Oscar - he is the best!! Most importantly is the restaurant staff Aldo, Betty & Chef Marco - we love you! We had great times eating & drinking and getting to know new friends in the Mayan Bistro. Hotel Management - your staff is your true treasure. From Andy's help with the reservations to the staff on site - you have good people! Thank you for making us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: gaylest
Reviews.Content: We picked the Hotel based on location and reviews on Trip Advisor. The staff who are on the desk 24 hrs are fantastic, they really gave good advice on tours etc, everything could be organised by the Hotel and was with the minimum of fuss. The food in the restaurant was lovely. The location was superb! One step out of the Hotel and you were in Playa Del Carmen! Short stroll to the beach (Beach Club is included) also 100 mtres to 5th Ave and 10th Ave. We would not stay any where else and highly recomment the Hotel. All the staff were friendly and helpful. If you want a real 'Mexican' experience stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - Perfect location - quiet”
Reviews.Author: UDIVER
Reviews.Content: We went with the all-inclusive plan and it was worth every penny! The value is incredible. The food we ate at the restaurant was better than most of the restaurants we went to in town. We ate breakfast, lunch, and dinner at the hotel several times and all were fantastic. We ate out a few times as well so we definitely are able to compare. It is in the perfect location, one block off 5th Avenue. You couldn't hear any noise inside the courtyard or in the rooms. It was nice and quiet at night. The two pools were very nice as most hotels in town don't have them and it gets hot in Playa in May. They also have free passes for beach chairs and umbrellas as Kool which is just a couple blocks away. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. I'm a picky sleeper and I slept pretty good in the bed. I like super soft mattresses, so I'm different than most. No matter where I sleep, I prefer a softer mattress. The mattresses at Aventura aren't the cheap, thin, hard ones that you see at the Super 8. Our room had a refrigerator only. I've seen some posts that said their bathrooms didn't have doors. Well, our bathroom did have a door. We also had a big closet and lots of drawers. The staff were very pleasant and attentive. You will know them very well by the time you leave. It's nice to have a 24-hour receptionist. They even hold your room key for you when you go out for the day/night so you don't have to worry about losing it if you have too much tequila. If you are looking for 5 star luxury, this is not the place for you. If you are looking for quaint comfort, excellent food, great people and convenience to everything, this is the place for you. I would post photos but they would look just like the ones already on here. They are exactly as pictured.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: dimapsi
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Aventura Mexicana hotel. It has everything that is promised. Great room (superior), great breakfast, excellent location and helpful staff. We booked this hotel to be near the downtown of Playa del Carmen and to be able to stay in a good hotel while doing full day attractions without paying for an all-inclusive service that we would not be able to use during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel - exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBaller
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this for a long stay as it is a small hotel but we used this place as a nice base to tour around the Mayan ruins of Tulum,Coba and diving in the Cenotes. Was perfect for this - stayed here for 3 days before moving on to Merida for 2 days (Luz En Yukatan) and then followed by 7 nights at the All inclusive Moon Palace in Cancun...overall the best holiday we have ever had. Nearly forgot to mention - online booking form asks if you want a massage ! This is a must...it was great and not expensive !

Reviews.Title: “10 Points for Adventure Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: Mextogo
Reviews.Content: We looked at a number of hotels before we selected Hotel Aventura Mexicana. This was our first stay at your hotel but not visiting Playa Del Carmen and we found your facility, staff, and location as the best I have experienced to date. The entire grounds and rooms were very clean and orderly. Any issues that came up (was only two) were taken care of immediately. Your hotel and staff are to be commended on your service and dedication to ensure the best for a very reasonable price. We look forward to visiting again and without a doubt Hotel Aventura Mexicana will be our choice for accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Great little oasis off of Fifth Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Juliebenmark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aventura during Easter break and had a great time. Charming little hotel steps from 5th Avenue. Steps from everything, but yet a quiet little oasis if you get sick of the crowds on 5th and at the beach clubs, etc. Property is beautifully maintained, workers were very friendly. Definitely will stay here again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Imacculately clean rooms, beautiful grounds, friendly and attentive staff all at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: HeatherandAndy
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several places in the Playa Del Carmen area ranging from 5 star all inclusive resorts to palapas on the beaches of Tulum. The Aventura exceeded all of our expectations and is on our list of hotels to return to. They recently began an all inclusive dining package that we had the pleasure of taking advantage of. The food is incredible at the restaurant thanks to their chef "Marco". We had heard stories of the chef coming into the dining room (which is partly outdoors by one of the pools) to talk to the guests and to custom create a meal for them. We actually saw him doing this. The service is a little slow, but after all this is not Denny's . It is worth the wait, plus what's the hurry this is Mexico. Most of the staff speaks perfect English and are always available to solve any problem or answer any question that you have. Definately a great find, one that we didn't want to leave. It is not right on the beach but only a short walk away. They give you access to the use of a beach club and 5th Ave is right there if you want to shop, hit Starbucks have your picture taken with a monkey or watch the amazing street artists. We loved this place and we will be going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good base for travellers”
Reviews.Author: Ania_Adam
Reviews.Content: We have been here over 3 weeks, fthe hotel was the base or us , we rented a car and were travelling in Yucatan. But when we were at the hotel we liked the atmosphere, breakfasts (especially omellettes ) and drinks (amazing barman with long hair - I mean his skills and talent for creating drinks- we loved Aventura mexicana that was different , the taste depended on the mood, weather, day;) . Room was big , based on basic colours and comfortable bed, The location was also good. Aventura Mexicana is worth staying in!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Beaverman33
Reviews.Content: The good - Great staff - incredibly friendly and welcoming Great location - just off 5th avenue where all the action is but there's no noise at the hotel, it's really quiet and relaxing Really nice grounds - beautifully landscaped with 2 swimming pools; one for adults and one for children (a great idea!) Fantastic room - very large and spacious with 2 double beds, satellite TV, refrigerator, en-suite bathroom and a small balcony overlooking the children's pool. The room was cleaned daily and the maids left us is with some stunning towel art! WiFi - Hotel also had free WIFi Breakfast - the price also includes a continental breakfast (tea, coffee, fruit juice, toast and a pastry), this can be upgraded with additional items if you're hungry. The cost of upgrading was very reasonable (a couple of dollars) and the food very tasty (I can throughly recommend the huevos ranchero) Book exchange - the hotel also has a cabinet full of books where you can swap, free of charge, any books that you have finished reading Kool Beach Club - a big bonus is that you also get to use the facilities at Kool Beach Club which gives you free access to loungers, umbrellas and toilets on the beach Cost - the hotel is good value for money The not so good - These really are very minor points Breakfast - on the 1st day of our stay the kitchen had run out of bread for the continental breakfast (surely someone could have gone and got some from the shop around the corner). On the second day we had toast but not hot options due to a fault with the gas. The room - our room was a little bit on the dark side and could have done with a little more lighting Summary - If I go back to Playa Del Carmen I would have no hesitation in returning to this hotel (you can't get a better recommendation than that!)

Reviews.Title: “lovely quiet beautifully maintained and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: AndreaChilanga
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Playa - previously stayed at a boutique hotel around the corner. We liked Aventura more because of the pools (great to have a family side and an adult side!), the restaurant, the included coffee/sweet rolls/toast breakfast and the towels/beach club passes to Kools instead of Mamitas beach club (which to me seems gets a bit too loud and crowded during some weekend days). Someone else posted an option if both Mamitas and Kools are just too crazy - go down the beach to the Las Palapas hotel and rent the lounge chairs for the days. Each for 200 pesos which includes your lunch/drink, use of the pool, facilities, etc. Quiet and peaceful if the other places aren't. We did that one day as it was the end of easter break and the other beaches were crazy loud but for the rest of the week Kools was just fine. We lucked out with a secluded, separate "suite" with private patio which I really enjoyed. I like quiet outdoor space to myself to read and relax. I can't say I believe all beds are new sealy mattresses as this one was very very firm - but still was softer than the last place we stayed which is a good thing. We only had dinner at the restaurant once but it was excellent. Would have been even better if the evening waitress paid a bit more attention but it was not a big issue. It's a very beautiful place filled with flowers and trees, lounge chairs around the pool as well as on the second floor large decks. Facilities and grounds are well maintained and staff are friendly and helpful. We did ask for a plug connector three times that we never got - small oversight that wasn't a problem. All in all with so many hotels to choose from, I aim for peace and quiet, outdoor space, pools, nice scenery and nice people. Aventura is all of that!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Dunk60
Reviews.Content: We stayed April 4-14, 2011 and had a fabulous time. Our 2nd time at this hotel and so beautiful and convenient to the beach, 5th Avenue and great hot-spots. We met some great people from all over the world and some old friends from our first trip to the Aventura Mexicana. Great staff (Jimena, Antonio, Luis, Alejandra, Cristina and the rest of the staff!) who spared no time in assisting us, giving directions, advise or just a great chat while hanging out. Location-location-location!!! No right on the beach, but roughly two blocks and now you can enjoy free beach chairs/ palapa at Kool Beach Club. We feel this area of 5th is the nicest area as it's cleaner, quieter with respect to annoying merchants and a more relaxed feel. Lots of beautiful little spots near by to eat and drink. Do enjoy the hotel's Mayan Bistro which is one of the best restaurants in Playa. Lovely spot with two great pools, hot tube, great tanning/sun spots with meticulously maintained lawns/ grounds. The hotel and rooms were spotless and the room always was cleaned early which was nice. Olivia the 14 year old house cat is lovely (we hope her eye is getting better?) A MUST VISIT! Aventura is a hidden gem that gives guests a great bag for their buck.

Reviews.Title: “Felt So Welcomed -- Just like Home”
Reviews.Author: edlinbell
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the first week of April at the hotel. We had done an all-inclusive before but wanted to try a small boutique this time. It was fabulous. We had a slight problem when we checked in with the room selection but the gentleman at the front desk, Jose, took care of getting us a room with a view as noted on my confirmation. The room was perfect and each day it was cleaned spotless. I usually don't sleep well while away and I slept soundly each night. Each day we were given passes to the Kool Beach Club and totally enjoyed being there in the private club and beach area. The walk was less than 5 minutes away. We did have the free breakfast each day in the Mayan Bistro and the service was outstanding. The lovely ladies that work there were so wonderful and helpful. The front desk staff person that makes me want to write this review is Jose. He was the most wonderful person we've met in a long time. He answered all our questions about restaurants, shopping, etc., and if he didn't know the answer, he called someone to find out.... With such a terrific person on staff there, I would go back in a moment! The hotel location is fantastic to say the least. It is 1/2 block off of the action. But, you don't hear the noise from the street. I absolutely love the staff, the location, and the small intimacy of this boutique hotel. I highly recommend this to anyone. We will definitely go back to this hotel next time we vacation in Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Got to defend this little gem”
Reviews.Author: abeachgirl4ever
Reviews.Content: I have been a lurker on trip advisor for a few years, but the recent review saying that Aventura Mexicana "sucks" made me angry enough come out from under my rock! My husband and I have stayed there 3 times over the last two years, the most recent being this past January. This is an adorable, immaculately clean, boutique hotel that prides itself on impeccable customer service. We have stayed in 3 different rooms, all were kept fresh and spotless, mattresses and linens were fresh and clean. Never saw a bug inside the room anywhere, anytime. Maintenence people are around daily tending to the pool and beautiful grounds. I have emailed Andy regarding my booking with questions and always got a prompt reply. The front desk staff were always very helpful, and answered our questions and requests cheerfully. If you are looking for a high end resort hotel with all the bells and whistles then this perhaps is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a unique, cute, clean, well located hotel to use as a base for chilling out or touring or being a beach bum, then you can't do better than Aventura Mexicana.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: mbnb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Avenutra Mexicana was recommended to us by my niece who had stayed there 3 years ago. It was everything she said, and more. All of the staff, and in particular, Antonio were very, very friendly and helpful. They all helped us with our daily sightseeing trips. Their advice was right on, so don't go any further than the hotel for advice. The hotel is so cozy, comfortable and very clean, and the accommodations are more than sufficient. We would like to have stayed around the hotel longer each day, but unfortunately, we set ourselves up for long sightseeing days. We would love to go back and spend more time at the hotel, since it was a very relaxing atmosphere. The location was absolutely perfect... one block off of 5th Ave. (where we had dinner each night and the food is awesome). Its about four blocks to the beach... just a nice walk. You get a clean beach towel anytime you want it, and they have a partnership with a larger resort on the beach to use their lounge chairs. It was perfect! We highly recommend it to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: trumpetmark2
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from an 8 night stay and couldn't be happier. The entire hotel staff was amazingly helpful - even the ones that couldn't speak english went out of their way to help. The rooms are spacious and very clean. We had a different towel design on the bed every day. The hotel is 1/2 block from 5th avenue and was still quiet. I have been traveling both personally and professionally for over 30 years and this was by far the best hotel experience to date. I highly recommend this hotel. Be sure to eat at the hotel restaurant, the chef is great!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley the best place to stay in Playa del Carmen hands down...”
Reviews.Author: d33rhunt3r
Reviews.Content: We had a Fantastic stay the room was clean the staff was A+++++ and the King size bed were EXCELLENT... If your looking for a GREAT Place to stay at a great Price look no further !!!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel for location, relaxation and customer service!”
Reviews.Author: KWerlinger
Reviews.Content: This is my first trip advisor review ever! We have always read other reviews but never posted anything of our own (although we book our trips soley by what others write). This place made us compelled to actually contribute and help out other trip advisor readers! :o) We absolutely loved this place. It has everything you need or want. The staff is amazing! Managers Rob and Dominic were so attentive to our requests and very helpful if we had questions about things offsite. Alex was a wonderful server at the restaurant and Aldo was a great bartender. We couldn't ask for anything better! The grounds are beautiful and immaculate. The pools are perfect for lounging/relaxing and visiting with other guests. We loved meeting new people and comparing vacation notes. The rooms are quaint and perfect for a nice getaway. We would sit outside every night on our patio and check emails and sip cocktails. The restaurant is amazing! I've never had such great breakfasts. The chef will cook whatever you want -- and believe me, I'm a picky eater. I had great massages (booked the day of) for $35 per hour. They were amazing -- right on site and you could book a couple hours in advance the day of! The hotel location is amazing. It is right off 5th Avenue where all the shops and restaurants/bars are... The beach is close by and not a big deal to walk to if you weren't into the pool atmosphere. Overall, we can't wait to go back. If we didn't have our dogs (and jobs) waiting for us back home, we would have stayed forever!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MNhasSnow
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Perfect location between calle 22 and calle 24. Free lounge chairs at KOOL beach club was a great perk (value: 40 pesos per chair per day). Nice little continental breakfast, but the orange juice is different. (Go down to the corner of 5th and Juarez and get some great OJ from the cart. 15 pesos, fresh squueezed. YUM!) We were in the section toward the back that runs along 10th avenue. Very comfy bed and quiet. We really heard nothing after we went to bed. We did have the "no privacy" bathrooms that we had heard about ahead of time. Not THAT big of an issue. If you need a little more privacy there is a bathroom in the walkway between the two pools that always seemed available. They have a computer you can use for free. I think they also have free wireless, at least I saw a lot of people using their laptops. The hotel has a variety of room styles. I think the rooms by the computer may have more of a sound issue as I was told my noise woke up one of the people in a nearby room. If I had one recommendation it would be to paint the area around the pool white. We would usually come back to the hotel around 2 or 3 and hang out by the pool and the brown area around the pool got pretty darned hot. That's it. We wouldn't hesitate to come back to Aventura Mexicana. It's a great place.

Reviews.Title: “A bit of paradise....”
Reviews.Author: mamabarks
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about our wonderful experience that we are having at Aventura Mexicana. Top notch service from the time we arrived and we are still here on our 7th day of a 9 day vacation. The staff is extremely accomodating and friendly which is very important when traveling with our parents that do not get around well. The rooms are very spacious and the beds are comfortable. The showers are large, the baskets of shampoo etc.. are plentiful and even include aloe vera. Every day we have a new design made of towels after they cleen our room, each of which is amazing. The pools have beautiful waterfalls flowing into them and they are always clean and comfortable. The restaurant is very good...the continental breakfast is free and plentiful and the menu available is tasty and cost effective. The chef is amazing and will prepare about anything that you desire, even if it means they have to order special ingredients for you. If you have any questions or want any tips just ask the front desk and they will give you all the information you need. The hotel manager is amazingly helpful as well and we have appreciated him so much. I will stop for now but may post again once we check out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: SmileyGirl7283
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Aventura Mexicana for our honeymoon and it was wonderful! The room was very clean and was a nice size. Most of the rooms look out into the main courtyard, which is beautiful and has many trees and flowers. We also ate at the hotel restaurant for lunch most days during our stay and the food was excellent. The staff was very helpful with arranging all of our day trips and was always available to answer questions and help. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: ken363
Reviews.Content: We have visited three years in a row. Nicely maintained, and a very helpful and friendly staff. Small gardens and pools are very quiet and restful--perfect place to relax. We do not enjoy laying all day at the beach, so this hotel is great--close to shopping, resturants, right in town--not a sterile resort all by itself along the coast. It is nice to see the life of real people in a real town. The bedding could fit a little tighter on the mattresses, otherwise very comfortable room. The beach is a five minute walk, free towels at the desk. We prefer the part of the hotel close to registration. The rooms in the other section are less traditional--bathroom separated from the rest of the room by a curving dividing wall--not a separate room with a door, and closer to a busy road.

Reviews.Title: “Yes please”
Reviews.Author: Mirko M
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the non-family area just to find out that most of these rooms are facing calle 10 a very busy road through Playa. Despite double gazed windows the noise was disturbing my sleep. We complained the next morning and got a free upgrade to the deluxe king room which was perfect. The location is absolutely spot on (short walks to the best restaurants, beaches & bars). The service was very friendly and Luiz & Antonio are just amazing guest managers. They answered every question and always seemed to be in a good mood. If you should go to Tulum as well, book your Chitchen Itza tour from there. It's a long trip from Playa (3.5 hours) just to get there. The included continental breakfast is way to basic but there are other options from the menu available. Close by are also very good breakfast places. It's a lovely hotel with nice garden area and amazing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel in Playa -- quiet, well-located”
Reviews.Author: BostonGirl011
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana is a great little hotel, located toward the north end of Playa which is quieter and more relaxing. We stayed here for 5 nights, and were generally pleased with it. The hotel is short (5-10 min) walk from the beach, and you get free towels to use at the beach/pool. It's right off of 5th ave, but is pretty quiet. A few notes: -We had a room on the 3rd floor, with very high ceilings, a fridge, AC, and fan. Rooms on 2nd and 3rd floor overlook the pool. First floor rooms are right on the walkways and would probably be louder. As other reviewers have mentioned, there is no door or partition to the bathroom. This wasn't a huge issue for us, but it was definitely weird; not sure why they don't hang a curtain or something. -The hotel gives vouchers for free plastic beach chairs at Club Kool, a short walk from the hotel. It has waiter service, so you can order food/drinks to your chair. It was pleasant in the mornings, but obnoxious techno music started around noon and got louder throughout the afternoon. We sat as far as possible from the speakers, which helped a bit. If you want a quiet, relaxing beach afternoon, you won't find it at Club Kool. -Helpful, friendly front desk staff for the most part. When we had an issue with no water in our room (this happened twice during our stay), the staff were extremely responsive and fixed the problem right away. One exception: the Sunday before we left, we asked the front desk person to confirm our airport shuttle arrangements because we would be out all day. He was unfriendly and acted as though this was a great inconvenience to him. When we got back that evening we found out that he never called the shuttle company or told any of his co-workers to follow up. That said, the night clerk was extremely helpful; he searched around until he found our travel info stuck in a desk drawer, and called the shuttle company on our behalf. -Breakfast staff at Mayan Bistro were friendly and attentive, though a little inconsistent (we requested milk for our coffee at least 3 times one day and eventually gave up). Free continental breakfast isn't much food; we ordered extra food off the menu every day. -Happy hour drinks were 2 for 1, and you can sip them lounging by the pool. The drinks were pretty weak (not much alcohol), but were tasty. Kind of like smoothies.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: adian_amsterdam
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 days in Playa at the Aventura Mexicana Hotel. The hotel is located more towards the end of 5th avenue, which is good, as the beginning of the 5th av. is trashy. The hotel is very clean and well maintained. The rooms are built around swimming pools and a garden, which looks lovely. The rooms are simple ( we had the deluxe room), but spacious and very clean. Also the bed was good. The decor is dated. The service at the front desk was very good, they were helpful when you asked them for tips etc. The service at the restaurant was disappointing; in the room rate you have a continental breakfast, but that is truly not worth it, sow e had breakfast outside of the hotel every day. Also the personnel in the restaurant are not very warm and welcoming. Overall, for the price you pay, it's a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: SallySmartTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is tucked away in the best location. It is within walking distance to everything from the beach, to nightlife, to restaurants, shops, and big box stores (in case you forgot anything at home). I will say that my husband and I spent many years living in a city and are not intimidated by a 20-30 minute walk, however. Others could easily and affordably travel by cab. Rooms are basic. The bed was very comfortable, there was good air conditioning and a ceiling fan. We had the smallest of rooms on the property but it was all we needed. And it was cleaned very well daily. Internet was available sporadically on the property but not often in the room. This was as advertised. Breakfast was as advertised, as well. It was very nice to have someone serve coffee and pastries every morning with a smile. The beach towels were a very nice service and allowed us extra room in the suitcase for other items.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel- good location, clean, friendly. Don't stay on 1st floor!”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth1107
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Aventura Mexicana, and again we really enjoyed it. The location is great- just off 5th Avenue, but quiet, clean and beautiful grounds. For the price, you cannot beat it! Our room (King bed) is perfect for two people. The a/c works well, the staff does a great job maintaining the grounds and the front desk is helpful. We used the mini-fridge for some snacks, sandwich stuff and cooling down drinks. The big difference in our stay this time was the noise level. We had room 110, a first floor room, and there was a speaker right outside our sliding glass door. The bartender cranked the music, and I had to go out and tell him to turn it down at 2 a.m- twice. Our first visit here just one year ago, we were up on the second floor (I think 203?) and it was much quieter, I didn't even hear music or people in the bar. Also the maids' closet is right next to 110 so you can hear them in the early morning starting their day, rolling out their carts, etc. Make sure you don't get rooms on the 1st floor is my only guidance. The beach is close by- a five minute walk- and while you get a free plastic chair at club Kool by staying at Aventura Mexicana, beware that the techno music gets louder and louder through the day. My husband and I ended up walking down the beach a short distance and renting chairs at Hotel Las Palapas for 200 pesos/person. You could put the 200 pesos towards food and drink- and the service was way better there than Kool. We easily used up the 200 pesos each on food (lunch) and beers so it was worth it- especially the quiet, friendly beach that suited us better. We sound like old farts- but we're in our mid 30's and just wanted to relax on the absolutely gorgeous beaches, not go clubbing on the beach. All in all, we love Playa, Aventura Mexicana and can't wait to come back. If you're looking for a great little hotel, with a perfect location, quiet (for the most part!), and clean- you can't beat this for roughly $110/night.

Reviews.Title: “big things come in small hotels.”
Reviews.Author: ndon70
Reviews.Content: This is a great property which took some getting used to. At first it seemed like a maze to get to my room (#1110), but then you get used to it after a couple of tries and soon appreciate the layout and security. The room was on ground level, sliding glass door entrance to the room right in front of the adult pool and mayan bistro. The room was exceptionally clean (thank you Cristina!) and generous in size. No trace of dust anywhere including top of cabinet doors where I tend to hang things. Having a clean shower head was great! The a/c was super cold and the ceiling fan helped for added circulation. I ate breakfast every morning in their restaurant “mayan bistro” and it was delicious! The two ladies working gave top notch service and remembered the little extra things I request during my visit. Dinner was yummy. Marco, the chef is very personable and will do almost anything to make you happy. The location is great and close to everything. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit. Big thanks to Andy, who was very helpful in aiding my decision to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: robertEdmonton
Reviews.Content: i spent 10 days at this hotel and found it met all my expectations. the hotel grounds and room was very clean. the hotel is located very close to fifth ave, yet far enough away to avoid the noise of clubs and music in the evenings. the staff were helpful and friendly in every way. the use of internet was always available in lobby or restaurant areas, in my case because my room was close to restaurant i could log on in my room. check in was a breeze and no surprise fees at checking out. a/c worked well and quiet. little fridge worked well for cold drinks and snacks. inroom safe did not work, bed was somewhat too firm are the only minor faults i can mention. all in all, a great stay, i enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, with very nice people working there.”
Reviews.Author: dicksterDuncanB_c
Reviews.Content: room was great. hotel in perfect spot, close to everything. maids did a great job cleaning the rooms. front desk were very helpfull, Jose, Antonio,and we can't forget the great ...... scratcher Luis. Can't wait to go back. see you guys soon Vern & Dian.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very restful and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tammyloree
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to this hotel in three years. It was very comforting that all the staff at the front desk was still working at the hotel. We had a very nice room that overlooked the pool, and garden area. It was very clean, and the whole staff was very friendly. It is about a 5 minute walk to the beach. You are only on block off 5th Ave. Which has lots of places to eat, and shop. Also the front desk has a very nice staff that can help you with any tours that you would like too take. We took a snorkleling trip that was very nice with lots of fish.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: KailuaBred
Reviews.Content: Not much more to add to the other reviewers who like this place. Great location. Fantastic people. Jose was great at check in and Luis was awesome with his recommendations. We got in pretty late and had our first dinner right at the hotel restaurant (Mayan Bistro). The food was excellent! In fact, even though they serve a continental breakfast at no charge, we ordered off the menu and had excellent food. Most of the breakfast entrees off the menu are less that $5 USD! When in Playa, do NOT stay at an all inclusive. Save money, enjoy the different restaurants in town and explore. We will definitely be back to the Aventure Mexicana. By the way, we had an incredible massage right at the hotel for $35. Sure you can save $5 by going down to 5th Ave, but it was much more relaxing right there at the hotel in their outside setting.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Jewel”
Reviews.Author: MarkVancouver80
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, just off fifth, the main street in Playa, so close to all the restaurants, shops and beach, but still far enough back to be quiet. Lovely small hotel, built around a courtyard with palm tree’s pools and lots of sun chairs, so you cam enjoy them in peace. Service first rate, and all the staff in the hotel and the restaurant really try hard to make your stay really special. Couple of issues that may not work for some people, the bathroom has not door from the bedroom, so while there is a wall, you can not have total privacy, and the water pressure in the showers is not great, this may be a hotel issue or a general issue in town? Anyway great value hotel, if you want to be close to the main town, but quiet and have a nice oasis within the hotel to relax. We have been twice and would go back

Reviews.Title: “It is the most relaxing hotel within walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: suzybelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us and it lived up to everything we were told. The room were perfect for 2 people. The television was mostly in Spanish but we were able to learn of the language. The rooms were cleaned daily and it was spotless when done. The guest services director, Luis, was most helpful with all requests. He knew everything about the entire area. We were very close to 5th Avenue but you would never know it because the sound just didn't carry. It was nice being so close because we could eat (just about anything) and shop. We found it to be the "perfect" spot and we will return. A free contintental breakfast was served daily plus the restaurant was opened for lunch and dinner. The food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “a little oaisis to regroup and get refreshed!”
Reviews.Author: happyjack62
Reviews.Content: Well here it is, people..quite a little gem of a place! We will be back for sure...This is truely set in a great location, close to the ferry to cozumel, shopping on fifth ave. and the Btours available through the hotel..we did it all..enjoyed it very much.They even have suggestions for nice, quiet beaches with bars..and few people for that quiet getaway.The staff is very friendly and helpful with english being well spoken. And for those who miss their animals back home they even have a cute little kitty named olivia who loves attention and food! Now for the food here in playa carmen...we tried so many different restrants all over fith ave and down the side streets and were very dissapointed with them... so the real key is to eat at the hotel! They have a wonderful little place called the Mayan Bistro which serves breakfast , lunch and dinner and it is the best weve had down here.. good food and good service and nice atmosphere.. you have to try it even if you arent staying here.. Their chef is well trained in italy and places his mark on all of the dishes..Now for those who enjoy gardening, plants and flowers like i do.. you are actually nestled in a plant filled courtyard with three pools and little garden rooms.. it is awsome and we feel that this is what really gives the little oaisis feeling... it is all so good! You should check it all out for yourselves... i know that you will enjoy it very moocho much!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel...Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SCJazzGuy
Reviews.Content: FIRST: Please review the Mayan Bistro (hotel restaurant) if you stayed at HAM and dined in the Bistro. Great Restaurant in need on more reviews.... Less than a block to 5th ave and 2-3 block to the beach, Hotel Aventura Mexicana is perfectly situated in Playa. If you are looking for the all-inclusive, multi activity, huge resort - this is not the place for you. If you are looking for a romantic, casual property with beautiful grounds and a staff you will know by name, this may a be good choice for you. Guest Services Mgr Luis and General Manager Rob made us feel at home in a foriegn country. All requests were quickly taken care of and all questions answered completely. My only complaint is that I did not plan on staying longer!

Reviews.Title: “A classy, comfortable, oasis ½ block from 5th AV.”
Reviews.Author: gopbroek
Reviews.Content: An excellent boutique hotel that is quite and comfortable but located close to everything. The attached restaurant, the ‘Mayan Bistro’ has a great chef / proprietor, Marco, and serves very good food. This was our first visit to Playa, for my wife and I, we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. We had heard all the news concerning Mexico’s violence but within the tourist areas from Playa to Tulum, we felt relatively secure, at the hotel we felt utterly secure and often we did not bother locking our room. I highly recommend this hotel as a great place to ‘recharge your batteries’ and regain your mental health.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: par41
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Aventura. The room was large and clean, the a/c more than adequate, and the beds were comfortable after the staff switched out the mattresses at our request (my wife has bursitis). The hotel is small and has a quaintness about it, with helpful personalized staff, nice courtyards and pools, Wi-Fi in the lobby and café, a very helpful concierge, Luis. The location is quiet, yet close to 5th Avenue, so we could experience local restaurants rather than an all-inclusive monotony. It would be nice to increase the wattage of the lights in the room and put the same cable TV in the rooms as in the bistro, but those things were minor. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Still an excellent choice to stay in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: SuperDave77
Reviews.Content: Only reason I don't rate "excellent" was because the service dropped a bit since last time we stayed, particularly with taking care of transportation to and from the Cancun airport. make sure you do this well in advance! Our second time staying and we upgraded this time to the deluxe room, we definitely thought it was worth it. The employees both times were very friendly and helpful. Perfect location, enough away from the action to be quiet but just a few steps away if you want to jump in! The Bistro restaurant is nice to have for a quick bite, although I would say that service went down quite a bit there from our last stay. Still, all in all, we might just come back to stay here our 3rd time! I don't see why anyone would ever want to stay on a resort in Playa, there's just too much to do and see in town and Hotel Aventura Mexicana puts you right there where you wanna be.

Reviews.Title: “Our Home In Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: bigbuy
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel about 2 years ago and have been staying here and nowhere else in Playa since then. My girlfriend refuses to consider any other hotel in this area. Antonio works the front desk and has always been pleasant, attentive, and considerate. Marco is an excellent chef and even though there are tons of other restaurants in Playa, we take a lot of our meals here at the hotel. I told Rob, one of the managers, about missing the coffee in the lobby that I used to get before the restaurant opened, and he make arrangements for us to get coffee early. One of the housekeeping staff, Migelia I think, gave my girlfriend a gift that she made, as they always look forward to seeing each other. The restaurant staff has changed since our last visit, but they are all wonderful. We just returned from a trip there and have already made arrangements for a return visit in April. The bottom line is, if you are a Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons kind of person, then this hotel may not be your cup of tea. But for all others, just look at all the positive reviews and ignore the few negative reviews. I don't think you will be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to be nickel and dimed (whatever your currency)!”
Reviews.Author: NumberOneJETSetter
Reviews.Content: I have no idea how this hotel received a 4.5 on Trip Advisor – I couldn’t agree LESS. Four bits of advice, should you choose to stay here: 1. Do not use the hotel transport! They quoted my husband and I one price and danced around the details of additional changes. In the end they tried to charge us $180 round trip! The bus is $2/per person each was. I almost need to laugh at this, because it’s simply asinine! 2. Take much of what’s advertised on the website with a grain of salt. The pools are tiny, the AC leaks, the free wi-fi only works in the restaurant and some other areas - NOT all the rooms and the shower hardly provides any water. In addition you must read the fine print that says, “Discounts to beach club and fitness center.” Nothing is free here! The continental breakfast is a few pieces of white bread, coffee and ONE glass of juice (don’t ask for a second). 3. Should anything happen to anything in your room – prepare to pay 10 times what it is worth. One of the cheap lamps in our room was not very sturdy and when my husband bumped it, it fell to the hard floor and broke. We are understanding people and yes, it was his accident so we were OK to pay, however we were charged $89 for the extremely cheap, low quality lamp, which I’m pretty sure actually cost the hotel $10-$15. When we tried to reason with them on the cost of the lamp, they wouldn’t even listen -- we were left feeling robbed! 4. Do not book any trips through the hotel. Thankfully my husband and I shopped around a little before booking a day trip to Chichen Itza. Our day trip, which was purchased by a travel company on 5th Ave., cost $45. The hotel offered the EXACT same trip for $69. Once again – trying to work their guests for every penny they can. Because I consider myself a positive person and have never written a negative review, I feel as though I should at least include what I did think was positive about the hotel. The location is great and the rooms are generally nice.

Reviews.Title: “The best Mexico experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: Jason6972
Reviews.Content: I have stayed all over Mexico and Playa del Carmen was the best! The hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating. The food was delicious. The hotel and room was very clean and comfortable with great air conditioning. I will definitely be heading back to Hotel Aventura with my girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip in years...”
Reviews.Author: afeddersen
Reviews.Content: I didn't get to stay for long but I had a GREAT trip. The staff was very attentive and very friendly. The entire facility is very clean and well maintained. There are several small pool areas for you to kick back and relax while sipping on some of the greatest drinks from the poolside Bistro. The rooms, food, and drinks are all reasonably priced. My favorite part about the Aventura is the location. It's just a short walk to the beach, shops, dining, and nightlife. No cabs and no maps needed. Everything is at your fingertips.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT holiday!”
Reviews.Author: TORI022556
Reviews.Content: My sons and I celebrated our first Christmas on the beach this year and could not have asked for a better experience at Aventura Mexicana. Staff is incredible and we ate at multiple locations during our stay and I must say, Chef at Aventura Mexicana creates the absolute best dishes in the area! I would highly recommend eating the majority of your meals on site. The location is perfect for shopping, entertainment, and the beach. We can't wait to go back and are already planning the next trip - this time with Gma & Gpa in tow. Aventura Mexicana will definitley be our destination.

Reviews.Title: “No worries -- no surprises.”
Reviews.Author: Connie_Greg
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our short stay here. The grounds are beautiful and well-maintained, all of the facilities were clean, and the staff was friendly. Instead of one large pool area, there are several small areas where you can relax in the shade or sun and take a dip in the one of the pools. Towels are available at no charge to use at the pools or take to the beach. Great happy hour prices at the bistro; the morning servers were excellent, though the evening server/bartender was not very attentive. Overall, we loved how quaint and private this hotel was. Loved the waterfall right outside our patio door.

Reviews.Title: “I'll stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: mbmomKansas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Playa for our 10th anniversary. I read the reviews and saw the price and thought it was all too good to be true. Trip Advisor members have never steered me wrong and this was no exception. The room was simple, but clean. The hotel is so beautiful I sometimes hated to leave in the mornings. The restaurant/breakfast area was very close to our room. The staff went above and beyond to make sure our stay was great. The beach was only blocks away and the hotel loaned us nice towels. When our room door needed repaired, it was fixed in minutes. The fridge inthe room was a definite bonus. We enjoyed having cold drinks and water at hand in our room.

Reviews.Title: “This place is the best value in Playa Del Carmen.”
Reviews.Author: SRobinson2011
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience. The hotel was extremely clean and the grounds were prestine. The staff was very accomodating and the Restaurant/Bar had the best food I ate all trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Playa”
Reviews.Author: jenngypsy
Reviews.Content: Was also skeptical of the word "boutique" hotel before arriving at the Hotel Aventura last week. We were so impressed by the entire experience - would definitely not want to have stayed anywhere else! The grounds were so beautiful, the staff so nice and helpful and friendly; the food in the Bistro was amazing.
