It was like a little oasis away from the hustle and bustle of 5th Ave, and only a few steps away. Would absolutely recommend to anyone planning on going to Playa Del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: rcwid
Reviews.Content: We booked this property based on past reviews and we were not disappointed. The location was great, just off 5th ave. We walked from the ADO bus stop but a 350 peso cab ride would have been worth it. The property is very lush and the rooftop patios are great for relaxing. The rooms were good sized and very well kept. The beach is 10 min walk and the KOOL beach club offers a discount for Hotel guests to use their facilities. On the down side, our room, on the west side, faced a busy and at times noisy road. The bathrooms have 3/4 walls and are not enclosed which was not my preference. The staff was outstanding, providing helpful information and making our stay a wonderful experience. We would definitely stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean and serene hotel with good food”
Reviews.Author: fp154624
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana This hotel has very friendly staff. If you ask them something, they are immediately prepared to react and do what they can. Although Playa is extremely busy, the hotel has a serene atmosphere. The restaurant of the hotel offers good food for lunch and dinner. Also the continental breakfast is nice with a good croissant. The hotel in general is very clean and the rooms too. The rooms on the ground floor are very large and can be darkened really well throughout the day. This was very convenient for the naps of our one year old. Our bathroom was separated from the rest of the room (on the first floor it is not and these are also difficult to darken). Something you might need to mention when you book your room if you have a child that takes a nap! There are 2 swimming pools: one for adults only and one with a part for little children. The shallow part is large enough for a one year old to play. Although there is no fence and there are stairs to deeper water, as a parent you need to be close anyway because even in shallow water little children can drawn. There is also a 40 meter square covered area where our one year old run lots when it rained for instance. Walking to the beach took us 8 minutes. Of course it would be much easier to stay at the beach but budget counts too. In summary we had a great stay with our one year old in a clean ground floor room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice budget hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: jfiedler
Reviews.Content: If you want to be close to 5th ave. and have a great restaurant in your hotel, then you will not be disappointed. I would have liked one bigger pool instead of two small ones, I never saw anyone in them. Great if you just want to go to beach for swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place - close to everything, but also quiet”
Reviews.Author: crumpet69
Reviews.Content: A great place to stay in Playa - a short walk to the beach and right off 5th Ave. Nice pool area - you could easily while a way a day there. Can walk to everything you need. Staff all very friendly and helful. Didn't try the restuarant, mainly because it always seemed deserted, and there were so many other options right on the doorstep. A shame really. Parking is limited but we always found a space either in the dedicated spaces right in front of the hotel or on a nearby road.

Reviews.Title: “unexpected diamond in the rough, elegant, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Suzanna_11
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Mexico, and didn't really know what to expect when we got off the ferry boat. After a hot walk down 5th Avenue, we were pleasantly surprised to find this beautifully decorated, relaxing hotel in the middle of town. It was very private and the staff was friendly. The food in their restaurant was delicious and we found ourselves dinning there more often then we thought.

Reviews.Title: “Serene Feng Shui style Hotel.. making your stay unforgettable!”
Reviews.Author: Thought89
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 weeks at this charming Feng Shui style hotel. Lush gardens with Feng Shui style landscape are to die for. Centrally located with it's own cosy little restaurant serving delicous meals at all times and nightly Happy Hour! I stayed in one of their completly renovated large & bright rooms with balcony. I was in heaven! A MUST... During my stay, I was introduced to a courteousvery & very friendly (english speaking) Taxi Driver named Victor Carillo. This father of two children just bought a new taxi: #1563 He knows Quintana Roo and the Yucatan like his pocket. He will take you anywhere your heart desires. Excursions, snorkeling,shopping, airport pick up/drop off and more.....His phone No. is 984 108 5433.. I have travelled extensively and recommend him to you without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, lush, great deal, great location!”
Reviews.Author: CathyRSeattle
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 nights at Aventura Mexicana. Our vacation started in Cancun at a ritzy resort, but my whole family agreed that we enjoyed our time here more. The grounds were beautiful, the pools pristine. For a hotel of this relatively small size, we were impressed by the number of maintenance people cleaning and grooming the grounds every day. The front desk staff were friendly and spoke excellent English. Our rooms were immaculate, pretty quiet and comfortable. The entire place was charming. We would definitely stay here again. One specific "above and beyond" positive: About a week before our trip, I went to their website and typed in info to make a reservation for the same dates as our stay, just out of curiosity. The site came back with a rate over 40% less than what I was charged when I booked in March. I emailed to question this, and our rate was immediately lowered to match the website, no questions asked. Great customer service! My only somewhat negative comment is that the waiter/bartender who worked evenings was painfully slow, though a charming guy. The women who worked the breakfast shift hustled and were super sweet. The food was superb. Loved everything about Aventura Mexicana, and will definitely stay here again if we ever return to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, great place!”
Reviews.Author: kschmautz86
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed to the Hotel Aventura with my sister. The location was great - close to the dive shop that was the primary purpose of our trip. It is on the north end of the main street in Playa del Carmen - close to everything, but away from the crowds and noise. The staff were friendly and professional. A continental breakfast was included - nothing too fancy, but OK. The rooms were clean and comfy. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Adorable, Quaint, Beautiful, Personal!”
Reviews.Author: Raineydaydancer
Reviews.Content: We started our stay at Mayan Palace and after 2 nights at a Mega Resort that overcharges for everything and you have to walk a mile to get anywhere, we checked into Aventura Mexicana. We were overjoyed! The room was oversized with ample amenities including the microwave, refrigerator and a coffee pot ( Mayan Palace provided NONE of these). Our vacation started when we checked in to Aventura. Everything is very well kept, including the restaurant, grounds, and rooms. The service was outstanding....everyone went the extra mile to make sure we enjoyed our stay. Quaint little boutique hotel in the middle of a lively town. Location was absolute best! The beach club they partner with ( Kool Beach Club) was also very nice! Will definitely go back to this charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa!”
Reviews.Author: ejbPhilly
Reviews.Content: Loved Playa del Carmen & Aventura Mexicana! The hotel has beautiful grounds & several smallish pools. Very lush & tropical with the sun we had every day. Food at the Mayan Bistro was good....best steak ot the entire holiday served here according to my husband! Very friendly staff & convenient location. Hotel is one block away from 5th av. & only several blocks away from a large supermarket & a Walmart! Overall great.......If I needed to complain about anything & I hate to be negative but....I would warn guests not take room 1112. The room had a broken screen door which had no lock! Even though we felt safe, anyone could have come in. Actually someone did come in....the resident cat who would open the door & wake us early in the morning. The front door is right next to where everyone walks by to give there morning greetings. And the room it self just seemed to be a bit shabby & unfinished (wardrobe on wheels) hmmmmm! Sorry....I really loved the place except for these minor, but irritating details. Anyway....cheers from London.....hope to come back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Staff attentive and considerate”
Reviews.Author: rangerpaul
Reviews.Content: You never know what you'll end up with when you book over the web. This Hotel was a great find. As others say the location is ideal, and we found the staff to be very considerate and attentive without being over bearing. Without a doubt would stay here during future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Aventura Mexicana - Best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: scompers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I read all good reviews about this hotel and were still skeptical but we booked the hotel anyway. We were not disappointed, when we arrived the staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel was darling and beautiful, the perfect size for the vacation we were looking for. Cozy and delightful, we loved every minute of our vacation there. Once checked in, we were escorted to our Deluxe King room which we paid a little extra for. It was clean, and a decent size with a bathroom and small area to sit. We had TV with a few English speaking channels, but when you're in paradise you don't watch much TV. The pool was a stone's through from our room. We had a safe in our room and a mini fridge along with a hair dryer. The scenery around the hotel was beautiful, with lush gardens, I truly cannot say enough nice things about it. Luis, the conceirge was very helpful with ideas of activities and places to visit. We were less than a block from famous 5th Avenue and two blocks from the beach. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we will definitely stay there again. Soon I hope!! One thing that may disturb someone looking for quiet is in the evenings if your room is by the restaurant they play music and you can here it from your room. It did not bother us but it may be annoying to someone looking for total peace and quiet. It stops around 11pm or 12am and I had no trouble falling asleep with it playing. My husband and I are in our late 40's early 50's so we go to bed around 10 and it didn't bother us. One more plus, we got massages at the hotel for $35 each. They have an outdoor massage area, very professional and inexpensive. Fabulous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “First but definitely no last”
Reviews.Author: Yolis-CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to go to Playa del Carmen for our 5th Anniversary, it was the best desition we made, we stayed at this hotel just one block away from the main street in Playa, the rooms are very spacious, clean, great service, continental breakfast included, which is great 'cause we spent all day in excursions so no time for All Inclusive, free Internet, excellent staff, we definitely will go back to Playas and Aventura Mexicana.

Reviews.Title: “stay here if you want to actually experience mexico”
Reviews.Author: natastical
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive prior to arriving at the hotel, the lack of a big pool had me worried...but once i arrived i knew we were going to love our stay here. Set in tropically landscaped gardens with flowers, waterfalls and boho chic features. The front of house staff are friendly, personable and helpful, the mayan bistro cafe was our favorite breakfast haunt and the housekeepers did fantastic job throughout our 8 day stay. The only thing i didnt love was the bathroom's layout, theres no toilet door to shut in the standard rooms so if you're a shy type you may want to ask your partner to go hangout on the porch or take the deluxe king room which appears to have more privacy ;) The hotel is located in exactly the right spot off of 5th avenue to go to the better restaurants (not the overly touristy home from home places down) and right around the corner from a great tour booking company called Info Tours who'll go out of their way to find the perfect trips for you to go and discover Mexico on. Marmitas beachclub is a 3-5 minute walk away and is 90 pesos a day (5 pounds) for 2 beds and an umbrella (that midday sun gets damn hot!) which is reasonable as then you get to use the bathroom and shower facilities and to order drinks and food to your beachbed. With white sand and turquoise water, it's pretty amazing. There's tons of nightlife here too, but after a day exploring in the sun we had dinner and retreated back early most nights. For all gym bunnies there's an amazing looking gym opposite the hotel that was always buzzing. All in all we had a really great time in Playa del Carmen and in the Hotel Adventura Mexicana, and the next time we go to SE Mexico we'll absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, welcoming and great value”
Reviews.Author: crackedandcrazed
Reviews.Content: Instantly felt at home. The staff were smiling & always there to help. The beds are the best that I have ever had in Mexico. Small, intimate with beautiful grounds. Yoga 2x a week. Close walk to one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. There were good fridges in all the rooms and some of the rooms had a kichenette.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Aurelia42
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights in August 2010 at Aventura Mexicana Hotel and I definitely recommend this hotel… The hotel is decorated in a colonial style; it has 2 nice and small pools, a solarium and really nice gardens… Rooms are nicely decorated with an ok size for the bathrooms. Almost all the rooms have view on the pools. The hotel is really quite and is a perfect hotel for couples, friends and family who are looking to spend a nice time in Playa del Carmen without being disturbed by the noise of nightclubs. If you are travelling with young children the place might not be suitable as there is no Kids Club or things that you would except from a resort. The Hotel also has an Italian restaurant with great food for the price. The restaurant is an open area close to the pool which makes it really nice for breakfast and dinner... We also appreciate the advice of the Tour Guide that got us a car at a really nice price, ask him about scuba diving in Puerto Morelos, it was amazing! He offers you different type of trips according to your needs! The staff in general (reception, restaurant, Cleaning Ladies…) is really nice and helpful! Great stay, great hotel in Playa del Carmen!

Reviews.Title: “Top end service for a budget price”
Reviews.Author: travellingbarry
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend enough this hotel. From the moment we arrived until check out the staff were nothing but friendly, helpful and seemed to genuinely care that we were having a good stay. Whenever we needed to organise anything, whether it be a taxi, make calls to dive shops or planning accommodation in our next phase of the holiday, we simply asked at reception and they done all the work for us. The breakfast in the morning is simple but perfectly adequate to get you going and consisted of croissants and pastries, freshly squeezed juice and brewed coffee and toast. It was always served with a smile. This was served in the poolside restaurant so you have the choice of dining al fresco or indoors. In the evening the bar has a happy "hour" with 2 for 1 cocktails and beers. On two occasion's we decided to stay in the hotel and as a gesture of thanks the staff continued to serve us 2 for 1 for the ENTIRE evening. The grounds of the hotel are lovely with several different small pools varying in size and shape. There is a Jacuzzi and sun loungers around all the pool areas. Fresh beach towels are provided daily. The rooms are beautiful and spotlessly clean. There is daily maid service and linen change is optional. Great attention to detail is spent arranging the towels into swans and flowers to give the extra touch. Air con worked well and there is also overhead fans. I would most definitely stay in this hotel again, i thought it was excellent value for money. It is close enough to stroll to the restaurants and bars but far enough away so that you get a peaceful night sleep without the thud of the nightclub's on your doorstep. The staff are exceptionally helpful and get 10/10 for customer service

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the W Hotel of Mexico”
Reviews.Author: BethanyNOLA
Reviews.Content: Welcome to Mexico’s version of the W-Hotel. This new hotel offers all the amenities that Flashpackers love: Free WiFi, 2 pools, free breakfast, a great bar that offers 2 for 1 happy hour drinks from 4-7pm everyday, huge clean rooms with comfortable king size beds, air conditioning, TV & refrigerator in each room, free yoga classes on Tuesdays and Thursdays and amazingly helpful staff. The bartender Aldo is so hospitable and invited us to enjoy Mexico’s Bicentenial with him and his friends. We felt like family. Antonio at the front desk is great as are the two new young managers who are from the US. They had just added ultra lounge music that plays throughout the hotel. The music plays as long as the bar stays open, so if you want to go to sleep early, opt for a room on the other side of the hotel. The restaurant was delicious. The chef is from Italy and makes classic Italian dishes. The food presentation is 1st class. Also try one of the many classic breakfast dishes including chiliquitos (a great hangover cure for you late night partiers). You can also get discount chairs and umbrellas with a coupon from the hotel at Beach Club Kool. Pricing for two chairs and an umbrella were $7 usd. They are right next to Las Mamitas, however this beach club also has a pool. It’s a little closer to town if you are walking down the beach. If you are driving, guests park for free parking in front of the hotel. Also included are great organic shampoo, soap, conditioner and lotions in each room. We took advantage of low season pricing for a double of $50 usd a night Sunday-Thursday. Prices were $65 for Friday & Saturday night stays.

Reviews.Title: “Awwww, what Mexico should be like...”
Reviews.Author: LilLover
Reviews.Content: My apologies for such an overdue review of this fanstic gem in Playa. My husband and I along with 38 guests stayed here for one week leading up to our wedding Nov 7th in Akumal. This place has the best prices ever! The grounds here are so pretty, staff wonderful, rooms beautiful. We paid nothing for our week stay in the honeymoon suite because we booked such a large party, too good to be true and it WAS!!! I loved the cat that lives at the hotel, we became fast friends. There is a gal onsite that does the best massages at too low of a rate 25$ for an hour, she works from your toes up to the head, gives me goosebumps thinking about it. NO complaints, you won't regret your stay, thank you for making my wedding week unforgettable we still reminise of our late night swims and roof top fun :) I will be back..... Not soon enough!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: joefnj
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the aventura mexicana. Its a grerat location. Close to 5th Avenue and the beach. The staff was terrific. If you are looking for a nice boutigue hotel this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, friendly”
Reviews.Author: oteragram
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights with our two children, ages 9 and 13. It is immaculately clean and well-maintained. The grounds are beautiful with trees, plants and flowers throughout the courtyards. The pools are clean, and the restaurant is very good. The staff are super helpful. Luis gave us great practical advice on when to rent a car and go somewhere on our own versus booking an organized excursion. With his advice we successfully used every mode of transportation: we rented a car for a day trip to Tulum and Akumal, booked an excursion to Chichen Itza, took a bus to Xel Ha, and took a cab to Xaman Ha. All four trips were stress free and fun.

Reviews.Title: “It was a let down”
Reviews.Author: chocolatemalt
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Aventura Mexicana and I have to say it was quite a let-down. We reserved a Deluxe King room using Expedia and when we arrived I was appalled. The room we were given was on the adult side of the hotel. The only door was a sliding glass door, which opened onto a tiny room with a king-sized bed, two soiled armchairs, fluorescent lighting overhead, and a bathroom with no door. I was prepared for the bathroom with no door (having read reviews here first), though I have to say the lack of privacy was worse than I expected. Not very romantic! But the smallness of the room, the terrible lighting and the dirty armchairs were surprising. We were told that we were in the largest room and that the best that they could do for us was one on the third floor of the property, which was smaller but at least had a better layout and more windows. We were also near a deck with some lounge chairs that were decent, though there are no private balconies on this side of the hotel. The pool on the adult side is decent, but there were kids in it all week (that 'adult' vs. 'family' division in the hotel didn't seem to apply for the week we were there). The food at the Mayan Bistro, for dinner anyway, is mediocre and very overpriced. We paid the same amount for a dinner there as we did for dinner down the block at Yaxche, which was a million times better--one of the best meals we had in Playa. The continental breakfast consisted of stale pastries, toast, coffee and juice. It was a bad breakfast, but you could order decent omelets for only $39 pesos. There was one computer available for checking your email next to the lobby, but it was almost always in use by someone else and it was in a dark, dank buggy corner where you were sure to be eaten alive. The rooms themselves were spotlessly clean but in the hotel area there was a weird smell of sewage that I found very unpleasant. The staff were fine but not overly friendly. The clientele for the week we were there were a mix of mostly European young people and families. The hotel has a good location, only half a block off of 5th Avenue, on the tail end of the International part of Quinta. It's also only a short walk to the Mamitas and Kool beach clubs. As I say, the rooms were really clean and we didn't see a single bug in the room all week. We got a filtered water dispenser and refrigerator for our second room, which was nice. But I didn't find the comparatively lower price of the room worth it. It's definitely a budget hotel, like an Econo Lodge in the US. However the pictures online seemed deceptive--the rooms, at least on the adult side, are small and depressing. People might have had better luck with the 'family' side, I do not know. But I for one would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “value, value, value”
Reviews.Author: HC5984
Reviews.Content: sure it's not on the beach, but that's why you pay half the amount. it is right off 5th in the less busy area. it stays pretty quiet for the most part. there are two separate pools (an adult and kid), the property is a bit of a maze to at first... the third deck has a cool little area to drink a few beers (BYOB) and play cards. the premises is always being tidied up. our toilet seat broke (not cause i'm fat) and without mentioning it to the concierge, it was fixed the next day while we were gone. if your smart enough to check tripadvisor then your smart enough NOT to book excursions through the consierge. don't be afraid of the taxis and bus system! they are a great way to get around on the cheap. while wi-fi was only offered in the lobby AND the mayan bistro (the restaurant connected to the hotel and pool), my wife and i were conveniently placed in room 201. the reason this is important is because we were located just above the mayan bistro and picked up their free wi-fi all week long!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (i'm currently writing this review in my room)... the mayan bistro is underrated; we didn't really check it out til late in the week and wished we would have earlier. happy hour from 4-7 (2 X 1 drinks) and really great dinners. "continental" breakfast was limited to coffee and OJ with fresh pastries and toast. i would have appreciated more selection and self-serve. as a final note, hit up veronica's massage (1 hour, $50 per couple, AMAZING) and maya-xel, both are located on 5th slightly north of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd stay here like visiting a friend's house”
Reviews.Author: 2LsMama
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is the best value in town. It is clean, comfortable, and ideally located just off 5th Av--but on the quieter north end--and just a 5-minute walk to the beach. If you are looking for a fancy resort, this isn't it, but after a day at the beach, Aventura Mexicana feels like home-away-from-home, whether you just want to relax in your room or sit out and enjoy the beautiful garden courtyard. Say hello for us to the friendly, always-helpful staff and tell them we'll see them Next Time!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: coach3415
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from Playa and stayed at the Aventura Mexicana Hotel. The hotel grounds were pristine, the rooms were clean, the staff was friendly, and the location could not be better. I do not know who the previous review is referring to, but we found the restaurant staff to be extremely pleasant and willing to please. Dora, Alex, Susannah, Aldo, and Chef Marco were all outstanding and pleasant. They could not do enough to satisfy you. Luis Ortiz, Antonio, and Jimena at the front desk always greeted you with a hello and a genuine smile. The owners of this hotel should be delighted to know what a great staff they have and we will miss everyone dearly. GMARCH

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: WonderlustCO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Adventura Mexicana for a week while I attended Spanish classes at Solexico. The hotel was wonderful. The rooms were clean, cool, quiet and the hotel is in a great location. The pool was nice too. The employees at the bar/restaurant left something to be desired. At times they were downright rude so we only ate breakfast there. If you are looking for a reasonably priced, nice, quiet hotel in Playa, this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, friendly, convenient and affordable”
Reviews.Author: trigby
Reviews.Content: This charming hotel is very conveniently located a block from Quinta Ave and 2 blocks from the beach. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. We paid a little extra to get the private room, with it's own private sundeck, which was quite nice. Nothing super fancy, but worth the extra money to feel a little pampered and private. Luis, the concierge, was extremely helpful and gave us good advice every step of the way. He managed to organize whatever we needed as far as activities went, which included renting a car, XPLOR and gave us good advice for a day trip to Cozumel. For our first day at the beach, they pointed us towards a beach club that was quite nice and had a pool. The vibe was younger and very friendly. The included breakfast is Mexican/continental, but they do have additional options available for more pesos, in case you're really hungry. The only bad thing I can say is that there is a new hotel across the street with a club that has music going until the wee hours of the morning. This isn't a problem if you're up late or if your room is not near that new hotel, but would be annoying if you were a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: IdahoBeachgirl
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect! Just off of 5th Ave., but no noise. A pleasant 5 min. walk to the best beach/water in Playa. We walked the entire beach to find this out. The attention to detail in the upkeep and cleanliness of the property was excellent. Luis and the entire front desk staff were always ready to answer questions and attend to any needs. Susannah and Alex and the restaurant staff were very friendly and smiling. We also had excellent massages (with Coral) at the hotel. If you're looking for a quality low key and comfortable place (without the glitz), this is the place. We also had a great experience with Blue Caribe snorkling with the turtles and in the cenote. We are hoping to return sooner than later! Thanks to the staff for an excellent stay. We miss you all already! Family from Idaho

Reviews.Title: “THE MOST AWSOME HOTEL WEVE EVER STAYED IN!”
Reviews.Author: larryg25
Reviews.Content: We lucked out finding this hotel. its an oasis in playa, great location quiet and beautifull. the satf was incredible and luis the concierge was awsome. he made us feel right at home and took real good care of all our needs. the hotel is a real gem, very tranquill and clean. the bistro was fantastic, great menu and very affordable. the pool was a perfect and you can go for a late night swim. after partying all nite it was nice to cool down before bed, wich was the most comfy we have slept on in mexico, for some reason the beds in mexico are hard as a rock. so thats one of the reasons we picked this hotel. cant think of any other place we would want to stay in playa. we will defintly stay there again. also the spa has great affordable massages in a very nice setting. we had a great time staying there and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant spot would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: travelhobo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on these reviews and were not disappointed. There were so many to choose from in Playa, it was a tough choice. As soon as we booked we received an email confirmation with a free room upgrade from Superior King to Deluxe. We didn't see what we would have got but the room we were given was on the top floor in the adult section. Always book this area unless you have kids as it's much more spacious. The Kids area is tiny but you can keep an eye on them from your room. The room was huge with great air con and lots of light. There is only a partition to the bathroom and toilet but this didn't bother us. Lots of stairs so not for the unfit. Although we didn't use it the pool area was stunning. Breakfast was fine and the staff were so friendly. Situated in the Italian part of the strip and a nice 5 min walk to the main hub at night. I would highly recommend this to young/old couples or small family.

Reviews.Title: “10 days in paradise”
Reviews.Author: Lindalouj
Reviews.Content: This is a great boutique hotel on Ave 10 & Calle 24. We spent ten days there in May and wish we could have stayed longer! It is so close to everything yet seems so far removed when inside the hotel. Its very private and very well maintained. The staff was wonderful. The Mayan Bistro was a great place to eat. The chef and wait staff were great! The cleaning staff worked very hard to keep the property spotless and the front desk staff was always there to take care of any wants and/or needs. You get discount coupons to Kool Beach Club which was about a 5-7 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel also offers free beach towels for use. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: kanga43
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel, beautiful grounds, well cared for and staff very friendly. Luis very helpful to the two Aussies (and Newcastle United supporter !!!) Thankyou for your humour and your help. Was a lovely stay and hotel in a great position,close to everything. All the staff very friendly, and the barman Luis also makes an awesome cocktail, loved it. Thanks to all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellend hotel with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: corver
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel as it is a highly recommended at tripadvisor, and we we must say: " They are right". This is the place to be, if your are looking for an excellent hotel and great value for your money. We were given a large room on the family side (adult pool). Nice spacious room with all the comfort you need. Quiet, very clean and located in a beautiful garden and swimming pool area. We had booked 10 day`s but stayed one week longer .The staff is very helpful and friendly. They do everything to make you feel comfortable. They will arrange and advice for trips and transportation. Thanks Luis!!! The restaurant is very good, we had good breakfast and good menu`s for very reasonable price. The hotel is in a great location just a few steps from the famous 5th Avenue (but still in a quiet area) and 5 minutes walk from the fantastic beach area. If we go back we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Finndk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the family section of the Aventura Mexicana for a week and I can definitely recommend it. It's completely separate from the adult section and that works very well. The kids pool is right outside the terasse doors, which is very convenient. So is the fact that the hotel is right around the corner from the main stretch, still it's very quiet. The highlight in my opinion, however, is the staff. Particularly the people working in the reception who were the ones we talked to the most. Always helpful and up for a chat. So in short, great place, nice ambience, and very clean as well.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: deepsnows
Reviews.Content: This property was amazing from the moment we walked in to the moment we left. The room and property were spotless, immaculately maintained, and were beautiful. The staff was extremely accomodating and willing to help with everyting.The hotel is quiet and peaceful while close enough to 5th Avenue that shopping, restaurants, etc. are all within easy walking distance (1 block). We also stayed at the Hacienda Paradise while in Playa. The Hacienda Paradise is a very nice property, but in no way is up to the standard of the Aventura Mexicana. A great hotel at a great price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value-Great value”
Reviews.Author: roughcut
Reviews.Content: We booked our 3 week stay from May 1-22/2010 directly through the hotels website. Andy was very attentive to our wants and needs for this vacation. We have done alot of the all-inclusives in the area, but wanted more of a "playa" experience this time. Andy picked out room #1402 for us which is unique for the property. It is a cabana on the second floor with its own private patio area. Since we wanted to prepare a few of our own meals, it also comes equipped with a small fridge, a microwave, coffee maker, water cooler and dishes and utensils for two. It also has a kingsize pillowtop bed, cable tv, safe and plenty of storage/closet space. The washroom has a spacious shower and we never ran out of hot water. The pressure does fluctuate a bit, but was never a real issue. The property has to sides to it. The family side is just beyond the reception area and has its own pool and lounge area. You pass through here to get to the adult side. Which also has its own pool (a little larger than the family side) and also a good sized lounge area. This is also where you will find the free continental breakfast area which is served by the Mayan Bistro. It includes, toast, coffee, juice and a variety of pastries. It is a great place to start your day in the shade of one of the many palms. If you would prefer a full breakfast, that is also available for a very reasonable price. We also enjoyed the club sandwiches and cheeseburgers for lunch. The burgers were especially delicious, great flavour and the meat seemed to actually melt in your mouth...if that's possible. The best meals that we had at the Bistro though were the dinners. Marco the Italian chef, definately knows his stuff. The presentation was very professional and we never had a bad meal. We especially enjoyed the chilles relleno (stuffed Poblano chiles) The prices were some of the lowest we paid while dining in the area and the ambience in the evening is very lush and relaxing. It would be a mistake to not dine @ the Mayan Bistro on your next trip to Playa, even if you stayed somewhere else! The grounds at the AM are always kept up nicely and the staff are always busy keeping up the obvious high standards of the owners. One of the best amenities of the hotel though has to be the main concierge, Luis Ortiz. Luis always will acknowledge all the guests as they pass through the reception area, a nice touch. He is quick to give advice, book a tour or share a joke with you. We found out that the love of his life is fond of carrots. So when you meet him, ask him about his [--]....I mean his donkey. I think its name in Johanna......or no, maybe that's his girlfriends name. I'm not quite sure anymore. Luis speaks perfect english....at least he thinks so! He claims to know a little Italian, spanish or course and also a little german. But that's only when he's drunk. Prosssttttt !! But seriously Luis is one of the diamonds in this hidden gem. He even agreed to distribute the toys that we brought down for some of the under priveledged kids in the area. We didn't get the chance to do it ourselves this time. Thanks for everything Luis! We feel that you wouldn't go wrong by giving the Aventura Mexicana a try during your next trip to paradise. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel Close to 5th Avenue”
Reviews.Author: Arubamasc
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven-night stay at the Aventura Mexicana. This hotel is a very good option for the budget-minded traveler looking to be close to the offerings of 5th Avenue. Rooms at the property are basic, but very clean. Bed was slightly firm, but comfortable. Our room (superior king) came furnished with a king-size bed, two nightstands, two chairs, a small table, dresser, microwave, coffee maker and flat panel television. The room also had two ceiling fans. The bathroom, as mentioned in previous reviews, did not have a door and was only partially private. Not an issue for us, but be advised. Air conditioning worked well. Our room was always very cool. My only 'complaint' concerning the room was the chairs. They looked old, a bit dirty and in need of replacement; they did not look like they belong in an otherwise modern and clean space. Management mentioned they read these reviews for suggestions...perhaps consider replacing these chairs in the future, as they can detract from the overall asthetic of the room. The grounds of the hotel, as well as the pools, are well maintained. The floral plantings give a beautiful tropical feel to the property; colorful and cheerful. The on-site restaurant, Mayan Bistro offers continental breakfast daily (included in the cost of the room), serving coffee, orange juice, toast with various spreads and assorted pastries. Menu options are available for as little as $4 USD. The waitstaff were very helpful and pleasant! The restaurant is also open for lunch and dinner, and offers 2 for 1 drinks from 4 - 7 p.m., daily. Ask the bartender, Luis, to make one of his original beverage creations for you - you will not be disappointed. Several beach clubs are within walking distance of the hotel. We discovered Wicky's, on 10th, to be a good option for us 40-somethings. A wonderful, relaxed atmosphere. Beach loungers are free of charge, provided each guest satisfies a $100 peso charge for food and beverage (easy enough to do). Staff comes throughout the day, offering slices of fresh fruit and cold towels (free of charge). If we return to PdC, we would certainly consider staying at this property again. Thanks to Luis, the concierge, Luis, the bartender, and Maria and Alejandra at the Mayan Bistro for a terrific stay.

Reviews.Title: “Third Times still a CHARM!”
Reviews.Author: playasuzi
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed her for the 3rd time in a year. All in you all, you can't beat it. The comfort, the space inside of your room and out, the people who work there, the cat, the pool and the Mayan Bistro, the restaurant. The comfort: Beds are awesome. Temperature in room is perfect. The space: We've stayed in 3 diferent kinds of rooms there and they are all nice. Even the the smaller rooms have space, character and comfort to keep you happy. The people: The receptionists at the front desk are genuine....feel like family. The cat: Olivia. She's perfect. Nice cat who's about 13 years old who lives there. When you stay here, make sure you feed her moist /wet food since she only has few teeth. She is so sweet, we feel like she is ours when we are there. :) The pool: Perfect. The water is crystal clear and warm. The pool is big, not like other pools I've seen in boutique hotels. Last but not least, the secret hidden charm of the place: The Mayan Bistro. This hidden little gem is an awesome restaurant. They start so early in the morning with a quaint outside (or inside) setting for breakfast and then go throughout the day and then at night with the really pretty lights on, its perfect. Not to mention the perfect food that Chef Marco will make you. You gotta try the food here.

Reviews.Title: “Playa's Finest!”
Reviews.Author: PlayaBum1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for 2 weeks, with 2 young children and LOVED it! The pools are awesome and were cleaned constantly. The staff was all AMAZING! The breakfast offered daily is wonderful, as was everything we ordered off of the menu in the Mayan Bistro. Any request we had was immediately addressed. The concierge was also really helpful and kind. I will absolutely stay with the Aventura Mexicana in the future. The kitty that lives there is adorable and friendly! She hung out in our room almost every night. The hotel is quiet, even on the ground floor. Our room was one of the 6 that surround the "kid" pool and was so convenient. The kids could easily run in and out, grab a snack, get a different toy, etc... and we didn't have to constantly run back and forth with them, since we could see them from the loungers, or the pool! It was also great for afternoon naps. The adults could stay outside and read, lounge, whatever, and it was fine, because we could still see the room. My only issue is the free computer for guests to use was broken the whole time and not replaced or repaired, and the pillows were a little flat... otherwise, perfection in Playa!

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd Stay at the Aventura”
Reviews.Author: mtl_habs_fan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last November and just got back from another 10 night stay. There have been a few changes since the winter, like the addition of a PR guy in the lobby who was friendly and knowledgable and there is no longer a public computer which was dissapointing as it really came in handy when we were planning our days but we found an internet cafe just 2 blocks away that charged 20 pesos for 30 minutes which was fine. They also have new lounge chairs which were nice for hanging out by the pool. Last time we had been upgraded but the hotel seemed to be pretty busy so we had a standard room this time. I knew the walls of the bathroom didn't go up to the ceiling however I was pretty surprised to see there is no door on the bathrooms in these rooms. Makes for very little privacy but we made it work. The safe in the standard room was also different from the deluxe rooms. Our safe was small and plastic and had a key. I prefer the ones in the deluxe rooms that are very heavy steel and have to combo. The bed in this room was 100 times more comfortable than the last one... it was a different style bed frame and it had a sealy mattress top. If you are worried about noise request a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor. Our window faced 10th avenue and although it wasn't super loud you could definitely hear cars going by. The food was great and the continental breakfast is sufficient. The staff was friendly and the hotel itself is very clean and beautiful. The location is in the very up and coming north end of town and suits us just fine. Very close to beach access and clubs and amazing restaurants and bars. (Try the 2X1 mojitos at La Hora Feliz on 5th about 2 blocks to your left when leaving the hotel and El Diaz for the best steak right near by). All in all it was a great stay and we're looking to go back in November.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal.”
Reviews.Author: Voidman
Reviews.Content: This is a great deal for an excellent hotel. We were given a very large room on the family side. It was also very clean. If we stayed again we would probably stay on the adult pool side due to some kid related noise in the mornings. The restaurant is OK. The free breakfast isn't the best, we didn't try the other things on the menu. The hotel is in a great location and seemed pretty safe. The only problem we had was our door not shutting properly. It sometimes would seem shut, but would swing open again. We had an experience when we went in to the room and didn't realize the door was wide open behind us. This seemed to happen to our neighbors as well. We could hear their shower running, and their door was wide open. Just make sure you keep pulling on it until it clicks. Overall we were very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience”
Reviews.Author: Darrin-Sylvie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 5 days at Aventura Mexicana for the last part of our honeymoon. We wanted to take some tours and relax. Aventura Mexicana was the perfect place for us. The hotel is clean, quiet, private and beautiful. The staff is really pleasant and very professional. The Mayan Bistro (restaurant on site) offers delicious breakfast. The continental breakfast can use some fresh fruit but the pastry served compensate a little bit for it. We both loved their coffee! Located by a the famous 5th avenue, AM provides easy access to a great shopping area, diverse restaurants and quiet area of the beach. We had good tours recommendations from the concierge desk. He organized everything for us, even book the taxi for our trip back to Cancun. Their spa offers decent massages. The adult pool isn't big enough to exercise but it is refreshing and very private. In general, we would totally go back!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet restful space”
Reviews.Author: DDfromSF
Reviews.Content: We were here 8 nights, 2 couples in 2 rooms, and recommend it. Great location on 24th Street, just half a block from 5th Avenue, which is the main promenade for restaurants and shops. The beach is a few blocks away, but this wasn't too bad. We liked the beach clubs down by 6th to 10th Streets better anyway. The blocks are short, so it's a quick walk anywhere. The hotel is very clean, the staff is very friendly, helpful, and most speak English well. The rooms are spacious, the beds comfortable, the water is purified. The bathrooms are open, which is different, but not a problem for us. There is a separate adult pool in the wing closest to the restaurant. They seem to put couples in this wing, and families in the wing around the main pool, which makes things quieter! The in-house restaurant isn't very busy, but don't let that scare you off. We had dinner there one night and the food was excellent. We also had the continental breakfast there every morning. Only problem was that we (four adults) had taken a car service from the airport to the hotel, riding in a Suburban. We wanted to get a similar ride back. My husband speaks fluent Spanish, so he thought the concierge knew what we wanted. Instead we got a little taxi. These are OK to squeeze into for short hops around town, but not for the 45 minute ride to the airport. We should have taken the taxi to the ADO bus station and caught the airport shuttle from there.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect experience!!”
Reviews.Author: HughesMstar
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and as I commented a couple of months ago, it just keeps getting better and better. I had breakfast at the restaurant, great prices, good food. I had one of the "suites" near the restaurant, it was wonderful with a kitchenette, couches, great TV and a comfy bed. Some of their beds can be a bit hard, so if you aren't comfortable be sure and let them know and they will fix it. These people are professional, responsive, friendly and it is a great experience from the time you walk in to the time you leave. They really go the extra mile!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “more than expectations”
Reviews.Author: MontrealDiscerning
Reviews.Content: this was my second stay at the hotel (feb 2009 previous) and on my return to playa del carmen, this hotel was my first and only choice. it did exceed expectations and turned out to be a real gem again. well located, close to activities and yet quiet enough for a laid back peaceful holiday. the staff were helpful and friendly, always a smiling face, they gave me a feeling of sincere appreciation.i did feel welcome as a few of the staff from last year extended thier "nice to see you again" . the restaurant is underrated and yet to be discovered ,right price and good quality (thank you chef marco) thank you, del davies, montreal canada

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Mandersandnater
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Playa del Carmen with 33 of our closest friends and family for our wedding celebration. Everyone stayed at Hotel Aventura Mexicana thanks to a great deal on rooms for the large party. I began reviewing hotels on tripadvisor and then sending out emails to the hotel managers. Hotel Aventura Mexicana was more than happy to accommodate our party with very reasonable rates. Any question I had or email I sent was immediately answered in a timely fashion, in a very professional manner. When we arrived, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. They helped us to our spacious, very clean and pretty rooms. The rooms were not fancy, but they were clean and pretty. One warning is that the single king bed rooms were very nice, but the bathroom walls don't go all the way to the ceiling, so you can hear (and smell) everything that's going on. But the rooms with two beds had "normal" bathrooms. The hotel was very quiet and peaceful for being right off of the main drag- 5th Avenue. It truly felt like an oasis when we walked in after being out in the town or on a tour. Not only was it quiet with reference to the location, but it was also very quiet and peaceful at any time of the day. The pretty, peaceful gardens and pools are very nice, but the lounge chairs are limited. The beach is a five minute walk away, and the hotel has coupons for $1 off the chairs at Kool Beachclub, which our party took full advantage of for our relaxing times on the beach. The hotel's location was perfect for us. We enjoyed walking on 5th Avenue to find different places to eat and drink farther down the road, but there were many good shops and restarurants within a block of the hotel also. The hotel provided a continental breakfast, which consisted of a lot of bread and pasteries, and the main menu was available to order a wonderful fruit, yogurt and granola dish, or eggs in many yummy ways. The fish tacos at the hotel restaurant were some of the best we had the entire time in Playa! Everyone seemed to enjoy the food, and the servers got used to us and warmed up. They always gave great service! I love coffee, and I thought the coffee at the hotel was the best I had the entire trip! The staff treated us like family by the end of the week. They were so very accommodating and helpful and wonderful. The concierge, Luis couldn't have been more helpful with any directions, restaurant recommendations, and tours. He went above and beyond the call of duty to help me with hair appointments, pedicure appointments, and even finding a place to get my dress pressed. He was so wonderful, friendly, and helpful! Hotel Aventura Mexicana felt like a home away from home for us, and we are so excited to go back and visit our family again!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: Nikast
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 10 metres off fifth avenue, it is a short walk to the beach with the well known Mamitas Beach and Kool Beach Club (Discount provided by hotel for a beach chair). To the 12th Avenue with all the Clubs and Bars the walk is approximately 5 minutes. The location is ideal. The service is perfect, I travel a lot and nearly never had such a clean room! The hotel itself is really nice with 3 small pools and lots of green. The rooms are comfortably big and held in white which gives a friendly atmosphere, cable TV is provided, unfortunately CNN is only in Spanish but therefore you have Wifi for free. The breakfast is continental (toast and marmelade) but eggs can be ordered for around 40 pesos, which doesn't kill the budget. I would always book this hotel again if you are looking for a really nice location off one of the resorts in the city!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLori
Reviews.Content: I stayed a week with my teen daughter, cleanliness is very important to both of us. This hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. It was very well maintained, pleasantly decorated and furnished. The location was perfect, close enough to the beach and night life to walk, but just off the main street enough to be quiet. Hotel and restaurant service was always smiling and great, not only spoke english but willing to help us with our Spanish. Can't say enough, the pictures don't do it justice. It was GREAT, Wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great staff and more than a bargain!”
Reviews.Author: mama924
Reviews.Content: I chose Aventura Mexicana because of it's reviews, grounds, proximity to Fifth Avenue and the the fact that we prefer the northern, more quieter end of Fifth, and it's quaintness. We are not fans of Mega resorts or all inclusives and this hotel fit the bill perfectly. The hotel is spotless clean, with well maintained grounds and landscaping. The pools, although small were adequate enough for a dip after the beach or sunbathing on the sundeck which we utilized after a day at the beach since there are tables and chairs as well as loungers. Our balcony was small so this area helps if you want to relax with a drink and a snack before getting ready for any evening out on the town. Our room (1301) was a deluxe king and had a view of the beautiful grounds. The room was of a decent size with the most comfy pillow top king bed. There was plenty of closet and shelf space for our clothing, cable TV with American shows, a microwave, mini fridge, water cooler, dishes, fork, spoons, knives, and a couple of chairs. It was spotless clean everyday. The bathroom is as everyone states, no real door in the toilet area so if you are modest this is not the place for you. After 28 years modestly flew out the window for us! We stayed on the adult side so I cannot say if the family rooms have doors. There is a room on the ground floor, adult side, room 1401 that has a bigger sitting area and a door to the bathroom. This used to be their Jr. Suite but is now considered a deluxe king and you must request this room at time of booking. If it's available you will get it. It's the only one so I would imagine you need to book well in advance to get it. There is a nice restaurant on the grounds of the hotel and they offer free continental breakfast of croissants and sweet buns, white and whole grain toast with a choice of butter and jams, coffee, juice and water. More than enough for us as we are not big breakfast eaters. There is a breakfast menu available and I saw some great looking omelettes being served. They also offer one free glass of wine during your stay which you can get during happy hour. The happy is very good as well with 2 for 1 drinks, very inexpensive, especially compared to NYC prices! Towels are issued for the pool or beach and discounts for a chair at Kool are also provided. All in all, this is a lovely hotel especially for it's low price. You cannot go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Deal in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: alfie828
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Hotel Aventura and it was just as we expected based on the reviews here. I'll review by category: Rooms: Clean, comfy and roomy enough. Drawback was the bathroom not having a wall that extended to the ceiling or door to close, but we read that here and expected that. Was no big deal. Shower had great pressure! Only negative was the pillows on the bed were small and very flat. But hey, for $105 per night, who cares! Staff: Everyone was friendly and helpful. Louis at the front desk even gave my husband a computer cable we needed free of charge. That's service! Food: Breakfast was included and was good. Rolls, juice and coffee. We ate at the on-site Bistro there and had a great meal at night. All I can say is don't hesitate...this really is a great deal and close to everything (beach, shpping, food) but still very quiet and quaint. Free WI-FI which is a great deal. My husband used his laptop on the roof and still got reception. We will go back! Oh, they had $25 massages and were awesome! Just as good as a upscale spa!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place with very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: thvid
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with a 3 yrs old child for 15 days. Had an excellent time. Very cosy and nice hotel. Beautyfull garden & nice pools. Although placed centrally we had no trouble with traffic noise. Close to Av. 5 and in walking distance to the beach. Surely this is a recommendable hotel :-) With free wireless internet.But are you uncomfortable with having no door to the bathroom - then you should not stay. Only for people close enough to accept bathing and doing personal hygiene without doors...

Reviews.Title: “We will be back next year!”
Reviews.Author: AbbyLouis
Reviews.Content: Very clean rooms, the best service, great Bistro within the confines of the hotel complex, don't have to leave the complex, you can just lay around the pools or hot tub and sunbath or relax. We had no problems with language barrier with any of the staff and they are very accommodating with all of our questions. We miss the happy atmosphere between the staff members, miss the flowers and beauty of the complex. We will be back next year again, now if we could. We come home to Saskatoon Sask. to snow, some dirty snow and no leaves on the trees or flowers, so pretty bleak compared to the beauty in Playa Del Carmen. Thank you for the great holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, a must stay in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Lotty79
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel! I don´t think I have ever given anywhere a 5/5, but this place well deserves it. I stayed here for 5 nights, on my own in-between volunteer projects in Mexico in Oct 2009. As I was on my own I was a bit worried to begin with, but soon realised it was a safe hotel. I was given a ground-floor room, which I don’t usually like because patio doors are very easy to get open. However, there are always plenty of staff members walking around and it really feels safe. The rooms are big, nice and clean, as are the bathrooms. The only minor complain I can think of is that the walls are rather thin, and for 2 nights I had noisy neighbours, but that is hardly the hotels fault. My patio door opened up to the pool area, it’s been very well designed boutique style hotel. There are two small pools in the hotel, and it is surrounded by beautiful grounds that are really well maintained. The complementary breakfast is served in their restaurant/bar and was very good, they try to get you to order some eggs as well or something extra off the menu, but it’s up to you. They have computer with internet access which you can use free of charge for 30 mins a day. It was really handy, but obviously some people abuse the free usage and spend a lot longer on there than they should. The hotel isn’t in the main part of Playa Del Carmen, but is a good 15-20 minute walk away. This said it’s nice and quiet and very near to the strip of shops, restaurants and bars along the way to the main part of PDC. (By main part I mean the harbour where you get the ferry to Cozumel and the main ADO bus station. It’s an easy walk to a few good supermarkets and the other ADO bus station.) It is about 2 blocks away from Mamitas beach. I’m going back to Mexico in October this year, and will definitely go back to Aventura Mexicana.

Reviews.Title: “very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: piscado
Reviews.Content: the staff was great. I'm a 70 yr. old recent widow, this was 1st. time I traveled by myself to Mex. they were terrific to me. close to main restaurants, food was good at hotel too. Alma { masseuse} was great!! $25 for an hr. I went twice

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel/grounds with great/inexpensive food and close to 5th Avenue shoppng.”
Reviews.Author: Hatlady12
Reviews.Content: My spouse, sister and her husband stayed 5 nights in early February. We found the Hotel to be exactly what we had researched on the Internet. The grounds were beautiful and the food was excellent, as well as reasonably priced. The rooms were very spacious and the towels were large and thick. The staff was courteous and accommodating. One of the rooms required brighter lighting next to the bed (for reading), and the staff immediately resolved our problem. Our only complaint was that many of the sundeck lounges were broken to the point where you could lie down but could not sit up on them because the notches were broken. We brought this to their attention and they immediately removed them; however, we were never provided with replacements. WI-FI is available throughout the grounds if you bring your own laptop. One computer is povided but was in use most of the time. The Hotel has 3 levels with outside access and no elevators. If you have any problems with steps, you'll want to request a room on the ground floor. We were within minutes of walking distance to 5th Avenue shopping, restaurants and nightlife. We did not utilize the gym or the beach, but we walked the short distance to the beach just to check it out. We were extremely happy with our stay here and would highly recommend the Aventura Mexicana. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “a very good time in Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: suede2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I enjoyed our stay here- second time in Playa del Carmen, first time in Aventura Mexicana. We did not see any point in paying high-end hotels, considering you spend most of the time outside, in tours or on the beach. The staff very is helpful. Even Jorje from the travel agency was very kind and helpful, even though we didn't book any tours with him. The hotel is very clean and beautiful, there are gardens and pools all around. Our room (superior king on the first floor next to the pool) was fine, clean but a bit damp. Noise from the street was very slight, so hardly an issue at all. The A/C was good in cooling the room quickly, but didn't keep it dry (hence the dampness. our clothes and swimsuits could only dry outside). The continental breakfast was ok (too bad the orange juice isn't freshly squeezed). Only complaint here is that it took a long time to get everything, sometimes even over 20 minutes (and that's just for the coffee, juice, toasts and jams). We ordered from the menu twice, and it was tasty. Also ate at the Mayan Bistro one night, good food. We suggest trying the local food (near the Mega there are some good restaurants), which is also cheaper. The hotel is very close to the beach and avenida 5, the perfect location in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “The Adventura Mexicana is an absolutely WONDERFULLY delightful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: terrill
Reviews.Content: Myself and daughter spent 7 days in Playa Del Carmen at the Adventura Mexicana hotel and were extremely impressed with its great staff, cleanliness, security and food! We decided that we didn't want to go to an "all inclusive resort" because we wanted to go on alot of tours and felt the added expense of going "all inclusive" was not cost effective. We spent the extra money it would have cost going to a high end resort....on tours! With the added bonus every night we ate at many extremely taste restaraunts on 5th Ave. On our first day we took the ferry over to Cozemel and hired a taxi driver to take us on a complete tour of the island. Stopping at a small restaraunt and ate an amazing seafood platter! The food was very fresh and tasty, along with the beautiful view of the ocean, the sound of the waves and friendly service! The second day we went to Xel Ha....not a tour guided one. Which for us was perfect, as we spent lots of time snorkling and swimming. Xel Ha is a wonderful natural water park with lots of things to do and see. Cliff jumping, rafting through the mangroves and down the river, hiking, lounging and a great buffet to eat at! Don't miss this place if you want lots of water fun, the snorkling is great, you'll love it. Day three we went to Xcaret, we orginally planned on not going here. Because we thought it would be alot like Xel Ha...It's not at all the same. It is beautiful lots of walking, parrots, flamigos, rivers to snorkle or raft, caves, tunnels, ruins, humourous Mexican cemetary, scenery and the most amazing evening show. Don't miss going here...make sure to wear comfortable shoes! Day four we went on "Tulum and Beyond tour" with Yucatrek tours! They are a fanastic tour group. First we went to Tulum and toured the ruins for 1 1/2 hours, then to "Grand Cenote" for a refreshing swim, then to a ocean beach to play in the waves while our tour guides made us a shore lunch, then we went swimming in another cenote before returning to our hotel. Great relaxing day!!! A fantastic tour with Yucatrek tours, would for sure do this tour again!! Day five we went on the "Coba Mayan Encounter tour" first we stopped at the Coba ruins for a couple hours, here we had the chance to climb to the top of the Yuctan Pennisulia's highest pyrimid! Wow, what a sight from the top. Then we went to a Mayan village and treked into the jungle a mile or more on very uneven rock terrain. Then rappelled 50 ft down into a cenote, the zip lined, had an autentic Mayan dinner. This was a Very exciting tour and I don't think I would have wanted to be much older to have done it! Not for the faint of heart or physically challenged, as far as I'm concerned! Day five was a horse back riding at Rancho Baaxal, we rode through the jungle and on the ocean beach. It was a good tour and the horse seemed to have been looked after quite well! After the horse back riding we went to Dolphin Discovery to swim with the Dolphins. We were quite disappointed that we actually only spend 30 or so minutes in the water with the Dolphins! And that when we went to buy the pictures, especailly of the "Foot Push" that they didn't sell that picture like all the rest. If we wanted the "Foot Push" picture we had to buy the c.d for another $50.00. I would advise anyone interested in swimming with the Dolphins to look else where. Each day we were picked up either at the hotel or very close by between 7 -8 in the morning and dropped off between 6 -7 at night. I can't say enough good about the Hotel, cleanliness and Wonderful staff! I would go back to the Hotel Aventura Mexicana ina "Heart Beat" , great location, fanastic Mayan Bistro cafe and wonderful massage staff also!!! Plus the added pleasure of english speaking staff, that arrange our tours, needs and transportation to and from the airport!! This was an absolute perfect hotel for us, thank you staff of the Mexicana for the wonderful time and memories of Playa Del Carman!! Sandy Syrjanen, Nipawin, Saskatchewan, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, friendly and clean...a great little hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Lilly003
Reviews.Content: Traveling with my sister to Playa del Carmen and what attracted us to the Aventura Mexican were all the good reviews we read. For a budget hotel we weren't dissapointed at all...friendly staff, a few blocks from the beach and just off 5th Avenue. The room was spottless as were all other areas of this small hotel. Pools were rather small but just right for cooling off while sunbathing at the hotel, but who needs pools with a beautiful beach so near. The breakfast included in the room price was served in the Mayan Bistro each morning and consisted of toast, juice, coffee and an array of delicious pastries. Were we to visit Playa del Carmen again, I think we would chose the Aventura Mexicana.

Reviews.Title: “A little breath of heaven in the heart of the City.”
Reviews.Author: LorrettaJ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was even better than the photos on the internet. The grounds were beautiful and well kept, the hotel very conveniently located but still quiet and the service was excellent. It would have been nice if at least one of the pools had been heated.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: AnneyZ
Reviews.Content: We are leaving Hotel Aventura Mexicana today after having been here for six days. We had a wonderful time and are so sorry to go! The staff, in particular, is helpful, kind and courteous. The hotel itself is spotless. We had a basic double. Our room was spacious, although a bit dark, clean and comfortable. We had a fridge in the room in which we kept bottled water and various leftovers. We had a balcony, but it overlooked the street, so we didn't use it. The hotel has two small-ish pools. One is on the "family side" and the other is for adults only. My four and one-half year old son greatly enjoyed playing in the family pool and in the hot tub (that is hot in name only). The grounds are beautiful, lush and green. Included in the price of the room was a basic continental breakfast. Perfectly fine. The hotel has a great location! Literally a five minute walk to either Mamitas or Kool beach clubs. The hotel has a 10 peso discount for the plastic beach chairs at Kool. The hotel is located on 24th street between 5th and 10th avenues, a perfect location for wandering. Best of all, the hotel staff is super friendly and helpful. We felt well taken care of and can't wait to come again!

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: carolgened
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a great location, easy parking, and a fabulous staff. They were friendly, accomodating and very knowledgeable about Playa and beyond. The courtyard, with its palm trees and pools, is just beautiful and a great place to relax with a book or drink - or both. It feels secluded and uncrowded. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody - families, singles or whomever. We would definitely return without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aventura Mexicana puts the guest first.”
Reviews.Author: tmeltz
Reviews.Content: We had two problems here which were promptly solved-Upon arrival, our room had a musty odor which we put up with for one night and then asked for a room change-the request was cheerfully and promptly answered; our new room was great. Midway thru the week, the air conditioner leaked all over the floor. Within 30 minutes after asking for help, a maintenance man arrived (at 10 p.m.) and fixed the problem. The landscaping on the grounds is impeccable and the place has a very relaxing atmosphere. You can tell that management is intent on providing excellent service here. Location is great-close to beaches and fifth avenue. We would return-the value is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: eeast
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent ten days at the Aventura Mexicana over the Christmas holiday. We enjoyed EVERYTHING---location, cleanliness, service, hospitality. Great place at an amazing price! We will be returning in April.

Reviews.Title: “Really great place, nice people and location!”
Reviews.Author: Belizeangirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aventura Maya for 3 nights and we absolutely loved it. The room #31 on the third floor was spacious with a king size bed, hot & cold shower, and view of the pool. The bed was very comfortable, the AC worked great as well as the hot water. The service was great! Very good receptionist, the food at the restaurant is amazing! we loved the fish meals at the restaurant. We especially enjoyed the location,-just about a block away from 5th Avenue where you find bars, restaurants, stores etc. The continental breakfast was great! All in all we had a great time especially because our hotel was on a great location and we slept well every night.

Reviews.Title: “Fun stay at Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: beachbums2Houston_TX
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel in a great location. Our room was very comfortable and included TV, radio, fridge, coffee maker, blow drier, toiletries, etc. The room was cleaned promptly every day. The maid service will not disturb your room as long as you have the "do not disturb" sign on your sliding glass door. As soon as you turn it over to "please make up room", they will clean right away. The hotel staff are friendly and very helpful. We had no noise issues at all during our stay. The hotel has 2 small pools, as mentioned in previous reviews. We only used the adult pool, as it was close to our room, and the nicer of the 2 pools, in my opinion. Pools are open 24 hours, which is nice if you want a late swim. Wear your shoes around the pool chairs because of the small landscape rocks. Not sure why they have rocks there, but they are not bare feet friendly. There is a resturant and bar on site called the Mayan Bistro. I think the specialty is Italian. Basic continental breakfast is included with room, which was fine. Wo ordered breakfast from the menu once, and it was very good. We did not eat any other meals there, so I cannot comment on that. The hotel is beautifully maintained, and in a great location. You can walk anwyhere in town easily. The Mamitas and Kool beach clubs are about a 10 minute liesure walk. Both nice beaches. The hotel offers a discount for Kool beach club, but I think it is only a small $1.00 coupon. No matter because the cost for chairs and shade is very reasonable. We met several people while staying at the hotel who also loved the hotel and were enjoying their stay. Second stay for one couple we talked with. We would stay here again and we would recommend our freinds and family to stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret of Playa”
Reviews.Author: lifelongtraveler44
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel half a block off the pedestrian street is incredible value. The gardens and pools were beautiful and restful. The rooms were large, attractive, quiet and comfortable. The continental breakfast served in a beautiful courtyard/restaurant included in the price was ample: as many pastries, toast, juice and coffee as you like. The employees were all very friendly and helpful. We walked about 2 1/2 blocks to the beach (bring beach towels from the hotel) where the hotel has an agreement with a beach club. We were walking distance from the Mega supermarket and ATM on Ave Constituyentes. There was a fridge in our room so we kept it stocked with bottled water and juice. The tourist restaurants along Ave 5 were expensive and nothing special but there were many excellent places to eat local food along Ave Constituyentes and Ave 30. We went back many times to El Fogon on Ave Constituyentes, and Acavera, Luncheria Dona Mary, and La Vaquita around the corner on Ave 30. We rented a car so that we could explore the Yucatan. AM provided us with free parking. The internet connection was slow but adequate for checking email every few days. We enjoy traveling to other countries to experience the local culture. AM allowed us to avoid the international corporation experience of the resort hotels and get to know the local culture as well as the gorgeous beaches of Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed”
Reviews.Author: SirLoin
Reviews.Content: There was a lot like about this hotel. The layout is really unique with many courtyards and alcoves, all well appointed and landscaped. The hotel has many twists, turns, and staircases leading to other floors and deck areas. If you don't like climbing stairs be sure to get a room on the bottom floor. There were 2 pools. They have a restaurant and bar. The food wasn't fancy but it was very good. The WiFi signal was strong enough to make it all the way to my room on the 3rd floor even though it wasn't supposed to have that kind of range. They offer onsite massage. This is by far my favorite hotel in PDC and I have tried quiet a few.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: aiyahvn
Reviews.Content: The good: * Nice, attentative staff who are willing to go above and beyond to meet your needs * Clean, neat rooms with standard accommondations * Close to 5th Ave, but quiet * Free parking and computer with internet access * A really cute cat will come by and stalk you every once in a while The drawbacks: * Some hot-water equipment in our building broke down on our second night of stay, so for 3 days, we had to walk across to the other side of the hotel and take showers in a different room * Wi-Fi didn't work, so the only way to get on the internet was to use hotel's desktop in the lobby(no AC), which means you would be browsing the net in sweat while feeding hungry mosquitos Bottom line: You can't compare this nice little boutique hotel with the fancy all-inclusive resorts nearby. However, this place does offer good value. And if you're looking for a place to stay at night while going on excursions in the daytime, Aventura Mexicana will be a great choice!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a reasonable cost”
Reviews.Author: ThomasM_9
Reviews.Content: Clean and large rooms, excellent location close to the beach and Avenida no 5. Friendly staff and free wifi connection. Quite small swimming pools and simple pool area, but who cares when you have caribbean sea 200 meters away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful clean, quiet, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yukatan
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Aventura Mexicana for 14 nights mid to late August 2009, with 3 kids, 8 and 10 year old boys and a 14 year old girl. We had two rooms with two double beds that had a connecting door, which was a fantastic setup for us. Each room had a little fridge (great to keep water and snacks cool) and a small balcony. Our rooms were right above the small family pool, which was great, as we could sit on the balcony while our kids went down to the pool. Cannot praise this hotel enough. Everyone was super-friendly and helpful. The maid, Rosy, kept our rooms very clean and did some great towel art work (never knew you could shape towels into dinosaurs, caterpillars, babies, you name it!). Our kids were deligthed to find new towel art every day! Breakfast was fine; you have a choice of coffee, orange juice, toast, butter, jam, honey, and danishes, or you can order off the menu (omelett etc. around 40 pesos, less than 4 dollars). All waitresses were super nice and tried to teach our kids Spanish - thanks Rosalia, Yolibeth, and Maria for making our vacation so nice! The pools are small, but big enough for a quick dip in the evening. With the Caribbean so close (less than 5 min walk to the best beach in Playa), who wants to sit next to the pool all day anyway?
