They are set in a pretty, lush, tropical garden. Also, you can pick up new beach towels at the reception every day, which you can take to the beach or excursions. The location of the hotel is perfect. You're on busy 5th Avenue in a couple minutes, yet it is off the track enough to be quiet and restful. We have stayed in other hotels in Playa before where you could hear partying till the early hours - but no such issue at the Aventura. We would highly recommend this hotel, it's perfect for a relaxing beach vacation or as a "base of operations" for further excursions in the Yucatan. This area has so much to offer and is so beautiful, that I'm sure we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Hesitate, Just Book It!”
Reviews.Author: search4sol
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend, now fiance, and I stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for a week at the end of June. We had a great time in Playa and even got engaged on the beach south of Tulum. Our stay at the hotel was wonderful. I'm not sure what category of room we had, but it was perfect for us. We had a sofa in a sitting area, a small kitchenette, a king size bed, a bathroom with a door, bottled water to drink etc... The best part of this hotel is it's staff. They really want to make your stay comfortable. We contacted them before our arrival with a few questions and concerns, and they took care of everything. (Thanks Andy!) The location is perfect. It is close to the beach, and 5th Av. but there aren't any noisy bars or disco's keeping you up at night. The small pool was perfect for lounging around when you want some sun, but don't want to go to the beach. We would never stay at a hotel in Mexico without a pool. Overall we would return in a heartbeat. I don't think you can find a better deal in Playa if you are looking for a small, quiet, boutique type hotel. If you have any concerns about this hotel, call, or email them. They will be more than happy to help you with your vacation plans. You won't be sorry. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Close to the beach, and priced perfectly”
Reviews.Author: collado_23
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aventura Mexicana in August. It was a perfect stay for us. We were close to the beach and right off 5th avenue. The hotel was quiet, rooms were large and comfortable. The hotel also booked several trips for us which worked out really well. If you want to stay at a nice little boutique type hotel, close to the beach, and very close to 5th avenue but with a resort type look to it...look no further than Hotel Aventura Mexicana. I'm quite sure you'll have a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: BoSox81
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel. The staff is always friendly and helpful, the rooms are very clean and nice, and the restaurant was surprisingly very good - dinner was fantastic. This was my second stay at Aventura and it was as equally good as the first time. Highly recommended and I will be back for another visit next year.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful small hotel”
Reviews.Author: teinertone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 20th wedding anniversary. Super clean rooms, beautiful grounds, pretty little hotel. Great location for us. One block off 5th and about 6 blocks to beach. Reliable phone booth and convenience store half block away on 10th. Ate at many restaurants on 5th and all were good. Best restaurant was Manolo Cappelli, an Argentine steak/seafood restaurant. Staff at hotel was friendly and helpful. So glad we found this place. Price was great, hotel was definitely above our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: Vikingolatino
Reviews.Content: A true paradise tucked away, so close to the beaches and the nightlife, yet quiet on a side street. All was perfect with a fantastic staff and restaurant. Deluxe King room was all excellent for the price of $95 per night, which included continental breakfast. Lush gardens, the adult only little pool, and Alma's fantastic professional massage ($30/hr!!!) only added to the "home away from home" feel. The room even had a FREE drinking water dispenser in the room and FREE wireless internet!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: armanicoco
Reviews.Content: A friend and I had stayed at Hotel Cielo prior to coming here and we had wished we stayed here the whole time. Cielo was cute and all, but this place really felt more like an oasis. It is not on the main strip but only a block away, which was nice. The grounds were very nice and the rooms were clean. They also have a pool and restaurant with outdoor seating. We only stayed for 3 nights, but it was a good deal. They have one computer in the lobby with free internet. The location was also good. It was not too noisy, but walk a few blocks and you are near all the action. Sadly, although this has nothing to do with the hotel, I think I should mention that my purse was almost stolen, but thanks to the help of 2 local guys that chased the culprit, I got it back. Just be careful when you are there. As far as nightlife goes, there are some big clubs, Coco Maya, and some small clubs. There is one hotel, I think it's called Dream? which has an outdoor rooftop pool club/bar scene and at the same time the project silent films on the wall. It was pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: “Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: TheBTeam
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 9 days in Playa del Carmen. We stayed at Aventura Mexicana and had a wonderful time. Our room number was 2101. This was located right next to what I believe used to be referred to as the "childrens pool." We were on the bottom floor and could open our sliding door and step out to our patio w/2 folding chairs grass and then the pool. We had 2 Queen beds and I had requested a roll away also, there was no additional charge for this. This fit into the room w/plenty of space to spare. The roll away was all set up upon our arrival. We enjoyed the free continental breakfast but also ordered off the menu. The food was good and inexpensive. We only had breakfast. We used the $1 off coupons at Kool Beach club on the days we went to the beach. The beach was about a 10 minute walk not bad at all in our opinion. I loved the location of the hotel because we could walk to the Mega, to restaurants the beach etc. If we wanted to catch a cab it ran us about $3 to $7 anywhere in town. Cabs were plentiful and easy to catch. We were also about 3 to 4 blocks away from Scotiabank. The employees overall spoke great English. The only negative was at the beginning of the reservation process we had checked the box for transportation to and from the airport. As I looked into it I realized that their price was higher than anyone elses, $160 round trip as oppposed to $120 from Cancun Transfers. I never got any confirmation saying that I had actually set up the transportation and on one e-mail excghange they told me they could pick us up if we wanted them too. I did not respond to that thinking that I had not committed to it. Anyway long story short I had not cancelled the pick up and was charged for both them and Cancun Transfer said I was a no show. That was a downer at the end of an otherwise great vacation. Cancun Transfer did refund us half of our payment. Would I stay her again? In a heart beat overall it was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for my family”
Reviews.Author: romanoNewYork
Reviews.Content: I got married in PDC on July 2009. My family including myself booked 6 rooms in total at Aventura Mexicana. Everyone absolutely loved AM!!! The staff was wonderful. They all fell in love with Josefa, Rosalia, Jose, Jemina...just to name a few. They all went out of their way to accomodate your needs and answer all your questions. The hotel location is excellent. It's peaceful, quiet and such a short walk to Mamitas/Kool Beach Club. I suggest everyone go to the beach clubs. The beach is beautiful. We all loved the location...absolutely perfect. The beach was seriously just about 5 minutes away. Oh and I love the free beach towels that AM provides. 5th Avenue is also just a few seconds away. I truly enjoyed the fact that we were in the quieter side of 5th Ave. The hotel itself is clean, quaint and very relaxing. My room was in the adult section and it is beautiful. The grounds are well kept. Everyone is always cleaning. My family enjoyed the pool every night. The pool was always a great way to relax in the evening or after a day at the beach. The Mayan Bistro restaurant also had great service. The following night after the wedding, I had leftover wedding cake that my family enjoyed with the help of the Mayan Bistro staff. They gladly provided us plates and all utensils needed and allowed us to enjoy our time in their outside dining area. They were great! My whole family completely enjoyed PDC and Aventura Mexicana. We are all planning a trip back and will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal, great location”
Reviews.Author: vancouver_petunia
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a few nights with a friend in March 2009. The place was absolutely spotless. Very convenient location to the beach, 5th Ave, restaurants, nightlife, etc. Pools are small, but great for a quick, refreshing dip. Included breakfast was pretty minimal, although I heard they had great pastries before we arrived. Staff was very accommodating and constantly cleaning the common areas. We had to check out hours before it was time for us to leave. They stored our luggage, allowed us use of the pools & even had a private bathroom/changing room for us to use before we left. For the price, I thought the Hotel Aventura Mexicana was great and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, relaxing get-away, close to everything - totally recommend”
Reviews.Author: NYTXN
Reviews.Content: I found Aventura Mexicana on the web. The site is very accurate and I found a beautiful, welcoming place with friendly, professional staff. The rooms are simple, comfortable and well done. The hotel is very conveniently located a short walk from the beach and the main street, 5th Avenida. Antonio, Roberto and the rest of the staff were wonderful resources and very attentive to me and other guests. I would totally recommend Aventura Mexicana and would stay there again on a return trip to Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel - fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: Serlyson
Reviews.Content: First time in Playa and we were looking for somewhere that was opposite to the "all inclusive's" that were available. The Aventura was a great choice. Good room (202), amazing food at the hotel's restaurant and really well looked after by the staff. Yes interesting arrangement on the shower/bathroom but we're getting used to it in this kind of hotel (and I now know my partner sooo well!) Pool was lovely and the environment was really good around it - they also do a good cocktail. The masseur on site was also excellent - and I would recommend highly. My only minor negative is that its not as close to the beach as I would like - its only a 10 min walk but my issue is that it was HOT HOT HOT so I didn't like the walk but its worth it. Great hotel, people and would recommend this highly to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: maitdang
Reviews.Content: ALL THUMBS UP! From begining to end! This boutique hotel had it all. Service, Cleaniness, and Accommodations. The staff was wonderfully helpful and hospitable. Rooms were nice and spacious. 2 Great pools, free computer to use and free wi-fi! 1 Block away from the 5th Avenue (great restaurants, shopping, and attractions.) There's a Starbucks and Ben and Jerry's a few blocks away too. It's only a couple of minutes walk away from the green/blue beaches. Definitely will be return! It is like your home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “Good value & wonderful ambiance at a great location”
Reviews.Author: Artie09
Reviews.Content: In April/May I spent a total of 17 days at the Aventura Mexicana. The courteous and helpful staff (thanks again to all desk managers, especially Antonio), delicious meals prepared by accomplished chef Marco and beautifully maintained garden hotel grounds made my first trip to Mexico memorable and special. During my first week the restaurant held two music events in the evenings which I enjoyed very much. I loved hanging out in the lounge chairs under the the palm trees, cooling off in the pool and practicing my rudimentary Spanish with the staff at the Mayan Bistro Restaurant which provided a basic continental breakfast included with the room. I'm already planning a trip with my husband and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: edwardhenry
Reviews.Content: My newlywed wife and I spent 5 nights at Aventura Mexicana and had a great time. The room was not luxurious, with its stone floors and small bathroom area, but we did not expect it to be. It was, however, very pleasant and perfectly comfortable. The hotel itself has two lovely small pools that have a very nice lagoon-like feel, and since the hotel is small it is easy to get around. The hotel's restaurant serves good food, and the breakfast menu was delicious and the prices were good. Aventura Mexicana is located a few short blocks from Fifth Ave, which is the main shopping/eating drag in Playa, so it was easy to walk from the hotel each night and find a new and exciting place to eat. It's important to know that Aventura Mexicana is not right on the beach, but that they have a relationship with two beach clubs, both a five-minute walk away, which allows you to get a discount on a good spot with chairs and an umbrella. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and gave us good instructions about where to catch the bus, etc. I would definitely recommend this hotel to any traveler wanting to avoid the resort-experience.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST STAFF AND VALUE $ IN THE AREA.”
Reviews.Author: Nuevo_Ca_Scuba
Reviews.Content: Hola, I just returned from a 10 night family / friends Scuba Diving Vacation & Wedding in Playa del Carmen. Our whole wedding group lodged at this hotel. I was very happy with the great, personable and very friendly staff and with the tidy, clean well run daily operations of this hotel. This is a well located and very value friendly $ hotel. I humbly recommend this hotel to anyone who wishes a pleasant stay in the area. Gracias. Jose' Luna., Nuevo. Ca. 04 June 09.

Reviews.Title: “Another great place in Playa!”
Reviews.Author: ZsaZsa
Reviews.Content: We booked our 4 night getaway with Orbitz, including their Greyline transfers. No problems with any part of the booking. Greyline was there at the airport and we were off to our hotel. A note on Greyline transfers. I had read a few negative things on them and since this was our first time using them, a bit curious as to how it would play out. The only problem we had was when they never showed up the next morning to arrange for our return shuttle. I wasn’t losing sleep over it, but it did bother me a bit. Our hotel called them for us the day before we left so I could confirm the transportation and the gentleman was there 10 min early to pick us up! Check in at Aventura Mexicana was typical and quick. We needed to give them a cc for “incidentals” and sign a form that we were given a room key, breakfast card, and towel cards. Lose them and you have to pay. Again, typical and nothing shocking or out of the ordinary. We were taken to our room on what used to be the “adult” side. We had a corner room, 205, and it was much better than I expected. I booked the Deluxe King but just didn’t realize it was a small “suite”. Patio doors opened to a small living area with TV, water jug, and microwave. Around the corner was the bathroom. It is true that the walls do not reach the ceiling, but there is a door on the bathroom so I don’t quite understand the concern over lack of privacy. I thought it was a cute attempt at style and uniqueness. There was also a rather large size closet with hangers and shelves. The frig was located here. The room safe was also in the closet, it was electronic and a bit tricky to figure out the first time. There was a different routine to putting in a code compared to the ones we were used to. Off to the side was the king bedroom. They proudly advertise Sealy mattresses, which is true, but both my husband and I had bad neck and back problems after the 2nd night. Bathroom was only stocked with shampoo and soap. I was glad I brought a small bottle of conditioner with me. Lotion would have been a nice touch as well. There were also two robes in the room, love that, but no slippers. I like to have them because the tile floors can be quite slippery and cold. Oh well, no problem! Maid service was fine. We always had towel art on the bed – and those were the only two towels we were given. At Aventura, if you hang up your towels, they will not replace them. I know this is common with all hotels, but AM was the first one we’ve stayed in that actually did not replace them unless you put them on the floor. Air conditioning worked great! The hotel has wifi - but it was spotty and not that great. I have an iphone and I was able to finally connect in the lobby and near the restaurant. But even then it wasn't guaranteed. They do have a computer for use just off of the lobby. The grounds were very lush and cute. Two small pools and what looked like a Jacuzzi of sorts. We used the pool on our side only and it was refreshing (not too cold or too warm). We enjoyed sitting in the chairs with Olivia, the cat. We thought it was odd that the chairs were on harsh gravel - made it hard to get to your chair bare foot after coming out of the pool. Did I say this before? – No problem! Our room was located on 10th Ave, but we never once had any issues with any kind of noise, traffic or otherwise. In fact, our room seemed very quiet and with the shades all closed, very dark. If someone was right outside of our room and talking, you could hear, but that was it. We took advantage of the included continental breakfast one morning and it’s quite simple, but we expected that. We were given toast with toppings and there were sweet rolls. Nothing great, but it worked. Discount passes are included for Kool beach club, but it’s not a big deal. It is only a $10 peso discount. After getting to the club and choosing our chairs, we were told the discount only applied to the plastic chairs in the back row. We were already comfortable and it wasn’t worth moving. $70 peso each for the chairs. Kool had great pina coladas and the chicken nachos were some of the best. Great service and not too bad prices either. Location of the hotel is very good, yet for us it was a bit far north for our liking. We found ourselves heading to the calle 10 area or so. A nice walk, but it was HOT and sunny, making the walk a bit harder than one would think, especially for my hubby who doesn’t take the heat as well as I do. We certainly have no complaints with Aventura Mexicana. I have a few observations (not complaints!): - Room could use a full length mirror for us girls that like to check our outfit before leaving the room - Conditioner and lotion might be a nice touch to the bathroom amenities - TV in the bedroom as compared to only in the living room - Get rid of the rocks under the pool loungers - Front desk was nice, but shy and not outgoing at all. We had to see “hola” first or you wouldn’t even be recognized when you walked past them. I can highly recommend this hotel for someone wanting a nice place to stay in Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: jeff71
Reviews.Content: Last week we stayed at the Aventura Mexicana. It was a very nice, low-key, hotel. They had free internet, a nice little continental breakfast, 2 small pools and a great staff. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a clean and reasonable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bullrider008
Reviews.Content: Located just off of 5th Avenue (basic street for food-shaooping-bars, etc..)--this hotel has very clean rooms and good size. Will hear traffic in the area but A/c unit or fan to cool you down will drown it out. Small safe and water dispensor in each room--shower ihas good pressure. Only think is no privacy on bathroom since no door to toilet area. Daily contental breakfast was adequate but not filling and service is a bit slow. Dinner was good size portion and delicious People are very friendly and helpful in the hotel and small restaurant almost next door to the hotel has GREAT FOOD and CREPES! See Karla and tell her Ines and Frank sent you. Major fitness center across the street and discounted for hotel guests.

Reviews.Title: “Ought to be number ONE hotel in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: scottybail
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from this hotel having selected it from comments on this web-site. There are supposedly eleven hotels which are better but we cannot see what they have to offer in preference to this hotel. Despite the flu scare, you should go to Mexico. There are few cases of flu in the Yucatan Peninsula. The Aventura Mexicana is one of the oldest high-quality hotels in Playa. It occupies a prime spot away from the sometimes trying end of Avenida 5, close to the beach and to the classy end of town. The building is stylish and well designed. It has a small pool, two sundecks, and every room is dual aspect with a large patio door facing the beautiful internal courtyard which is the hub of the hotel. Much time and money is expended maintaining the gardens which are in tip-top shape. There is also a restaurant which faces a side street but which isn’t used very much even though it is does the best ceviche in Playa and cheap cocktails. Breakfast is served in the centre of the courtyard in the sun and the staff are amazingly friendly and genuine. The clientele is honey-moon couples and older people. We saw no children. Every day, the maids made up the rooms brilliantly. They specialise in towel sculptures. One day, we had bought a cloth elephant and found that the maid had produced an elephant sculpture out of towels to sit next to the Elephant! You get a fridge, safe, TV, wi-fi, a fan, a good bathroom in every room, as well as air conditioning. Breakfast was tasty with plenty of orange juice. You can also have a cooked breakfast for approx £2 – but you do have to ask for the menu (otherwise you don’t get it!). The staff speak good English and are welcoming, caring and genuine. They arranged a fishing trip for us and took care of taxis etc. The staff make the hotel what it is and I very much doubt the other 11 hotels can match this quality. When you’re in Mexico, you should explore the archaeological ruins, the cenotes and go fishing. We left with a high opinion of Mexico and the Mexicans.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay I've had in Playa!!”
Reviews.Author: Jennd317
Reviews.Content: Aventura was an awesome hotel. We were there for my wedding so I had a lot of guests coming to stay. They were all very well taken care of and everyone enjoyed their experience. There a couple of pools and even a children's pool. The restaraunt served great happy hour drinks (2 for 1) and had great snack foods (try the onion rings!). The continental breakfast was great for waking up and grabbing a little something to eat. The bed was not hard at all, which is what we usually expect in Playa. I've been to Playa many times, and this was on of the best stays I've had, including condos. We will definitely stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Pack your bags and go now”
Reviews.Author: CTKATE
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 8 night stay at the Aventura Mexicana. The staff was great. They must have listened to previous comments as they now open for breakfast at 7:00 AM. The continental breakfast was very good and they always have complimentary coffee in the lobby area. My husband received Spanish lessons in the morning from Rosalie and Maria came to his rescuse and helped him use the phone card. Julio at the bar always had a smile, and he makes EXCELLENT margaritas. We stayed in a Deluxe King room on the third floor. The room had a microwave, mini fridge and purified water dispenser. Shower had great pressure and the bed was very comfortable. We faced the inner courtyard and 10th Ave and never had any issues with noise. They provide passes to Kool beach club, where we rented plastic beach chairs at 30P per person per day. The hotel is centrally located to everything. The pictures are accurate, it is a charming boutique hotel in a garden setting with some on the most amazing and helpful people. We thank them for their hospitality and look forward to returning in the future

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: cbonk
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came to PDC for a short 4 night dive vacation. The dive shop, which is 3 blocks away, recommended AM and I was pleasantly surprised. AM is a half a block west of the famed 5th Ave where all the shops and restaurants are. Other hotels have reviewers complaining about late night street noise, but we heard absolutely no noise in our room. The hotel is small, but charming and very clean. it has several courtyards with pools and a quaint Bistro for all the day's meals. Prices in the restaurant are very reasonable. The staff were all EXTREMELY friendly!!! The price for our stay was very reasonable as well, with a special February discount! We had two twin beds. Our room was spacious and clean. Refrigerator and TV. Nicely tiled shower. I would highly recommend this place for any one interested in a no-frills, but charming, clean, ideally located hotel that is only 3 blocks from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: acn-taby
Reviews.Content: In the beginning of March 2009 we (two senior couples from Sweden) stayed in Playa del Carmen for 10 days in Hotel Aventura Mexicana. This is a wonderful little hotel close to the beach (5-10 minutes walk) and the centre. Still very quiet. The staff is friendly and helpful, the bar and restaurant is better than many of the nearby restaurants, still not very expensive, the garden is lovely, the rooms are comfortable and clean and includes air condition, refrigerator, safe, TV etc. If ever in Playa again this would be our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: Newkie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AM this past week and we loved the hotel. The grounds were very nice, with the rooms, pool, common areas all being kept as clean as can be. We loved our room near the family pool, and the people were so nice to us. Played tennis with one of the agents at the desk, sorry her name escapes me. She was very nice to play tennis and introduce me to some other players at the courts down the street. Thanks alot. We didnt eat anything but breakfast, so I cant comment on the food for the other two meals of the day. I will say, I think breakfast should be moved up a half hour to an hour for the earlier guest who need or want earlier start times to their days. Maybe one day they will change the hours for the majority. I do realize that maybe the hour might be too early for the guess that might overhear the noise in the adults section Second, I do wish there wasnt a designated adults section and family section. I stil think they should have one or the other in this hotel. It sure would've been nice to use the better/larger pool for our kids. We never did see anyone using the adults pool during our 3 day stay? Third, the bar area in the family section by the massage area could be used as something more than just an empty space with no use at all to it. Maybe they could put it to better use? Not sure what, so I will just leave it at that. It just seemed like wasted space that took away from the attractiivness of the Hotel, with empty cans/bottle sitting around. Fourth, the jacuzzi tub did not have jets that worked as far as we know. If so, we never did find out how to use it. So, would I stay there again? Absolutely! Just wanted to address a couple things that might help in the long run. Thanks AM P.S. One more thing. hopefully an all non smoking hotel in the future?

Reviews.Title: “ATTENTION GAY TRAVELERS:”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkJonNY
Reviews.Content: As much as my partner and I liked the property and the staff was nice, there were too many kids at the time we traveled. This is not an adults only hotel. The property is not very big and it seemed like wherever you turned, kids were around. Luckily, we were on the top floor. Aside from that, the hotel was in a great location (5 minutes to the beach) and right around the corner from 5th Avenue where all of the restaurants & shops are. At times, we felt a little uncomfortable at the hotel with all of the families around. Yes, there were some gay couples staying there, but they seemed a little uncomfortable as well. If you are looking for some privacy in a gay friendly environment, I'm not sure if this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: ORCon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in a king room from 3/20/09 - 3/29/09. Right outside our sliding door from room #110 we had a nice table, two chairs and a palapa with picnic table. The waterfall from the pool was right there and very relaxing. 10 steps away was the Mayan Bistro indoor/outdoor restaurant. They have a great continental breakfast at 8:00 a.m. and great food throughout the day with happy hour later. Prices were very reasonable. The best part was all the great people we met from Canada, Minnesota, Boston and Germany. Some people return each year. The hotel has a great Mexican ambience with lots of palm trees lit up at night. The room was meticulously cleaned each day. The bed was very comfortable and the room had lots of closet space. There is one computer for guests to use and many library books to choose from in the lobby. The guys at the front desk are very friendly. It took me a long time to get the keys to open the sliding door quickly but just takes practice. Not a lot of American stations on the television, but you can watch the news and weather. I don't think we will return in March again due to the high winds each day. The good thing was after a day at the beach I could swim in the pool at the hotel with the buildings blocking a lot of the breeze. We enjoyed watching the hotel cat sleeping in all kinds of hidden places. I wish we could still be there. Being home and back in the rat race makes me look forward to another trip sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Cute place for a relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: Chubloidis
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a couple of days in March 2009 and really enjoyed our visit. The staff is really helpful and friendly and the hotel itself has a relaxed vibe. I'm not a spring breaker kind of person, and this hotel was a good fit for my vacation: nice music and snacks at the "Mayan Bistro" (their restaurant), beautiful bougainvilleas and palm trees around the courtyard, nicely kept pools for taking a quick dip, and close proximity to a well-priced and fantastic massage ($30/hr at Spa Azul Maya!). The rooms are pretty big and have expected amenities: A/C, King bed, full bath, sliding patio doors and the location is great- a 5 min walk to the beach, where you can rent loungers at "Kool" (ask for coupon at the front desk) and all the restaurants and shops along 5th ave. Be sure to check out the cafes and restaurants a little outside the touristy area too. Quick Tip: grab snacks and water at the "MEGA" supermarket on Constituyente if you are taking day trips and want to save money! AWESOME PASTRIES!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff & great location”
Reviews.Author: rw12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aventura Mexicana for 3 days in late March. It's in the perfect location in Playa del Carmen, with access not only to the beach, but a number of great restaurants and very good Mexican food. Additionally, it is a great hub for tours heading to the nearby Mayan ruins (we traveled to Tulum, Coba, Chichen Itza and highly recommend all 3). The staff was very friendly and very helpful. We were in contact with them before our arrival and they arranged cost-effective transportation from the airport (and to our next hotel at the end of the stay) for us. They also let us check-out at the normal time and yet leave our luggage with them so we could spend a few more hours in the town. The rooms were pretty big and nice, but nothing flashy. For those concerned with privacy, our bathroom was not separated by a door, but in a separate enclave. I am not sure if bigger rooms have that issue. The restaurant at the hotel was nice, but comparatively pricey to local joints. We only ate off the "snack" menu while we were there. It's good, but for dinner, you are better off going to one of the many places in Playa del Carmen, we had good meals at Quinta Passion (on 5th & 28th), HC de Monterrey (on Constituente) and a local taco place on 5th. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place conveniently located and for a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel, really great time”
Reviews.Author: picklebird101
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aventura with my wedding party from March 2nd-8th. This hotel is really lovely, the gardens, pools and loungers are really nice, there are plenty of areas to chill out in or sit around with family. The rooms are regular hotel rooms, the staff keep it very clean, the beds were not too hard, and the air conditioning worked very well. We stayed int he little house/roomt hats all by itself at the top of the second floor in the newer area of the hotel (honeymoon suite). It was really cozy and nice to have our own gated patio - only downside - people were curious and would come to check it out and also the maid kept comming over early int he morning to move the chairs. It is very convinient that there is free internet in the lobby and the staff at the front desk are really helpful and honest, they always got us a fair deal on taxis/taxi van, and told us really great restuarants to eat in etc. I would totally stay here again, the price was great, the hotel itself feels friendly, and the location is awesome. You can walk to any number of beaches or to 5th, or to walmart (walmart is kinda far though). Its location is quiet, its interior is clean, and the breakfasts are very good (omelettes were great!). Everyone in the wedding party said they would stay here again, so we were all very happy, no complaints :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel but beware where you park”
Reviews.Author: Megan03london
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Aventura for 4 nights and it is a beautiful little hotel within walking distance to the beach and 5th avenue. Hotel is as depicted on the website and staff very helpful and friendly. The only thing you have to beware is that hotel has got limited parking and on busy days, such as friday nights and weekend, please ask hotel for a sign saying Hotel guest that you can display in your rental car if you are not parking at the designated hotel parking spots. We parked 100 metres away on a busy friday night and went for dinner only to come back later to see that the Mexican police has taken away our number plate and given us a fine. Having read so much about Mexican police, we were very nervous the next day having to show up at the local police station.Thankfully, we paid the fine (early discount if paid within 3-4 days) and they gave us the number plate back.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Charm, price”
Reviews.Author: snarl71
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for 6 nights in March of 2009. We reserved one of the "Deluxe King" rooms prior to our trip and when we arrived we were actually given a "Junior Suite" for the same price. At the time of our reservation, if you booked 3 or more nights you got 30% off. I'm surprised to hear of other people paying $140/night since we paid only $85 or so. The room was enormous, with a living/dining/kitchen area, a raised bedroom, and very large bathroom. As others have said, he bathroom walls were not to the ceiling so privacy was slightly eliminated, but it did come with a door and with the AC running, noises weren't easily heard. The room was immaculately maintained, and the chambermaids did a wonderful job keeping things clean (and preparing some hilarious towel animals). The grounds are quite lovely with two small pools and lush shrubbery. There are three sunbathing decks, but we only used them briefly as it was too much (we prefered going to the beach). The complimentary breakfasts at Mayan Bistro are very simple (literally orange juice, coffee, and bread). However, for only $2 you can get an omelette, too. Some days, it was worth it to splurge on the extra $2, but most days we just had toast then went to Kool Beach Club and had lunch there. The staff at the restaurant and front desk were always friendly. My partner took advantage of their spa and had a massage (for $30, I believe...maybe $35). He said it was decent. Our only problem with our room was the occasional noise. This junior suite is located next to the restaurants storage room so you can occasionally hear them working. In addition, there is a room upstairs and since all rooms have tile floors, we heard every chair being slid...particularly at night when those guests returned from shopping/dining. But, being city dwellers ourselves, this wasn't too much of an issue. If your'e sensitive to noise, Id recommend reserving a room on the third floor (since there is nobody above you). Our reservation was initially for 5 days (we planned on spending the final night in Cancun), but at the last minute we decided to stay one extra at Aventura Mexicana. Long story short, we're already talking about a return trip to Playa, and would definitely stay here again. The location was quiet (in terms of street noise) and was so close to great dining and shopping (and two great beach clubs).

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cgerard
Reviews.Content: Was there anything not to like here? Not really. Great food in the cafe, pleasant staff, clean, spacious, comfortable room--really liked the spacious bathroom and loft-like design of the room with walls that stopped before reaching the ceiling. There was also a cool small pool in a beautiful garden setting. Yes, will be returning here next time I am in Playa. Very relaxing atmosphere here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: b1j2m3c1
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel from 2/13 to 2/16. We make a yearly pilgrimage to P.D.C. to thaw out our bones from the cold Michigan winters. Each time we go we consult Trip Adviser for our hotel choice and again, we were not disappointed. The hotel is located at the northern end of P.D.C. closer to 10th Ave. and a 5-10 minute walk from the beach clubs. The staff was always friendly, smiling, and eager to help. Check in went fine, we arrived at 1:00 pm and was told our room would be ready at 3:00 (check in time) and it was. They held our luggage and we changed into our swim suits and had a cool beverage and cool dip in one of the pools. The pools are not heated so they are very refreshing. We were there with friends and there room was closer to the front of the hotel. While there room appeared to be a little nicer than ours, I don't really remember what I had booked so I'm not complaining and all you do is sleep in it anyways. The room itself was clean and well taken care of and that's what matters the most. Our room was on the 1st floor at the back part of the hotel. The entrance to the room was a doorwall to a courtyard. The room backed up to 10th Ave. and with the window backing to the road I feared traffic noise would be a problem but this was not the case. The bathroom was a little unusual in that it was a partitioned corner of the room with no ceiling or door. I am constantly reading reviews from people complaining about hard beds. Every hotel we have stayed in have hard beds so I assume this is the way it is in Mexico so I don't know what else to tell you. We ate two nights at the Mayan Bistro on site and the food was excellent and well priced. Service was a little iffy as the meals seemed to arrive at different times and they also seem to have a hard time doing 2 bills, 1 for each couple. The continental breakfast was typical but we ordered off the menu and the food again was excellent and well priced. A small problem is that they take the coffee maker from the lobby to use in the restaurant would then would run out of coffee and it took quite a while to brew a new pot. All in all we enjoyed our stay at this hotel, would recommend it to others and stay again without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “loved, loved, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Zoe-Chloe
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect - especially the staff, they were SOOO friendly, helpful, accomodating. The front desk staff helped us book a tour at the Rio Secreto, which was the BEST tour I've ever done. The cave system was amaxing. If you go to Rio Secreto, just take a taxi to the location, don't waste your money on having them pick you up. It costs $40 US extra per person for them to pick you up/drop you off. Just take a taxi to the location (about 15 minutes south on the freeway), and when you're done, wait on the highway and flag down an empty cab/colectivo to take you back. It was about $60 pesos to get there, $100 pesos to get back - which is about $14 US dollars both ways for two people. The food at the hotel was well priced and yummy, good for a quick breakfast or snack. We each got a massage at the hotel, it was $30 US and was decent. We booked the first 3 nights of our vacation here, then 2 nights in Akumal at the Vista Del Mar hotel (that hotel is just so-so, but the location was great). When in Akumal we realized how much we loved Adventura Mexicana so we called and booked the last 3 nights of our vacation there as well! We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: ctm31
Reviews.Content: It was a great hotel with a genuinely warm and helpful staff. The location is excellent and the grounds were beautiful. If I have a knock, it is the mattress in my room. Although it appeared to be a new mattress, it was hard as a rock. Next time I will see if I can request a room with a softer mattress. Otherwise it was a great stay and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GreatLakesVic
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel. It was VERY CLEAN! Which is numero uno to us. We stayed in a double room. It had a 3ft tall fridge which we kept well stocked with beer, pop, and water. Also the room had a tv which we like to watch in the morning to get the news. We liked having a clean beach towel provided daily at the desk. The continental breakfast was ok. It provided coffee, orange juice, toast, sweet roll. We spent one day around the pool and the rest at Kool beach club or side trips. In all we would return and recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Best place to be when in Playa”
Reviews.Author: MojcaC
Reviews.Content: - great stuff, they make you feel as at home right away - really clean rooms - very safe place to be, eg. I stayed in the hotel all together around 1 month and I didn't always put everything in security deposit box and nothing ever happened - all the stuff is just great not only receptionist, but also cleaning ladies, stuff working in the restaurant, ... - breakfast place is just great - palms, flowers, ... around it ... JUST GREAT place to wake up and have breakfast - they have 2 swimming pools - and they are just few steps away from famous 5th ave which on one hand means that the place is really quiet and nice and only around the corner you have ''night life'' - and they have wi fi --- and also their own computer that is possible to use

Reviews.Title: “Great Time and A.M.”
Reviews.Author: mk90longisland
Reviews.Content: We just returned from PDC and our stay at the AM and it was great. We booked many months ago, so received the discounted price and thanks to many emails to Andy, all went smoothly. The Hotel: beautiful. We had a great room and we were there with two other couples, who's rooms were even better! Always clean, always beautiful towel art, clean towels, etc. The Grounds: really nice, peaceful and just what we needed after and EXHAUSTING day at the beautiful beach. Came back every day to two for one drinks and delish snacks. Then after a short siesta, we were all off to town. The town is the best and as my friend said, you could be here a month and not see it all. Big Smootches to Olivia, the resident cat, I miss her!!! The pools: There are two, both nice. The Staff; the front desk was excellent. The restaurant staff needs some work. All in all we had a great time. Kook beach is the best, great chairs, beautiful beach, but annoying music. They really need to mix it up during the week at least. Also, just a mention to John Grey's restaurant, Xcellent as usual!

Reviews.Title: “It brings us back to Playa del Carmen every time”
Reviews.Author: RubyDooDenver
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Aventura Mexicana, and like our first visit, we loved it. The hotel staff (the same employees we had last year) was extremely friendly and accommodating. The grounds and upkeep were maintained daily. The rooms were very clean too. Although the hotel is just one block off of the main strip, it is quiet, secluded and quite romantic for couples. It is still a close walk to the beach (approximately 4 blocks), which is nice. It also hosts a number of extra amenities, including towel service for the pool or beach, an onsite restaurant and bar and Internet access. We even got engaged at the hotel and hope to have our wedding there soon. For a good meal, be sure to visit the crepe restaurant '5.24' right next door to the hotel. Great food and great service.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Wonderful Find!”
Reviews.Author: Knarliss
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel rather last minute on Expedia without doing much research into other options. What luck! Its location in Playa is great - only a short walk from the beach and tourist areas, but still nice and quiet. The courtyard-style layout provided a very serene (and romantic!) atmosphere. A nice pool and small restaurant are surrounded by beautiful landscaping, and the sound of the fountain added to the peaceful atmosphere - a great refuge after a day of people watching at the beach! The best part of our stay was the exceedingly accommodating staff and the unexpectedly fantastic restaurant. The employees take such pride in what they do, and it shows! The restaurant, the Mayan Bistro, was so good that we ate there every single night of our stay, as we couldn't imagine the quality being better anywhere else in such a tourist-centered place. Every meal was spectacular - fresh ingredients, great care in presentation, and absolutely delicious! Also fantastic were the drinks - a great piña colada and mojito. Go for happy hour when it's "2 for 1" and try them both! Even if you decide to stay elsewhere, put this restaurant on your "Must Do" list while in Playa. You will not be disappointed! The room was very nice, very clean, and it had a microwave, a little refrigerator, place settings for 2 as well as an extremely convenient 20-liter purified water dispenser. Internet access was free, wireless, consistently reliable AND available in the room too! Fantastic! All in all, this is a great little botique hotel with a superior restaurant in a convenient yet quiet location. We will definitely stay there again and will recommend it to anyone we know traveling to Playa. It was GREAT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great local hotel”
Reviews.Author: glbkge
Reviews.Content: The service at both the front desk & the restaurant was A+. Our room was a Superior King & was spotless. Bed was the most comfortable bed we have ever had in Mexico. Unless you are hung up on having beach-front, the location was great. It is about 1/2 block from 5th Ave & about 3 from the beach. There are couple of small pools at the hotel & lovely courtyard.

Reviews.Title: “welcoming and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: beach-bound_from_DC
Reviews.Content: We just returned relaxed and refreshed from a five-night stay at Aventura Mexicana. This is a very well-managed boutique hotel that does a wonderful job making guests feel at home, handling requests (for restaurant suggestions, reservations, directions, etc) and keeping your room very clean and comfortable. Extra blanket, extra pillow, no problem. All cheerfully accommodated. As you can see from other photos, the reception area opens up to a lush courtyard with palm trees, flowering plants, fountains and several pools (one with a small waterfall). It's quite lovely. Groundskeepers are constantly at work to keep it swept and pruned. There are several decks above to explore and catch the sun. There's a small casual restaurant--Mayan Bistro--for lunch, dinner or drinks by the pool. Staff here also super friendly. AM caters to all kinds of travelers--U.S., UK, Canadian, German--plus all ages and family types. The vibe is pretty laid-back and quiet. So this is probably not the best choice for a family with teenagers. But if you are seeking a secluded garden spot just a few blocks from the beach, this is a good pick. Noise was not a problem. The hotel is a block off the main pedestrian street (5th Ave), and that probably helped. There is some nearby construction. That's true for most of this newer, northern end of Playa. It was not a bother. Resident cat, Olivia, patrols the decks between naps.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing little gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: lafahm
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel recently and were amazed at how wonderful it was. Our room was very clean, and the staff was so kind and helpful. I disagree with some of the other reviews about the bathroom not being private. Our room had a separate bathroom with a toilet and shower with a door that closed. We had a room with 2 double beds that were very comfortable. The hotel is set in a nice neighborhood and within a few minutes walk to the beach, restaurants, shopping etc. I also disagree with the fact that most of the staff didn't speak English well. First, you are in THEIR country so maybe learning a bit of their language would be a good thing and second, you only needed to speak slowly and clearly and they usually could figure out what you wanted. Food and other things like taxis, shopping etc are really inexpensive. We took the city bus everywhere, to Tulum, Xcaret and more. Its extremely clean, comfortable and a wonderful traveling experience. The people were genuinely glad to see you each day. We ate fresh fruit and veggies every day with no problems. Bottled water is plentiful and about 7 pesos a bottle which is around 50 cents US. Do not miss Xcaret it is soo worth it. The Mexican show at night is amazing and very well done. The "plus" ticket allows you to eat at any of about 4 huge open air buffets. The food was really good and the setting is just pristine and gorgeous. Its very easy to exchange US money into pesos in Playa Del Carmen. There are exchange places on every corner. They tell you on a sign how many pesos equal a dollar so no worries. Tulum is spectacular and well worth the trip. There is a great restaurant there also. If you wish to swim in the ocean at Tulum you should wear your suit as there is no where to change and people were pretty much just taking their clothes off in front of you. Playa is a very clean, safe, fun, and beautiful area. The hotel offered massages and I cant recommend them more highly!! It was one of the best massages I have ever had and only $35 US!! If you wish you can easily walk from the bus station to the hotel. Its a nice stroll even with your suitcase. We will definitely return to this hotel as it was soo charming and located perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Selection,value for money”
Reviews.Author: christosDk
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to Mexico for diving. We stayed in this hotel for about 12 days. Aventura Mexicana is located in a quiet area, but also a few steps from the 5th Ave., where the restaurants and most of the people gather during the evening. In any case it is a 10 minutes walking from almost everywhere. Good location. Nice, mexican style building with a garden and a pool area. Personnel: The personnel is friendly, especially those who work in the reception, are very service minded and helpful. Rooms: The rooms are clean and the room service is provided on a daily basis. Perfect air conditioning. Free Internet wireless access is also an advantage. A small refrigerator also available in the rooms. Our only disappointment with the room was the toilet, where there is no door, no privacy at all, and this applies for all rooms, as we could see from the glass main doors. Sometimes I used the toilet by the pool area for some privacy. Another thing is, the main room doors are very big sliding aluminum frame/glass doors with curtains and you have to close the curtains very well for privacy from people walking the balconies or the corridors. It takes a couple of days to get used to this unusual setup. Hotel's Restaurant: Somebody has to take care of few things in the restaurant. a) Opening Hour for breakfast is 08 in the morning. That's not good if you have to leave earlier for a tour. Most of the days we had to have our breakfast in nearby restaurants just because we had to leave hotel at 7:45 b) Only one or two persons speak English in the restaurant, and it is those 2 guys that make things work. The days where those guys were not there it was challenging, to put it mildly. However, you can have Coffee, orange juice, toast bread,croissant for free, and you can order omelets for around 30 pesos. Generally the prices in the restaurant were good, but do not expect anything fancy. So we decided to have our dinners to other restaurants. Pool: Just forget it... more or less it is decorative, since is very small. Very rare to see people in the pool. Of course there is no need, since the playa is only 3 minutes away. Overall we are satisfied with our choice, since the value for money we got was very good. But of course make a search before you book, because the prices change all the time. We got our deal during a promotion period for this hotel. If the price was higher I would possibly look for other options as well.

Reviews.Title: “Even better the second time around!”
Reviews.Author: kevmeyeth
Reviews.Content: It has been four years since our last stay at Aventura Mexicana and there have been some changes since then, but the service, value and the atmosphere are still excellent today! What has changed in four years? They acquired another hotel adjacent to their property (north) which has increased their rooms from 30 to 48. Also, the entrance to the hotel has moved to 24th St. This time we stayed in the "acquired" north section of the hotel. We actually prefer this area because: Our ground floor room had a patio with chairs and we were 10 feet from the pool. The pool in this area is small but it had a nice water fall which is great to hear during a afternoon nap. The lobby is also close for that free cup of coffee or to check your email. The bathrooms in this "acquired" north area have doors if you are really concerned about that. The rooms are clean, the beds are firm (which we like) and the service is fantastic. We made our reservations through Expedia and got a great deal (around $89.00 per night). We can't forget about the Mayan Bistro... Great 2 for 1's and a fun bartender (sorry I forgot his name). *Note - for a great beach bar you have to go down to Bad Boy's Beach Bar just off of 4th St. directly on the beach. Great service, food and music!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: backdrft76
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. It was really nice and clean and has a lot of things going for it. The reason we rated it a 4 is becuase it simply is an above average hotel, not quite the best however. First, the good. The continental breakfast was satisfying. Just enough to keep you going thru the morning until lunch. It was oj, coffee, tea, toast with jelly and butter, pastries, and an unbeatable $3-4 egg menu. The best oj I've had in a very long time...freshly squeezed! The free internet in the lobby was a huge bonus just to stay in touch when you're gone for 7 days and allows you to book and research other excursions. At times, people would be on the only computer for up to 10 minutes before finally leaving. The pool area was absolutely beautiful. Perfectly designed pools, gardens, fountains, flowers, and landscaping made it very relaxing, which also made for a nice restaurant setting. The daily maid service was impecable. Very good at details and clean. The bed was very comfortable. We stayed in a 1st floor king room and slept great. The pillows were a little thin, so we go 2 extras at the front desk. The small fridge in the room was great for storing beverages. Very convenient. The beach towels they provided each day were big, soft, and clean. A nice bonus. And the local cat was totally cool. I hate cats, but this one was the only one I've actually liked. The only negatives that kept this from being a 5 was the fact the pools were small and hard to enjoy for swimming. They are more for looks. I only saw 3 people in them the entire week I was there. The hot tub/spa was not functioning. It would have been nice to get in at night or early morning. And the rooms had no bath room. Yes, there was a bath area, but it was not a room. It was wide open enough for someone to be walking by the patio door and look in and see you doing your thing if the blinds werent closed. This also made an interesting time if you had to do #2 in front of someone. We simply came up with a rule to run the shower water or step outside. It was rather inconvenient. Overall, I would stay here again. A nice propery, quiet enough to enjoy, close enough to the beach and 5th Ave, and friendly, knowledgeable staff. I recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: summit167
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here at the beginning of our 13 day stay before moving onto a 5 star AI in Cancun. Very pleased with location, hotel rooms were fine, wireless internet in the rooms, 24 hr coffee in lobby, 2x1 drinks at bar all day, clean beautiful grounds, staff friendly and helpful. We did not spend anytime in the pools or on the decks because we do alot of exploring on our own. Hot water took a while to warm up, fridge was cold, nice and peacful here. Close walk to beaches and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint”
Reviews.Author: luvMexx
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Aventura Mexicana from Janurary 21-26. We are both in our mid-twenties and we were just going on vacation for a little fun in the sun. We have been to Puerto Vallarta the last two years so we decided we would like to see some new scenery so we booked a hotel in Playa del Carmen. Overall we were pleasantly pleased. The hotel is in a great location! We woke up and would go to the Kool beach club (which you get a small discount for the chairs -- but the techno music gets old) and stay there for several hours. Then back to our hotel to get ready and walk along 5th Avenue for drinks and food. Then back to our hotel for long sleeves because it got pretty windy at night. Then back to 5th Avenue for more drinks. We tried the drinks at our hotel which were yummy but we are all about exploring. The hotel room itself was okay. The bathroom wall is 6' or so tall and no door. My friend and I are close... but not that close. Plus we were on the first floor so we would keep the blinds closed so no one could see in but that left the room super dark. The one window was bolted shut and the door was a sliding glass door with no lock on the screen so we couldn't get any fresh air when sleeping. Overall though we spent such little time at the hotel it really didn't matter. It definitely was an older boutique hotel which gives you a feeling as though you really are in Mexico rather some generic resort. I would probably go back to Playa just to explore Tulum and Puerto Morales and anything off of 5th Avenue since we both felt like we saw everything that we needed to along that strip after several days.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: kateinohio
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights over Martin Luther King Jr. weekend at Aventura Mexicana. We booked a flight/hotel package on Expedia and ended up paying about $82 USD/night.. The hotel was very clean and comfortable. The hotel is divided into two sections; the back section has all sliding glass doors, king beds, and bathrooms with half-walls. We were put on the other side, and I'm glad we were. We had two double beds that we pushed together, and a balcony facing the street where we could enjoy a beer cooled in our room fridge while watching people walk about. Other rooms on this side have balconies facing the interior of the hotel or no balconies at all. We weren't originally placed in a balcony room, but when I asked about a balcony, they were very nice about changing our room, for no extra charge. There's no way to reserve a balcony room on their website as far as I can tell, so I would recommend asking when you get there if that's your thing. I asked a guy at the front desk to recommend his favorite restaurant in PDC; he directed us to El Nativo on 30th Ave. just off Constituyentes. It was excellent, and the fresh juice we had there was well worth the short jaunt off of 5th Ave. The location of the hotel is great, just a few blocks from the water and in a quieter part of the town. We would consider staying there again. We only had two problems: one was tiny ants in our bathroom. I told the people at reception but nothing ever happened. The other issue were very loud, drunk American guys that stumbled into the hotel at 3 and 4 am on two different nights. They woke us up, but nobody from the hotel seemed to care or do anything about it. I was happy when they left and slept peacefully the other nights.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Week”
Reviews.Author: Calikidsgramma
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from an absolutely wonderful stay from Jan 15 through 22 at this friendly hotel and we couldn't ask for anybetter service or any better "anything" Everything in this small hotel was very clean, and the constant maintance we observed kept it that way. Every concern we had was instantly attended to. We would definately go back to this quiet, comfortable small hotel just a half block away from busyness of 5th street yet well removed from the noise when we entered the grounds. We ate dinner here twice during our stay (excellent) and enjoyed the "happy-hour" 2 for 1 nightly before venturing out. I could say so much more but most has been said by others on here so I will just say I echo all the good comments made.

Reviews.Title: “Darn near perfect!”
Reviews.Author: lkcirtap
Reviews.Content: This place was darn near perfect for us - although I will admit, I was a bit skeptical at first. First, we checked in at night - which for some reason I'm not big on - you just don't see things the same at night as you do at daytime...at least I don't. The doors to the rooms are all sliding glass doors - not typical hotel doors, and they use actual keys - not keycards! The A/C in the room was cranked way up - go to Playa and you'll understand why. The room we were in has a concrete (?) floor - again, lots of sand in the area so carpet is impractical. The bed was extremely comfortable - I had a great night's sleep every day we were there. Facilities in the room were all fine and up to par. TVs in the rooms are OK - not huge, but a fairly extensive selection of channels, both in English and Spanish. But if you're going to Playa Del Carmen to watch TV - you really should rethink your priorities. The breakfast is a bit sparse, but it worked for us. There is lots to eat in Playa, so I didn't want to fill up every morning. A roll, coffee and OJ got my day started just fine every day. All the staff were exceedingly nice - they took care of everything we asked for, and let's just say you'll be impressed by their towel folding ability! It's located in a nice part of the strip - away from the real busy parts so the area is quiet at night. Plenty to eat and plenty close to the beach - just a few short blocks away. The on-site massage folks got high recommendations from some folks in our group - we didn't have enough time to grab one, but if we go back we will for sure. The pools aren't much to talk about - they're almost more decoration than functional. I did see some folks in them - but seriously - just go down to the beach and get some Caribbean Sea action instead of a hotel pool. One other potential drawback - no elevators. If you're on the ground floor, not a big deal. But it's a three story building, so if you're not game to take the stairs, ask for a ground floor room. Now here is the kicker -- I'm a total night owl, and I would often find myself outside on the second or third floor patio having a cigar. After midnight the front door of the hotel is locked, and you need to ring a bell to get in if the clerk isn't there. Well guess where the bell is - tucked up on the wall around the second and third floor patios. I'd usually nod off only to be awaken by the doorbell, which in reality sounds a bit more like a fire alarm. Not a problem if you're in your room, but a rude awakening to a nap in the warm evening air. But with that being said - I highly recommend this place! Great value, solid location, and an incredibly friendly staff that we got to know by name. Quiet and peaceful - a great place to call home while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: yincat
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana was perfect for us! We were there for 4 nights, 5 days for a girls getaway vacation. We chose this hotel because it was a small boutique hotel right off 5th avenue. If we had stayed at a big resort, we would not have experienced the culture of the area. The property was very cute, with a couple of pools that nobody uses, and it's nicely decorated. Perfect place if you're just looking for a nice place to stay where you can just walk out into town.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like home”
Reviews.Author: mrensfeldt
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 weeks at Aventura Mexicana over Christmas and New Year 2008. We had a great experience and would definitely come back. Clean rooms and well kept grounds made us want to spend a little extra quality time at the hotel (nice siestas, etc.). The location is great, although a couple blocks from the sand. Nice and quiet although only a block from the 5th avenue. Friendly and proffesional staff. The restaurant (Bistro Maya) has an excellent Italian chef and professional staff, although they did have some minor attendance issues with some members of the team (late breakfast one day). Looking forward to the next time! Sofi & Magnus (Sweden)

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: VaCaBoyz
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Aventura and it was even better than the first time! It was a week long birthday/anniversary celebration escaping from the bitter cold of NYC. We really enjoy staying here because it is very gay friendly and has such a warm welcoming atmosphere. The entire management staff (Jimena, Antonio, Alberto, Jose, Monica...) were always friendly and accommodating. The restaurant staff (Aurelio, Angel, Jolibeth...) were also very friendly and helpful in making us feel at home. The room was kept very clean all the time. There were always staff maintaining the grounds to keep things looking great. If there was any disappointment with this trip it was the restaurant. During our last visit, we ate at the restaurant (The Mayan Bistro) almost every night because of the exceptional food! Since then they have hired a new chef, Marco, who they are promoting alot, but we couldn't understand why. Unfortunately we were very disappointed in the ordinary food and there was no comparison to the former chef. As a result of that, we found alot of great, reasonable restaurants very nearby this time as we only ate dinner in the restaurant twice. To add a little variety to the continental breakfast, it would be nice if there were some fruit or yogurt added occasionally. All in all, Aventura Mexicana is a great getaway and we can't wait to return to our Mexican home away from home!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: marimar75
Reviews.Content: Fantastic time at a quaint and beautiful hotel. Our family of three had a wonderful time. The only thing we wish to see in our next stay is child seat/chair at the Mayan Bistro, which by the way had the best Margaritas in Playa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Playa, Hated To Leave”
Reviews.Author: drewfromnyc
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana is a great deal -- the grounds are well kept and attractive, the room was cleaned daily, the breakfast was fine, and the staff is very helpful. The hotel has an amazing location in the less honky tonk part of Playa -- one block from Fifth Avenue, five blocks from the best beach. Right next door to a great Italian restaurant owned and run by a lovely woman from Rome. Would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend the Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: LINYKenmare
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for 6 nights from Dec 1st. The hotel is an attractive building located around an open, palm filled courtyard and was spotlessly clean everywhere. Front Desk staff were friendly and courteous at all times as were all the employees we encountered. It's one block off the northern end of 5th Ave. Our room was spacious and kept very clean by Lupita. Sheets and towels were changed daily and the bathroom was fully supplied with soap, shampoo, conditioner etc. There was also a small refrigerator, coffee machine, fresh water dispenser, safe deposit box and TV in the room. The bed was a king size and, while quite firm, was also very comfortable and we slept well. Other than the fact that the semi-private bathroom (wall does not reach to ceiling) is not ideal, everything else about the room was fine. Despite being just off 5th Ave the hotel is very quiet and peaceful and the courtyard is an oasis of tranquility, especially at night when the lit torches and pool lighting give it a wonderful ambiance. Continental breakfast at the hotel restaurant, the Mayan Bistro, is good and you can pay an extra $5 for a cooked breakfast or visit one of the many restaurants serving breakfast within a few minutes walk. We enjoyed pre-dinner drinks nightly at the Mayan Bistro bar where we received very friendly service from Angel and Jolie and also had an excellent dinner on our last night. The hotel recommends Kool Beach Club which is just a few blocks away. The hotel supplies towels and you pay $7 per person for the wooden loungers at Kool. There are also cheaper and more expensive options. Our average bill at Kool, where we usually spent 4 to 5 hours on several days, came to about $40-45 USD, which we thought was great value. This included lunch for two, 4 or 5 beers, bottled water, lounger charge and tip . Food was very good (try the fish and shrimp tacos), beers were cold and service was fast and friendly. The sand is total powder and stays cool no matter how high the temperature. Note that topless sunbathers are in abundance all along the beach, in case you are of a conservative bent or traveling with children. Overall we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Aventura Mexicana and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: yohagopelo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights in November. The room was very spacious & kept clean. They had serious A/C & wireless internet in the lobby, which were nice treats. The property was really pretty & the location was perfect - a 1 minute walk to 5th ave, 5 minutes to the beach. The hotel was really quiet & I felt safe & comfortable there. My only issues are that 1) i booked through Orbitz, and they quoted me as getting a "Superior King Room with Garden View & Balcony". When we checked in, we got a 1st floor room with a view of the street, and no balcony. They simply shrugged at the front desk, and said they couldn't do anything. They offered to let us change rooms for our 2nd & 3rd nights, but we didn't want to deal with the hassle of moving rooms, and at a price of $65 a night, I didn't really care. Just be careful in your expectations with this place. 2) Our room was swamped with mosquitos. Despite wearing tons of bug repellant, my boyfriend & I both got tons of bites on us. 3) They offer massage at the hotel, which s awesome. Except that the woman giving massages was extremely pushy & was walking around the property, wouldn't leave us alone. She kept trying to rub my shoulders, it was very weird. Overall - for the price, you can't beat the location & cleanliness of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great middle sized hotel”
Reviews.Author: dognlap
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Aventura Mexicana was an enjoyable one. The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean and nice. Although I booked a reservation via Yahoo travel, the standard room was a good one. It was pleasing to find a 20-liter water dispensing system as well as a microwave and an unstocked refrigerator in the room. Some reviewers have complained about there being no door to the bathroom area in the rooms. Technically, that is true, but it will not really be an issue with most people. Our reservation talked about a room with a “balcony.” What we found upon arrival that our balcony was really the open corridor to the room, which overlooked the pool and courtyard area. In the hallway corridor there was a small table attached to the wall and two chairs. My wife and I frequently used this table for our lunches and for having tea in the evening and found that the arrangement worked pretty well. Previous reviews noted that the hotel had a cat named Olivia. Even though I am a dog person, I found her to be a rather endearing animal with protruding teeth. She was an aggressive beggar that sometimes left me wondering if she was a dog trapped inside of a cat’s body. She seems to eat everything but marmalade. The pool area and lovely grounds were very well kept. On several occasions when we thought about maybe trying the pool, we noticed that a fair amount of plant debris had fallen into the pool. The pool was rarely used by people, but added to the ambience of the hotel. Other reviewers have noted that the hotel is only a few blocks from Mamita beach. Actually, the walk is more like 6 blocks, but it just seems like a lot less because much of the inviting walk is in or near the pedestrian zone, 5th Avenue, with its inviting restaurants and lively ambience. One can rent chairs at the beach at calle 28 or one can simply go south a little ways and there are free umbrellas where one can just sit on the soft sand and let the world go by. There is a huge supermarket, Mega, about a half dozen blocks from the hotel. We bought bread, fruits, cheese, sliced meat and other goodies for our lunches there. Mega likes to compare its prices to the nearby Wal-Mart and claims its prices are lower. Surprisingly, many vendors on the streets were also making the claim that their prices were lower than Wal-Mart. Restaurants for tight budget people. The Mayan bistro at Aventura Mexicana offered specials for only $5 and “two for one” drinks all day long, which turned out to be a decent meal and drinks at a bargain price. Unfortunately, in our 10-day stay, the specials only changed once so that limited the number of times we ate there. At the front desk, if one asks for a map, there is a coupon in the pamphlet for a free dessert at the Mayan bistro. The dessert is enough for two people and very nicely done. Although the restaurant lists special prices for 60 pesos or $5, if one pays in dollars, the price can become $6. The restaurant seems to follow the traditional exchange rate of only 10 pesos per dollar, which is typically found all over the streets. There are money exchange places all over Playa on 5th Avenue where they pay the real exchange rate of about 12 pesos per dollar. Consequently, while one can pay in dollars in most places, it is almost always best to pay in pesos to avoid the extra cost.. On 5th Avenue, as one goes north, there tend to be slightly cheaper restaurant prices than if one goes south. At La Fe, we found a “catch of the day” meal for only 65 pesos (about $5.50). The first time we ate there, the fish was excellent. Several days later, we went back for the same dish. My wife got the same excellent fish, while my piece was a lot less tasty and barely chewable, much to my dismay. La Fe has limited tables on the inside that resembles a campus beer bar in the U.S. The outside tables on the street are much better, but oftentimes there are no free tables and cigar smokers tended to congregate there during our stay. Many people mention Babes Noodles as a good place for dining. There are actually two of these restaurants in Playa. If one goes north on 5th Avenue from AM, the closest one is found. Babes looks inexpensive, but really is not. While I thought the food there was very good, my wife was less happy with her dinner. The 1847 restaurant right next door has more bargain dinners, and we both found the food to be pretty good. One place to maybe avoid is Aca Los or something like that near Constitution Avenue on the main drag. Their prices looked low, but the portions were so extremely small that one had to order more and more dishes to fill up and even then we went away a little hungry. Other Things. We took the ferry to Cozumel to spend a day there. Contrary to a lot of published items, the ferry did not run about every hour, but sometimes there were 3 hours between departures. We had hoped to walk around town and maybe swim on Cozumel beaches. We found the town to have none of the liveliness and ambience of Playa and quickly got tired of walking around the city. Also, there are no beaches within walking distance of the ferry dock. Ferry prices were recently increased to about $12, so round trip tickets for 2 totals about $48. Consequently, the trip for us was a bust and not worth the effort. If one is really into snorkeling (and one has to go outside of town and make arrangements for this) or diving, then Cozumel potentially has something to offer. X-caret, Tulum and Chichen Itza. We bought tickets on-line for X-caret beforehand supposedly saving 10%. But when buying the tickets on-line, a tax of about 10% gets added back on so it is dubious if buying in advance that way is worth it since it did not look like people buying at the window paid such a tax. I noticed that most people bought the “plus” package which really is not necessary. One gets snorkeling gear as part of the package, but snorkeling in the underground rivers seemed kind of silly given there is no coral or anything to look at in the river or even at the special snorkeling place as far as I could tell. I was advised that one could not bring one’s own food into the park, but no one checks bags and no one seemed to object to us eating our own food in the park. We got to the park using collectivo vans that leave from calle 2 in Playa and then taking the free shuttle bus to the park from the highway.
