When leaving at closing time, the shuttle bus did not come after waiting a long time so we took the ADO bus back to Playa even though it was a few bucks more that way. The ADO bus is the “Cancun” bus that also stops in Playa and there is only one bus at 8:45 pm. We also used the collectivo van to get to Tulum to see the ruins. One has to get off at the Arqueologica Zona before reaching Tulum itself and then walk a few blocks to get a “train” to the site or to walk another half mile to the entrance. On the trip to Chichen Itza, our bus guide promoted the buying of a pendant (“cartouche”) where one could have one’s initials/name in Mayan symbols made into a piece of jewelry (silver or silver with gold). The jewelry samples that were passed out showed good craftsmanship. My wife ordered such jewelry and found that her finished piece that was available at the end of the day was a cheap, gaudy imitation of what the sample pieces were, probably just silver plated. Fortunately, one did not have to pay in advance, and she refused to buy the piece even though most other people accepted their pieces. The price for the pendent in pesos was equivalent of $44 (based on a 12 to 1 exchange). If one had paid in dollars, the cost was $58, which again, underlined the need to pay for things in pesos.

Reviews.Title: “3rd times a charm!”
Reviews.Author: IAH
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at AM, my Mom's first stay and first time in Playa! She absolutely raved about AM! Once again the hotel has been consistent with cleanliness of rooms/common areas/bar/grounds! Friendliness of staff is so important and AM does not fall short! I booked directly thru the hotel website and recived a 25% discount for a 3 or more night stay! I might add I stayed from Oct 31st - Nov 6th! I will and have recommended this hotel to friends and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Feels like home at Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: Eco_Geezers
Reviews.Content: The easy going ambiance, courtyard style and very caring staff made our six day stay very enjoyable. The tasty free continental breakfast every mornng was an opportunity to meet other international travelers. Rooms very clean, well laid out, adequately spacious. Dinner in the restaurant was really good. Angel the bartender and Chef Marco took good care of us providing nice personal touches. Lupita took great care with upkeep of our room. Location was very good, not on the beach but within two blocks. One half block from the walking thorofare Avenida cinqo. Good safe parking is provided for cars. Internet access is provided through computer or wireless in lobby. We will return. We look forward to seeing our friends on the staff who work to make this a great little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect destination wedding home base”
Reviews.Author: WintersR4beaches
Reviews.Content: After a previous stay at the Aventura last Jan. we recommended the Aventura to be the home base for our daughter's destination wedding. The Aventura offered a very generous package for the bride and groom and the guests. They helped arrange transportation to and from Cancun airport saving us the extra airport taxi fee and went out of their way to see that our needs were met from calling taxi, rental car and tour services, to accommodating the photographer during the pre wedding photos on the beautiful grounds. The person working at the front desk is extremely helpful and accomodating. Despite the comings and goings and in room get togethers our rooms were always cleaned and at times we had mountains of trash for the housekeepers to remove. Past reviews noted that the pools were small and they are but the Aventura is not meant to be an all-inclusive. It has found it's niche and does it well. The hotel is a short walk from the beach, the restaurants and the action. I know our guests had a vacation they won't soon forget.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SvetaNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Aventura Mexicana in the end of September and had nothing but amazing experience. I booked a delux king room and in my reservation request i mentioned that i would like a room to have a romantic appeal upon our arrival, so i was absolutely amazed to find that the stuff covered our bed and bath with rose petals. Hotel is located just two blocks away from the beach and 1/2 blocks from 5th avenue (the main street in Playa). It looks like city is expanding more and more so in the nearest future it will be the prime location in town. It has two pools and multiple sundeck spaces however i haven't used any of those due to weather conditions. Besides location and clean, comfortable accommodation, i have to mention the stuff. Everybody was friendly and eager to go beyond the call of duty to make our stay more pleasant - starting with scheduling massages and trips to Chichen Itza and Cancun and recommending nice hang out places in town. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Aventura”
Reviews.Author: sonry
Reviews.Content: We Just back from a trip to Playa the end of August 2008. We booked the hotel because of the great reviews and the price. Having been to Playa twice before I knew the location well however I was surprised by the how far the restaurants and activity have moved north on 5th Ave to the area of this hotel. When I was here the year before, this part of 5th Ave was very quite, with almost no restaurants and shops. Now, however, in this area of 5th ave there are many restaurant and shops that have opened. I actually prefer it to the southern part of 5th as it is more laid back, and further south it is getting to be very fast moving with people trying to get you to thier shop or restaurant and people shopping hurrying etc. This makes the Aventura Mex 's location excellent as it is also closer to the best part of the beach. The hotel itself is very clean and the service is good. The breakfast is only toast and muffins but you could buy eggs, waffles etc for only $3 more. THe pools are small but in this catergory of hotel in Playa, that is not a resort, it is about on par with other boutique hotels. (We have stayed at the La Tourtuga hotel a botique hotel, as well as the Royal Playa Del Carmen the big all inclusive resort downtown so we have a feel for the range of accomadations in Playa.) The grounds are pleasant and inviting. We stayed on the family side of the hotel and the beds are hard but not unbearable. The room was spotless and cleaned every day with the the decor and furnisinging slightly above average. However, given the reasonable price less than $100 a day we paid, it was an excellent stay and a very good chioce for a hotel in Playa. I would not hesitate to recomend to anyone if that can get it close to the price we paid. I just hope Playa keeps developing the way it is, cosmopolitan, international, and distictly mexican, with a street level scale and accessabitly, and that it does not become a packaged corporate resort destination, indistinguishable from known offenders all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “great getaway!!”
Reviews.Author: jen_and_justin
Reviews.Content: my husband and i recently stayed at the aventura mexicana hotel in playa del carmen and absolutely loved it! it was quaint, quiet, relaxing, impeccably clean, and the room was extremely comfortable, outfitted with more amenities than we expected. the staff was courteous and very helpful, and the food at the adjoining japanese restaurant was terrific too! the hotel attracted visitors from all over the world and we enjoyed hearing conversations in Italian, French, Dutch, etc - it was definitely NOT an all-american place (which is just what we were looking for)!! the staff also recommended a great beach area that we enjoyed for several days, and though it rained our last day there the hotel was comfortable enough that we enjoyed that day just as much as the others! i would highly recommend staying at the aventura mexicana... and if my husband and i go back to playa someday we'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Playa - Hands Down”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansFineHotels
Reviews.Content: A buddy and I just got back from a diving trip in Playa and couldn't have found a better place to stay than Hotel Aventura. The staff was top notch. All of the front desk associates were so helpful when it came the best places to eat, the best deals on transportation and making sure we were always comfortable. The double/double we stayed in was always clean, thanks to the always hard working housekeeping staff. The room had a balcony that faced the street, but since the hotel is perfectly situated a block from 5th Ave. we weren't ever bothered by noise. Breakfast every morning was just enough to start the day. The orange juice was phenominal and the coffee was just how I like it. Also, there's just something about having breakfast in the gardens around the pool that make you really feel like you're on a great vacation. The free Internet in the lobby was great for sending quick emails to family and friends. Usually there was no one on the computer but if there was, waiting was no big deal. Especially when it was easy to strike up a friendly conversation with hotel staff. Diving couln't have been easier. Right next door to the hotel is Diversity Diving - one of the most friendly dive shops I've ever been to. The only problem I had was that my stay at Aventura was just not long enough. And we stayed there eight days!

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Playa”
Reviews.Author: Roadking66
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel just off 5th, at the quiet end of town and closer to Mamita's or Kool Beach Club. The rooms are spacious and well decorated. The beds are firm, but I prefer them that way. The pools are just the right size for the hotel and the "kids" and "adult" pools are separated; although there was an occasion or two where there was screaming kids in the adult pool that was not addressed by management. The breakfast was very nice and the happy hour drinks and food were good, however the dinner was EXCELLENT! I couldn't believe how empty the restaurant was with such good food? I think people just didn't know? I do suggest you purchase the optional dinner with your reservation...you can't beat the price or quality for dinner in Playa. The hotel is on Calle 24 and 5th, as you walk down 5th towards Calle 10 it gets much busier and noisier. The location of this hotel is perfect! There are many great other restaurants as well...be prepared to pay about $50 per couple for dinner and a drinks. Yaxche has great Mayan food and an amazing back patio...a must. Our best meal was at 100% natural (not just vegetarian food)...the poblano chicken was amazing and fish was great too! Non-smokers beware...Playa has many Europeans that don't mind smoking and sharing that smoke with you while walking, dining, relaxing etc. Good luck trying to enjoy a meal without having smoke blown your way. There are also many massages available for $32-$35 all over Playa. We had ours at the one next to 100%Natual...it was great! Take the ADO bus from the airport to Playa $8 (purchase ticket in the baggage claim area at airport. You can catch a cab from the bus station to the hotel for only $2 (not worth hauling your luggage yourself). We were a little disappointed with Cozumel. It felt empty and run down, many stores were closed down. We also booked a snorkeling trip there...2 reef dives...turned out to be 200 feet off 2 beaches with very little corel and a few fish...not so great. We recommend you save your money by spending your time in Playa. Kool Beach club was very nice (discount available from hotel). If you get there "early" (10:00 or earlier) you can get the covered lounge chairs for $3 per person. They sell out after that and you will pay $7 per person for a nicer covered padded lounge chair. Both are great values. Food and drink are good and reasonably priced. I would definitely recommend this hotel and playa. Playa has great beaches, restaurants, night clubs, etc, without the "spring break" feel of Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: Julie A
Reviews.Content: We booked through the hotel and reservations were seamless. Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready yet, so we just stored our things in the office and headed out. Our room was ready just before 3, and we were shown to our room, which was much larger and nicer then anticipated. We got a great rate, and I assumed it was a king room, but it ended up being a whole suite with separate sitting area. The room was simply decorated and immaculately clean. We were on the adult pool side. The bed was a standard king size and was much softer than previous Mexican hotel beds we have experienced. The pool was nice and kept clean and was never too crowded. We never had any noise problems, which was nice since we are not early risers. Overall, this hotel far surpassed our expectations. Comparatively speaking, we have also stayed in Lun. Blue, Mosq. Blue, Tortuga, and Iber. Quetzal. We both felt this hotel gave the best bang for the buck, was the quietest, and best beds. Only bad thing I can think some might have a problem with: I did notice that there were a couple of small holes in the curtains that were noticeable when closed. I think this is a small nitpicky detail, but you just never know what may bother someone. That being said, the room was always cleaned immaculately, and cleanliness is probably most important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dpgates
Reviews.Content: We stayed six nights at the Aventura Mexicana and enjoyed our stay there. The hotel seems to be a fusion of two properties with two different styles. We stayed on the "adult" side although we had two teenage daughters with us. Also saw other families on this side. We preferred the rooms and grounds on the adult side to the other one. Front desk personnel were always friendly and helpful and spoke great English. Our room was clean and nicely furnished. The A/C was more than adequate. There appeared to be an effort towards energy savings as nearly all the lightbulbs were compact fluorescents. These unfortunately made the room a little dark in places, especially over the sink. The bathroom could have used an exhaust fan (there was no window) and a towel bar. The refrigerator was nicely sized and really convenient to have available. The beach is about a 4-block walk: half block to Av. 5, 2 blocks north, 2 blocks east to beach. You get a slight discount at the Kool beach club though only on the 2nd-tier palapas/lounges. Definitely would stay here again if in PDC.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice....”
Reviews.Author: mazatlanbound
Reviews.Content: My sister in law and I came across this gem of a hotel and since it had gotten such great reviews thought we'd give a try and we are so glad we did. We booked a Superior Double / Double and it couldnt have suited us better. At first we were a little concerned about possible noise because we were given a room on the " family side" since it is where the 2 bed units are located but turned out to be a perfect room in a great location in the hotel(I dont think there is a bad location anywhere on the grounds). We were on the second floor with a balcony overlooking the "kiddie pool" and noise wasnt an issue at all even tho there seemed to be several families with children of all ages. The room is basic but very comfortable and very clean. Kept cool by a ceiling fan,A/C and a sliding glass screened door leading to the small balcony w/ 2 chairs. Your standard TV with a few English channels and several Spanish speaking channels with good reception. Hair dryer,soap,shampoo and fresh towels daily with the adorable towel animals adorned with fresh flowers left on you bed. So cute you feel kinda bad taking them apart to shower. Tile floors and a very large tile bathroom. All in perfect condition and kept sparkling clean. The grounds of the hotel are lush and green and have hidden art and statues if you take the time to explore. The restuarant are also both very good. The free breakfast at the Mayan Bistro of coffee or assorted teas and orange juice along with an assortment of pastries and toast and jam was good and plenty to start off all of our days except for 1 when we ordered a hot meal from them menu that was very tasty and inexpensive. We also had a late lunch here of a fish fillet which was very good and again reasonably priced. The sushi restaurant also located on their grounds offered up some mighty fine noodle soup. The staff were all kind and helpful. One employee who was often at the front desk whos name I cant remember (but really wish I did so I could put in a good word for him) actually ran down the street and around the corner in the middle of a pouring rainstorm on the day of our check out to hail us a cab to the bus station as the phone lines were all busy. Another front desk employee helped us book the Submarine tour in Cozumel which made it so easy even telling us what the range of the cab should cost to get us from the ferry to the sub shop. The hotel location is 1/2 block to the quiter end of 5th ave and the beach is about a 3 minute walk. The hotel felt very safe and has 24 hour desk staff and night time security guards just in case. This is a wonderful hotel and dont let their less than the average rates scare you off. After seeing many of the other hotels we had checked into that were much higher priced I am so glad we stayed here. Big bang for little buck. If you are looking for lush,plush, pamper me silly this place probably isnt for you. But if you like to be comfortable,safe and relaxed it will fit your every need. I told the desk clerk I didnt want let anybody know how great this hotel is cause I didnt want word to get out about them and have their rates go up but alas I always look to Trip Advisor for reviews to help me make my lodging decisions and it's only right that I hopefully help someone else make a great hotel choice for their trip to the beautiful Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “satisfied with Adventura”
Reviews.Author: travelmaniaAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Adventura is a great hotel for somebody on a budget. For the price, you definitely get what you pay for! The staff is very helpful and friendly. The cleaning service was great. The location was fantastic...a little away from the noise of fabulous 5th Avenue but close enough that you can walk in less than minute. Whenever we return to Playa del Carmen, we would definitely consider staying at Adventura again...unless we have a lot more money, then we'll stay at a luxury hotel. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: Mariangela
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 wonderful nights at Hotel Aventura Mexicana. We are a family of 4, with a 12-year-old boy and a 4-year-old girl. The hotel perfectly met the needs of all the 4 of us and provided a wonderful stay. The family pool was super pleasant, clean and perfect for the kids to safely enjoy it. The adult pool is surrounded by beautiful gardens and great architecture. Very few people are in the pools at the same time, so both pools always feel very private and peaceful. The hotel is charming, inviting and cozy. The rooms are spacious and very clean. We did not find the beds hard at all. The people at the front desk are extremely friendly and accommodating. The service provided by everyone who works at the hotel is top notch. Thank you to all of them!! Breakfast is very nice. The Mexican pastries and sweet breads are a nice touch. Orange juice is fresh. The setting of the restaurant is very pretty. The menu for dinner is great, a little pricey, but that is common in Playa. The food is great!!! Happy hour is a great time to enjoy delicious drinks by the pool and relax in paradise. We rented a car while in the area and were able to explore the more secluded beaches of Akumal and Tulum. Paradise! The SUPERB location of the hotel allowed us to enjoy the adventure that the jungle offers, the beauty of the Mayan ruins, the great beaches of the Riviera Maya and the fun and eclectic night life of Playa del Carmen. We did a lot and it was very affordable! The rates that this hotel offers are excellent. You get a lot for your money. Enjoy your trip!!! We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Gem”
Reviews.Author: mgross2002
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and two other couples spent 5 nights at the Aventura. We had a fantastic time. The rooms were large and very comfortable. My husband likes to sleep with the air conditioner on and he was so happy to find that the Aventura's air conditioners can deliver an icy cold room when he wants it! We ate breakfast every morning at the resturant and it was delicious and the staff so very friendly and helpful. The pools were a wonderful oasis after a long day at the beach. And to have drinks deliver to you at the pool was wonderful! The Mojotios were my favorite, made right before you from the freshest ingredients. My mouth waters just thinking of it. On top of the lovely amenities and great service, the best thing about the Aventura is the location. Everything we could possibly want or need was just footsteps from the Hotel. Whether it was the beach which is just a short 2 blocks away, or live music at night at a Club on 5th Ave or shopping, you never had to worry, it is all just around the corner or a few blocks away. It was a wonderful vacation get-away and I am already planning my next trip to Playa and you can be sure, I will be staying at the Hotel Aventura Mexicana - it has everything I need!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Downtown Playa”
Reviews.Author: rleonard74
Reviews.Content: This hotel was all that I expected and more. We were looking for something that gave a more authentic Mexico experience than an all-inclusive and this place fit the bill. The hotel was just as beautiful as the pictures with lots of flowers and lush vegetation arranged very pleasingly inside a Spanish Hacienda style courtyard. The hotel was pretty quiet considering it is located between 5th & 10th avenues. The other nice thing was that it did not strike me as a type of hotel that would be frequented by the typical party crowd. The rooms were always clean. The pillows were awesome, but the bed was bit hard, which is typical for hotels, so I was not surprised. Our room was also stocked with a 5 gallon bottle of water, which I found to be very nice. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The maid created different towel sculptures each day that seemed to get better as the tips kept flowing (I recommend 10 pesos per person, per day). All in all, I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would consider going back there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place , great location, good staff, would return here”
Reviews.Author: SFvegetarian
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Hotel Aventura Mexicana from June 7-11th, 2008. We checked in 2 hours early with no problem, and the friendly staff assisted with our bags to our room (104) on the adult side. The room was small, clean, pleasant, and dimly lit, as other reviews have stated, but was more than adequate. There was a small TV, a working A/C, a small safe, a decent sized fridge, and a small table out on the sidewalk, which served as our patio. There are 2 pools, a large jacuzzi (which broke down during our visit), 2 sundecks, free internet, free continental breakfast,and nice towel arrangements daily. We enjoyed the continental breakfast, but the $3.50-5.00 breakfast is much better. We had nothing whatsoever to complain about here. All of the employees were attentive and the place was nice, friendly, clean and quiet. It also is very close to 5th avenue, and then the beach. I believe we paid about $70 a night, and we feel we got a great bargain. I will definitely come back and stay there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Best service during our 2 week trip”
Reviews.Author: audreymc13
Reviews.Content: We had not heard anything about this hotel, but picked it randomly for a short 2 night stay. We liked it so much, we brought our family back there for an additional 2 nights at the end of our trip. Great location, great service, good food and nice ambiance. The front desk clerk was a great guy. He was very helpful, spoke great English and even tried to carry my bags for me (both times we stayed there). I speak Spanish but appreciated his effort. The free morning breakfast was listed as the same "continental" breakfast all the other hotels in the area offered. However, the orange juice was fantastic! And the "pan dulce" (sweet bread) was a great addition. The rooms were small and humble but clean. They had safes, a/c units with remote control & cable tv in each room. There was free internet access in the lobby, which made it easy to check our flights and email. Finally, my favorite part of it all was the view. Despite the fact that it was in the center of town - it was gorgeously floral & green with two pools. And only one block from the shopping strip, two from the beach. I'd definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at the Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: arcticfox54
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week vacation at the Aventura Mexicana. My wife & I have stayed in small and medium sized hotels all over the world and we rate this as one of the best. The staff at the main desk were fantastic. Antonio, Gimena & Jose were always willing to assist, and always with a sincere and friendly smile. After a few days we came to know them personally and looked forward to seeing them. Jose, thanks for the Spanish language lessons! The room, courtyard, pool, and restaurants were always spotless, the atmosphere was quiet and peaceful, and the entire staff were polite and friendly. We looked forward to seeing Gloria's new towel sculpture each day. What a really nice added touch! We will certainly be back, and will most definitely recommend to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Playa”
Reviews.Author: EK1Toronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. Staff were very friendly, rooms were a good size and very clean. One of the rooms had a fridge which was a great treat. Small pool, continental breakfast, towels for the beach, free internet at any time rounded out a great stay. It's fairly conveniently located, meaning steps from 5th avenue yet far enough away from the action that you could easily get some sleep in the evenings. You couldn't beat the price either.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found”
Reviews.Author: YoungCharlie
Reviews.Content: Great Location in the middle of everything in Playa yet completly private. A short pleasent stroll to beautiful beaches and world class quisine. The property itself is a romantic hide- a- way. Sipping the best mojoitos in Mexico poolside in a perfectly manicured tropical setting was a highlight of our stay at Hotel Aventura Mexicana. The two restaurants are excellent and very affordable with excellent service. The room was immaculate with all the necessary amenities. Front desk service was outstanding. We will definitely return to this property!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: wdl
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at Aventura Mexicana. It is overall a nice hotel and we enjoyed our stay. We booked through the hotel website. They had a good rate of about $78 a day for a room with two beds (we have two little children with us) on their website, but even a better rate if you stay 5 nights or longer (25% discount). It would cheaper to book for 5 nights (and stay 4) then it was to book 4 nights. However, since the difference was not too much, and I wanted to avoid confusion, I simply booked 4 nights and paid the 50% deposit. A couple of weeks later, I found out through the website that they had a better deal, so now a 3 night stay would be entitled for a 25% discount. I called the toll free number and was able to have my rate discounted 25%. That was awesome! The check in was simple. No bell boys, you carry your bags, although the reception gave us a hand - we had to climb some stairs. The room was decent, had two beds, the AC was working, there was a mini fridge (don't set the temperature too low, we had our yogurt frozen). We were on the family side of the hotel. You can reach the adult side through their restaurant, the Mayan Bistro. I've heard that the rooms at the adult side were way better, but we had kids, so we got to stick with our rooms. At any rate, the hotel grounds were beautiful and well maintained. They have several pools and spas. They have a limited amount of parking spaces but we were always able to find parking. They have a free computer with internet in the lobby. The maid cleaned our room well, did the nice towel art sculptures but some days forgot to bring us the extra towels for the kids. Breakfast was in the Mayan Bistro. Continental breakfast is included and it's decent. You can help yourself with toast (white and wheat bread), several types of pastries (mostly croissants), coffee, cream, orange juice, butter, jam. You can also order hot food from 35 pesos to 50 pesos (note: the hotel website offers you to buy full breakfast for an additional 50 pesos pp per day - I recommend you to skip it, you can always buy it on the day if you wish). The location is one of the best things of the hotel. It is located North of the Constituyentes in an area named Little Italy, very close to fifth avenue. The area is nice, is a bit cheaper (slices of pizza costs 13 pesos, as opposed to 20 pesos on the other side of Constituyentes), less crowded but not less vibrant. There is a Ciao Gelato, a babe noddles, and even a little gem of a libanese restaurant beside babe noddles. You are also 2 blocks from Ah Cacao, some of the best desserts in PDC. Constituyentes is a major road that links fifth avenue to the freeway, but has less traffic than its sibling in the south, Juarez. I also found that parking is easier in this area. It is also close to some of the best stretch of beach in Playa where two of the best beach clubs are located: Kool and Mamitas. We have little children, so we don't need to be right on the action, just close, and that's where we were. Service is good. Maid cleaned the room pretty well, however, we wished she hasn't forgotten the towels for the kids. Also one day the AC broke down. We notified the reception, she went to check the AC, called the technician. By the time we were back from dinner, the AC was functional again. My only quibble, in addition to the missing towels for the kids, was that the room feels a little bit in need for a renovation. There were some cracked and stained tiles, and the shower curtain would not block the water from flooding the bathroom floor. Some reviews seem to point that the rooms on the adult side are way better. I believe so. However, because of the hotel was such a bargain, I thought it was an excellent value. I would probably deduct a star or two from the ratings if I have to pay high season rates for that room.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: drdiamond
Reviews.Content: As a first timer to Playa del Carmen I am thrilled to have chosen this gem. It is small, very clean and well done. There are many really expensive hotels and many dumps. This hotel is very well priced and I think you get the biggest bang for your buck. The employees are very good too. Front desk managers Antonio & Javier were very informative and friendly. The hotel has a nice sushi bar, I think its the only one in Playa. Great, great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Gringo Gem!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steffie326
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed that this lovely Hotel. It is located on the North side of the 5th Ave, strip (between 5th and 10th) on Calle 24. This was a great location since it was just up from all the action, but still set off enough not to be disturbed by the crowd on 5th Ave. during the evening. The room was clean and efficient with an AC and 2 ceiling fans in the HOT climate of Mexico. The pool was nice and the restaurant was great for breakfast, snacks and, of course, meals. All prices were very reasonable. Happy Hour every day has a 2 for 1 special. The Hotel is just a few blocks walk to the beach. The Hotel gives a discount ticket for the KOOL Beach Club. One thing to note, in Mexico toilet paper cannot be paced in the toilet when flushing. The Hotel should have told us this when we checked in. Unfortunately the front desk did not, and the room-maid had to be called to unclog the toilet. Fortunately, there was just a little bit of paper which needed to be cleaned out from a "small deposit" which thankfully did go down the drain and was not blocked by the toilet paper. My husband and I stayed on the "adult side" of the hotel which was free of any loud playing kids. The grounds of the Hotel has a "garden setting" atmosphere which is nice to enjoy, sit and relax. There is an upper lounge balcony which can be used to take the sun, enjoy a drink, or just sit and relax. There is always nice Mexican style music playing on the Hotel's outside sound system. The staff is helpful and friendly. Compared to similar Hotels is the area, the price of this Hotel was very affordable and offers discount specials which makes this a great find for the money (we paid $65 USD per nite with 1 nite free booking directly on the Hotel's website). All guests were of a mature age group (no young spring breakers). You will love your stay.

Reviews.Title: “17 years coming to Playa - Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: unpacking
Reviews.Content: I've first came to Playa when it was still a smallish fishing village and would stay in really downscale hotels. Over the years and probably 12 visits later I've moved up the quality scale and I could not be happier with this hotel. Many of the places I've stayed over the years are gone but I know the price range for different levels and this one is about right. I was a bit anxious about being billed the full rental in advance but it all alleviated as soon as my partner and I walked into the place. By the way, this place is not gay but noticeably gay friendly. It is family oriented on one side but the environment was safe and quiet. The front desk clerk is very cute...lol. Anyway, the best thing about this hotel aside from the nice clean room and firm bed is the wireless network. So if you travel with a laptop, this place is great. I write this review sitting on my bed facing the swimming pool in my really cold air conditioned room. The network is fast enough that I download my daily fix of iTunes newscasts ON VIDEO! Nice broadband speed. I was even able to use Skype every day to make phone calls from the comfort of our room. The connection was not perfect for phone calls but good enough that I was able to transact business back home via audio connection. The cute front desk clerk was very clear when we checked in that the Internet wireless connection was not stable but in our 5 day stay we never experienced down time. The wireless connection always worked. However, cute guy said it depends on the room location. Seems the hub is in the restaurant in the adult section and since our room was close, we lucked out. Worst case, you just sit in the lovely patio and get online. There is another wireless network in the reception area. Make sure you get the WEP security password when you check in. What else to say? I got certified for Open Water Diving with the training taking place right outside my room in the pool. The training was by the guys at Diversity Diving which has a shop next door. Despite it's name, it is also NOT GAY owned (I guess at least). By the master divers were friendly and didn't seem to be uncomfortable with my partner and I. This is an added plus to this hotel if you want to get certified to scuba dive. Location is great. Far enough from the busiest part of the main drag but still in the center of activity. Actually it seems that the hippest part of Playa has moved in this direction. I found all the staff helpful except for a wake up call that never happened. I almost missed my dive! But they successfully relayed messages between my partner and I or our dive instructors. When you come to Mexico, remember that tipping is customary. Tip everyone and your experience will be much happier. I get the impression that people who don't have positive things to say about this place are probably difficult, unpleasant people themselves. Anyway, my partner and I check out tomorrow morning but I think I will be back before the end of the year and I will be rebooking here at Aventura Mexicana. It's not high luxury but as luxurious and comfortable as I need or want. If you want the diamond treatment, go stay at some all inclusive resort. But for my buck, this place is perfect. Thank you to the staff for making it a great experience. Playa isn't the town I fell in love with almost 20 years ago but it still has the charm and chill that keeps me coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lee_Bu
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for a few days at the Aventura Mexicana in early April on the adult side. Our room was very nice and the staff was fantastic. We had a small problem with our shower but this was repaired during the day while we were out. The promptness of this was very nice. The continental breakfast was good. Nothing fancy but it allows you to bum around and relax before heading out for touristy stuff.

Reviews.Title: “Buffy from Ottawa Ontario Canada”
Reviews.Author: PLAYA01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel over the past 6 years and i have to say it is one of the best locations, clean, safe, friendly, and a nice split for singles with an adult side, and families on the other side... The staff are very warm and loving towards me as i feel more than a guest when i stay here. I travel alone there all the time and always feel safe. I hope they continue to grow and do well as i like to rely on there great service. see you all soon, Buffy Code

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at Hotel Aventura Mexicana”
Reviews.Author: dawnzascorp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from an amazing nine-night stay at Hotel Aventura Mexicana in Playa del Carmen. This was our third trip to the Riviera Maya. Previously we have stayed in two different all-inclusives, so this was our first time trying a hotel that was NOT all-inclusive. Our experience couldn't have been nicer. We had a room with a king-sized bed on the "family side" of the hotel. In general, it was very quiet, although there was a group of noisy people the first two nights we were there. After they left, it was blissfully peaceful. The front desk staff were always friendly and helpful. One of the very best things about Aventura Mexicana is how CLEAN it is. Our housekeeper did an excellent job every day, and left us beautiful towel art as well. We constantly saw staff cleaning around the pool area and on the grounds. We usually used the adult pool to cool off after a day on the beach. It was so refreshing. We also loved Aventura Mexicana's location. It is close to everything...just a few blocks from Mamita's Beach and a hop, skip, and jump away from Fifth Avenue with lots of restaurants and shops. The continental breakfast every morning was perfect for us...good strong coffee plus delicious toast and jam. We met some very nice people who also were staying at the hotel, too. This was in huge contrast to some of the people we've met before at all-inclusives. The "icing on the cake" is Olivia, the hotel cat. She joined us for breakfast every morning and really made us feel better about leaving our cats behind at home! We really can't say enough great things about this property and their staff. We hope to return very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from Mar 5-10. I booked my room on the hotel website. I received an excellent rate of $65/nite USD for booking five nights and paying in advance. Paying in advance was not an issue. I have been to PDC many times and know the area well. My room rate included daily breakfast and beach towels for two. The staff at this hotel were very friendly and helpful. From the desk staff to the chambermaids to the maintenance guys. My chambermaid was a sweet woman. The first day I noticed the floor was dirty from the construction dust blowing in from across the street. I left her a note in my broken Spanish asking her to please mop the floor. When I returned to my room later that day, not only had she scrubbed the floors but the entire terrace as well!! I spoke with her every day after that and she took good care of me. (Don't forget to tip the maids.) My room was awesome! I had room 402, the VIP deluxe adult room. This hotel has a family side and an adults only side. Nice. My room was actually not a room at all, but a small house with a private terrace. Pictures are attached. It had windows on all sides. It was light, airy and large. The room featured a sitting area, king bed, sink, dishes, microwave, filtered water cooler, refrigerator, coffeemaker, stereo, telephone, cable TV with lots of channels(which was great the day it poured rain), cold A/C, hot water, good water pressure, lots of closet space, a huge bathroom WITH a door. The private terrace was just off the adult sundeck and had its own chaise lounges, table, umbrella and chairs. It was a great place to start the morning. This hotel is located in a part of PDC known as Little Italy. There are lots of fantastic Italian restaurants as well as many other cuisines. Try Babe's for Asian/Swedish fusion. It rocks. The mojitos are great! My first day, I made the three block walk to Mega (like Super WalMart) to stock up on snacks, beer and sunscreen. I spent $30USD and was set for the week. The hotel grounds are lush and green is everywhere. Both pool areas are nice and the restaurant sits within the hotel grounds. It is a nice place to spend an afternoon chilling out. They have a 2-for-1 happy hour daily. The adult sundeck is nice and large, overlooking the pool area. The lobby has a small sitting area with a small library, materials on what to see and do in the area and a computer with internet access. I checked my email every day and there were always people hanging out here enjoying conversation. The hotel is only a five minute walk to both Mamita's and Kool beach clubs. Both are great places to sun, swim, eat, drink, chill out and watch the people of the world walk by. Don't forget to stop by the front desk and grab your beach towels before you go. The only drawback was the daily construction going on across the street from my room. This is no fault of Hotel Aventura Mexicana's. Though construction didn't usually begin until well after 9am each day, the pounding was intense in the afternoons. This made it difficult to enjoy a siesta or do some reading on the terrace. No worries, I just hung at the beach longer. PDC is experiencing tremendous growth right now so no matter what corner you turn, there will be construction. Head to the beach, you'll be fine. As I checked out of the hotel, the clerk asked how my stay was and if I would return. I told him that I would and that I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great if get what promised”
Reviews.Author: gsmoke
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay the maid was really kicking us out upon check out. I wanted to stay another week or two. I was very upset the day we arrived. We booked thru Hotels.com on the adult side of the hotel. When we confirmed on the 800 # still promised adult part of the hotel. MAKE SURE TO RE CONFIRM !!!! Of course the date we check in "the only problem we dont have a room on the adult side...only on family side" NO the seahorse bed spred is not my style. There are not many children just think the hotels are very different on each side. We did get our dream vacation. THe staff was great. The hotel is so pretty. Kool beach club is great, just make sure you see the front desk before heading to the beach for a coupon for a discount chairs. We had so much fun. I would go back tomorrow.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon !!!”
Reviews.Author: ankope
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Aventura Mexicana when we were on our honeymoon i Playa del Carmen i january/february and we liked it very much. The hotel is very clean and quiet, but still close to everything in Playa: the beach, restaurants, fifth avenue and stores of all kind. The staff is very friendly and helpful, and they let us stay in our room till the middle of the day, on our check out day, allthough their check-out time is at 11, which was great and very helpful. We stayed in the adult area of the hotel, which is close to a big pool and the restaurant/bar. Every morning we got a new sculpture made of towels, which the nice cleaning ladies made. They even made small sculptures with the toiletpaper, which was really funny and creative. The room is equiped with a frigirator and aircondition, which was nice in the very hot and humid days. We found the bed perfect, eventhough people here remarked that the beds were a bit hard, we think they were just perfect. Our only remark goes to the breakfast, because the free continental breakfast contains the same thing every day: coffe/tea, juice, croissant, toast and the same kind of marmelade. It was nice the first few days, but we stayed there for 13 days, and we would have liked a bit variation in the pastry, or if they added youghurt a day or two. There was a possibility to upgrade the breakfast for $5, but if you don't eat much in the mornings, its a bit much for a bowl of youghurt or a piece of fruit. But the food it self was very tasty and nice- no doubt. When staying at the Aventura Mexicana, you realy get what you expect, a nice clean and quiet hotel for a very favorable price, with friendly staff and close to the beach and the 5 Avenue. Tips: make sure to visit the "Crepe Factory" just around the corner, which has great crepes and the best Jugos (friut juice/smoothie) in town! We bought one every morning and took it to the beach. Besides of being incredibly tasty and healthy, the Jugo stayed cool until the middle of the day and was very refreshing. Uhmmm I could drink one of those right now. Another tip is not to go to the beaches nearer the "center", they are crowded and a bit smelly. Personally we found the best beaches a bit north of the Kool beachclub, a bit near the SHangri-la Hotel and eve further away. Alla in all, a great hotel, a great town and a great country! We would recommend the hotel and Playa any time, and are planning on visiting Mexico again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience !”
Reviews.Author: joan_n_pat
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Adventura Mexicana exceeded our expectations. Found on the net while looking at Purple Roofs for gay/lesbian friendly. Staff was friendly, room and property was very clean. Pool was nice. Resturant was cute. Location was great. Half block off 5th was quiet but close to the action. Beach was a short walk. This was our first time in Mexico and the first few days spent in playa at AM was a great start !

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cody581
Reviews.Content: This place is so clean and has a nice little pool and restaurant on the adult side. We stayed in the casa on the roof and had our own patio with view of the gardens. Breakfast is not bad but not worth paying for. There are better options in local restaurants nearby. Their two for one cervezas in the restaurant during happy hours are a deal! The hotel offers free internet and you can even get a massage on sight:Just ask the front desk guy to look after it. The beach is only two blocks away and the beach is fantastic at that spot! The hotel offers a discount coupon for Kool Beach Club. We sat under palapas and lounge chairs for about 60 pesos a day! The famous fifth avenue is right there but you are removed enough to not hear the all night noise coming from fifth avanue. Staff are friendly. The hotel is still gay friendly. Ask for the "Gay Guide" at the front desk. It actually exists. We bought Starbucks coffee grinds from around the corner and made coffee in our cabin every morning. This place is a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: namatovu77
Reviews.Content: The Aventura Mexicana was a treat to stay at -- speedy check-in, clean and stylish rooms, and lovely verandas and rooftops for sunbathing or sipping a margaritas as we watched the sun go down. Although the hotel is close to everything -- restaurants, beaches, shops -- it is relatively quiet. We stayed in the "adult" section, but never really saw any children around in any part of the hotel. The hotel staff were very friendly and offered useful travel tips. We had the free European breakfast, but I would recommend upgrading (unless croissants are enough to fill you up for the morning). And the only complaint I would have is that our shower rarely had hot water -- it wasn't huge deal, since the weather was so hot and humid -- but something to be aware of. I would definitely recommend Aventura Mexicana to anyone looking to stay in Playa del Carmen for a reasonable price. We had a wonderful time and would come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: sgbslo
Reviews.Content: I recenlty spent two nights at the Aventura and was pleased overall. I was in Playa to help a friend move into a house she'd bought about 30 minutes south. We were just staying at the hotel until we were able to the house habitable so our perspective wasn't really as vacationers. My room was on the ground floor of the adult side and was spacious and comfortable. The sliding glass doors made for a bit of lack of privacy. The mattress was a little hard but I slept fine. The air conditioning worked very well and my room was always comfortable. One morning the shower water was barely warm and the next morning it was better but still not very hot. The staff members were all pleasant. The continental breakfast was simple but fine for us. We were out shopping for household items during the day and didn't have time to go to the beach, but it's a short walk. Fifth Avenue with many shops and restaurants is just steps away. The grounds are very nice and well-cared for and the restaurant and lobby have a nice charm to them. The rates are generallly good here and I would suggest this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC !”
Reviews.Author: calypso1v
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from Aventura Mexicana I am in no doubt that this is the most charming of hotels with all the necessary atributes that makes it the perfect oasis in Playa del Carmen at which to stay......and at a reasonable price. This hotel is a true gem and I am nervous to recommend it on the basis that I may not be able to get a room in the future! However I am willing to take the chance. I stayed in a Junior Suite which was just perfect - with a hugely ( and huge! ) comfortable bed ( the last Playa hotel I visited had one not unlike a rock! ) and with the added bonus of fridge, coffee/tea/microwave and endless drinking water, I was "as happy as Larry" The service overall was simply charming and wholly prfessional, whether it was the lovely maid Lupita ,whose attention to detail was faultless thoughout the 10 days, or the reception team who were helpful and accomodating to the "n" th degree at all times. The bar and restaurant team were just LOVELY and made the popular bar just the place it should be in terms of either enjoying a superbly made pre dinner cocktail or a romantic dinner by the pool - in short, a treat coupled with the opportunity to meet other guests from around the globe just perfect for me as a single traveller ......or anyone else for that matter! The Aventura Mexicana should not be missed !

Reviews.Title: “Really nice place”
Reviews.Author: BillyandNic
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice small hotel. The rooms are lovely, the pool is nice (though cold!), the staff are super friendly and it is in a good location - close enough to get to the action but not so close you can hear it all night. There is free internet, a stack of books and you can book tours etc there. You can also get a discount at a nearby beach club when you want to move from the pool to the ocean. The bathrooms do kind of let the place down a little - although really nice, the water pressure was almost non-existant and the hot water was sporadic. When you´re on holiday in a place as hot as Playa, you really want a decent shower at the end of the day and it was disappointing not to have one. Also there are no doors on the bathrooms, which although it looks pretty, is a little unsettling when you are sharing a room - no matter how close you are to the person you are sharing with! We got a really good rate through the hotel website which made it good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: desertporter
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel and airfare through Travelocity. The room we selected was the least expensive of the rooms offered so we anticipated that we might need to upgrade. The "cheaper" room was in the family section. The room was street level with a window facing the street and door in a dark hall. It was nothing special, if not a bit gloomy so we asked to be moved. For an additioinal 20 dollars a night we transfered to the "adult side" of the hotel. This room was also street level, but the sliding door faced the pool and garden and was much lighter and brighter. We were pleased with the new room, and 20 bucks per night was not too much more to pay. All the staff members we met were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was just enough to get us started for our day. We did not pay the additional 5 dollars for the hot meal, but it looked good and several other groups seemed to be enjoying the food. We did not dine at the main restaurant but did try the sushi place. The sushi was better than most and was always busy. We did like the hotels location and ended up walking everywhere (including from and back to the ADO bus station with our luggage). There is a charming "hotel cat" Olivia who kept me from missing my cats at home by requiring (ane getting) a lot of attention. This hotel was fine for the money. The only problem we had was our room key would not open the door on Sunday evening and we had to wait over an hour for someone from maintenance to come and fix the lock. There are so many other hotels in the area for around the same price that when we return we would like to try one of them, not because of anything wrong with the Aventura, but just to try something else.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: PaulLdn
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start... this hotel is absolutely wonderful... it's small, friendly, cozy, brilliantly located, very clean and safe, very comfortable... what else can I say? It's gorgious and very good value for money. The staff are ones of the most friendly people I have ever met while travelling. They are always happy to help. The only (minor) negative thing I would comment on is that breakfast started at 8am which I found a little bit too late when I was picked up at 7.30 or 7.40 to go to excursions. There is a dive shop right next to the hotel which is fantastic. It's called diversity diving. Ask for either Carlos or Hans when you get there. They speak all major languages between them and they are extremely professional and friendly. I did 12 dives with them and never felt so safe and welcome. Their rates are very reasonable and competitive and their equipment is very well maintained. I would highly recommend both the hotel and the dive shop with no hesitation... I think I'll go back there and this is the first time I want to go back to a place I have visited before...!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: suitesibby
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old daughter and I had never been to Mexico, and wanted something smaller and more charming that what we'd heard about Cancun. We found Aventura Mexicana on the net. It was meticulously clean, quiet, and overall just lovely. We were steps away from the main street, and a few blocks to the most gorgeous beach ever. Our breakfasts are the only meals we ate at the hotel, and they were fantastic. We were so happy that we didn't pick one of the hotels on the main street. I would go back to this hotel in a minute, and have reccommended it to friends. Truly a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Getaway”
Reviews.Author: BigSteve45
Reviews.Content: Deciding to return to Playa Del Carmen for a third year in a row was not a difficult decision. The price of the trip was so good we planned on staying for 2 more nights. Our hotel of choice is the Hotel Aventura Mexicana. About 1 month before departure I emailed the manager and learned that the hotel had been sold. I feared the worst because this is the one hotel in Playa that truly welcomes all guests regardless of their sexual orientation. The manager reassured me the Hotel was still as friendly as ever and he was right. The Aventura Mexicana in now one with the adjoining hotel and nothing has changed. The rooms, grounds, pool, jacuzzis and all areas of the hotel are always spotless and the entire staff is still there and as friendly as ever. I love this place because unlike the mega-resorts a traveler can get to know people who live and work in Playa. The location makes it a perfect place for anyone venturing out, in or around the area and the hotel is always a great place to come back to for rest and relaxation after a long day of exploring. The food is great, drinks are excellent and service is way over the top. I only hope the new owners continue to recognize the great leadership of the general manager and allow him to keep this little piece of paradise just as it is - a charming and relaxing place that calls me back year after year.

Reviews.Title: “What a delight!!!!”
Reviews.Author: goplaya
Reviews.Content: Where to begin? My boyfriend and I had a fantastic time in Playa and a wonderful stay at Aventura Mexicana! The staff was extremely helpful, friendly and so welcoming. They helped us book some great day trips without pushing one more than another. The room was bright and super clean and once we got used to having no bathroom door, we were just fine (the family side has doors). Pools are small, but so refreshing. Gardens are lush, tropical and well cared for. Great day trips booked by the hotel: 1. Xelha-for fun in the water in an eco-friendly water park with great food. A bit pricey but if you spend the whole day and do it all, it's well worth it! 2. Day trip to Chichen-Itza, one of the the Mayan ruin sites, including tour, lunch and swimming in a cenote (definately swim in a cenote whenever you can!) 3. Horseback riding-if you're into the outdoors, no-frills and lots of local history, try a horseback ride at Ximbal. Restaurants we recommend: Babes-a great noodle shop, awesome menu and prices. Carboncitas-reasonably priced Mexican, friendly staff, no-frills, delicious. Crepe places are great, in general, especially the one next to the hotel. La Cueva de Chango-beautiful, cool spot off the beaten path, great for breakfast, lunch or dinner. The Blue Parrot-for drinks and fire show (show starts at around 11:00pm) General tips: Kool beach club (connected with Aventura)-bring a towel from the hotel and rent chairs under an umbrella right on the beach. $3 a person with discount from hotel. Great deal as you have access to showers, bathrooms, waitservice, restaurant and pool). Beaches are gorgeous! Walmart (I know, there are other big grocery stores, too)- a bit of a walk but great for groceries, bottled water and believe it or not, Mexican baked goods. Keep plenty of botted water in your hotel room. Bargain-don't pay full price for any souvenirs. Bargain your heart a way! Things are expensive in Playa, but you don't need to get ripped off! We are already planning a trip back to Playa and Aventura Mexicana-we can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scuba-in-Cuba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Aventura Mexicana for 3 nights in May. The guys (and gals) at the reception desk were really helpful and friendly, and allowed us to check-in a few hours early. Our room was on the ground floor, by the pool which meant that it wan't very private. When we were in the room we had to keep the curtains closed, or it felt like we were in a goldfish bowl. We could have just asked to switch rooms, but my husband couldn't be bothered. The room was spotlessly clean, but smelled mildewy, I think that it was from the curtains. I don't know if that is true of all of the rooms, or just ours. The fact that there was no bathroom door was a little annoying, and I am pretty certain that people outside could see you sitting on the toilet if the curtains were open. The pool is small, but you really just need somewhere to cool off after spending the day in the sun. They have lots of sun loungers up on the 1st floor terrace which they didn't tell us about, we just found them by accident. Free beach towels are available at the front desk, so you don't have to take your own. Free internet access is available in the lobby which is a bonus, it's a good place to plan your trips. Breakfast is served from 8am, which we found to be a little late, we wanted to be on the road at 8am. We made good use of the happy hour in the bistro from 4 - 7. The hotel is in a really good location, just off 5 ave. In the evenings we would stroll down 5 ave to the restaurants and bars and then end the evening with a Mayan hot chocolate at cafe cocoa just around the corner from the hotel (it's so delicious, you must try it). We really did like this hotel, it's in such a good location and we were made to feel very welcome. If we had just switched rooms when we got there, this review may have been more positive.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic inexpensive get away”
Reviews.Author: girliegirl71
Reviews.Content: We stayed from May 12-15th 2007 and loved it. Checking in was easy and the staff very nice. The hotel is divided into two. First area you walk through is the family section with small pool for the kids. We only saw two kids the days we were there and they looked like they were having a fun time. I would not recomend this place for families with very little ones though. There is also a restaurant in that section that we did not try out but saw a number of people eating there. As we entered the Adult Section of the pool we really liked all the beautiful trees, plants and flowers. Our room was on the 3rd floor. No elevators and steep steps so if you have a disability make sure you ask for a ground floor. Our room was very clean and bright. Fixtures are not new looking and some of the chairs outside our room looked like they should be replaced but that really didnt bother us much at all considering we thought it was nice that we had chairs and a table right outside our room where we could sit and relax after a day at the beach or at night before we went to bed. Bathrooms do not have doors and the walls do not go all the way up to the ceiling so if your shy which I am you will have to ask your companion to step outside for a bit. Was not a problem for us at all. Pools and jacuzzis are nice and clean and I noticed the pool guys cleaning it every day without bothering the guests. The Mayan Bistro restaurant was very nice too. We went there almost right away after we checked in to have a couple drinks. Their Happy Hour had not started yet but we did take it advantage of it when we got back from the beach. It is buy a margarita get one free between 4 and 7pm. Very delicious coconut margarita!!! We ate there the 1st night. We really liked their tortilla soup and we both had the special which was either fish or steak and we thought it was just o.k. I would just order from their regular menu next time. The ambiance though we both thought was very romantic. Dim lights nice music and great service. Short walk to the beach maybe 10 minute walk depending on fast you want to get their and what we liked is that it was close to Kool's and Mamita's beach clubs. Very close to all the fun stuff on 5th ave. The hotel was on a nice quiet street too so if you like silence at night when going to sleep this is a great hotel too to stay. We can not wait to go back to Playa del Carmen and stay at Aventura Mexicana again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: carlangas
Reviews.Content: Quaint place with excellent location, 2 pools. It's not a luxury place, be ready to haul your bags some pretty steep stairs specially if you're on the top floor. Staff is very friendly and accomodating. It is a gay tolerant establishment. Things to improve are water pressure and the breakfast. Best to not buy the inhouse breakfast and go for the excellent crepe place next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: dc2511
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Aventura Mexicana in April and it was convenient, quiet, and comfortable. This hotel has a great location -- everything walking distance, a few feet to restaurants, 3 blocks to a gorgeous beach, but not quite in the busiest section of Avenue 5. Nice inner courtyards with 2 restaurants and several pools, which you can generally have to yourself. Rooms had basic amenities, but were reasonably priced and clean. The staff were patient and attentive and gave us lots of good advice on where to go and how to get there. We were very happy with our stay and would recommend this hotel as a good value and base for exploring Playa and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Credit Card Fraud!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Carel
Reviews.Content: Our stay was a total disaster. They had an employee who set up a bunch of excursions (we had a very large group) and insisted on cash payment. Turns out she was ripping us off for over 3,000.00. When we called her on this, she denied it and started sending us harrassing phone calls. On the tail end of our vacation, I found out from my credit card company that someone in Mexico was trying to place multiple charges on our card. It turns out that in addition to overcharging us and harassing us with phone calls/in person, this employee was adding additional charges that had nothing to do with the stay. It has been a total disaster since I now have had to file a fraud claim with my credit card company and NO ONE, inlcuding the owner, has returned a single phone call to correct the charges. I would be very cautious.

Reviews.Title: “Get away from those All-Inclusives!”
Reviews.Author: consuella
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at the Hotel Adventua Mexicana on 5th between 22nd and 24th April 19-23, 2007 and had a wonderful time! We wanted to get away from the all-inclusives and stay in something less congested. We found this place to be quiet, subdued, reasonably priced and clean with very friendly staff including Olivia the cat! What a nice change! If you're into loud partying, this is not the place for you. The Mayan Bristro has great food and a happy hour every day but Sunday, with many different flavors of margaritas. There is a PC in the hotel lobby as well as a small bookcase. Checkin and checkout was easy and quick. The weather was gorgeous and the Kool Beach Club is 2-3 blocks away and gives Adventura guests a discount on chaise rentals. It is a beautiful beach. The hotel has the usual beach towel card policy. There is also a Wal-mart (they're everywhere!) within walking distance of the hotel. We went to a great Italian restaurant right around the corner from the hotel. Don't miss the "four corners" area on a Friday evening for cocktails and people-watching.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Neese39
Reviews.Content: My eighteen year old daughter and I found this hotel to be a hidden paradise. The hotel is divided into two halves - the "Family" side and the "Adult" side. The family side has an interior courtyard with two small child-safe pools. Rooms have either sliders to the pool area or balconies that overlook it. The "Adult" side, where we stayed, is a whole different world. There is a beautiful garden setting of tropical plants and palms, a free-form pool, restaurant and dining area, and two spa tubs. One near the pool, the other on the third floor terrace. We stayed in room 1208. The "Adult side of the hotel is an L-shape, forming two sides of the courtyard, with the restaurant forming the third side and a hedge of hibiscus (through which you enter the area via an arched opening) forms the fourth. The staff is very friendly. We paid the extra $5 US for the full buffet breakfast and overall found it quite good. They serve a variety of fresh fruit, fresh orange juice, hot drinks, an egg dish, a side dish - we had french toast one day, cheese tortillas another - it varies, so no guarantee you'll love everything every day. A nice plus is the availability of a PC in the lobby for guest use-easy and no cost to keep in touch with home. The location is ideal, on the corner of 5th Ave, two blocks from the best beaches (KOOL Beach club very nice) and the hotel provides a continuous supply of beach towels, so there's no need to bring. No cost to sit on the beach with a towel and only $70 Pesos (less than $7 US ) for a padded chaise and food/beverage service. Fifth Ave runs from 38th St to 1st, where the ferry dock is. The lower we walked down, the more congested - we were happy to return to the hotel.. A good selection of restaurants and tons of shops on 5th, as well. The only negative - the bathroom in our room was somewhat open - no door although the opening was discreetly positioned, and one wall did not reach the ceiling. We were able to work around this, but check with the hotel if it would be an issue, there are some rooms with doors.

Reviews.Title: “aaahhhhh!!! peace, quiet, and OLIVIA and ERIC”
Reviews.Author: zoogirldenver
Reviews.Content: We had a charming stay the last week of February. The hotel is 1/2 block from 5th Avenue but very quiet. The grounds are immaculate. The staff was friendly. They have a computer in the lobby to use internet to E-mail home. Our fellow tourists were very quiet; we had the pools to ourselves most of the time. I really MUST tell you about OLIVIA and ERIC at the Mayan Bistro Restaurant attached to the hotel. ERIC is the most friendly waiter in all of Playa. He was attentive to all our needs and made us feel very special. The happy hour margaritas from 4-7 included fruit flavors, tamarindo, and just about any other flavor you could imagine. OLIVIA is the resident hotel cat who graciously allowed me to share my spaghetti with shrimp with her. She even condescended to share my sunbathing time with me in the afternoons. I was most pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food at the Mayan Bistro; the only other place we found that was almost as good was the Italian restaurant on the corner of 5th Avenue and calle 24, just a few steps from the hotel. They had a marvelous shrimp pizza and Caesar salad for 2 mixed at tableside. The hotel grounds are well-landscaped with jungle foliage and it was a joy to eat dinner by candlelight and look up at the clear sky and know we were in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Aventura an Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: DryHeatPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Aventura Mexicana is a delightful destination for travelers looking for a quiet, hospitable retreat within walking distance of beautiful beaches, a variety of dining experiences and a bustling shopping district. The hotel grounds and rooms are clean and tasteful, and the mulitcultural staff are professional and accomodating. This is by no means an 'all-inclusive' resort experience, but if you are looking for a safe oasis to rest your bones after a day of activities, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rhale53
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked the Aventura Mexicana on the strength of other Trip Advisor reviews. The location of the hotel is excellent, near the best beaches and restaurants but out of the tourist franzy in the center of town. Our room was on the "adult" side of the hotel, ample (once you get used to the absense of a bathroom door) and clean as a whistle; the grounds quiet (important in Playa) with much planting. The included continental breakfast was appreciated and the optional $5 breakfast buffet ample and varied. Breakfast staff were quite helpful; front desk staff were courteous but not particularly welcoming or friendly. We understood the Aventura Mexicana to be gay friendly and it was. Not a lot of gay couples but enough for us to feel comfortable; the majority of guests were from Europe (particularly Germany) and Canada - overall giving the place a diverse and international feel. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Changes in Latitude”
Reviews.Author: 2x1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Playa Del Carmen. The Hotel Aventura Mexicana was just what we were looking for and would recommend to family and friends. The 2 of us stayed 7 nights in an adult superior room complete with king bed, ample closet space, mini-frig, tiled shower, TV, and shared balcony. The bed was typically hard and a little short for a 6' 1"er. The shower floor had a few tiles missing. The water temperature was luke-warm the first day but learned to just to let it run a few minutes. The room was kept spotless. Never heard our neighbors. The air conditioner drowned out any 10th st. traffic noise day or night. We paid $131 per night including tax. The court yard was peaceful and tranquil. The clean pool was small but never crowded. We never took advantage of the jacuzzi. Several of the shrubs and vines were in bloom. The included continental breakfast was basic: orange juice, bread, roll, jam and coffee or tea. Perfect for our daily start. A full buffet breakfast was available. Never tried the 2 restaurants at the hotel, but heard reports that the fish was good. The staff was helpful, courteous and patient. The free Internet access PC in lobby was a great feature. Beach towels were available at the front desk. Car, tour, dive shop & restaurant recommendations were available. Tried Discovery Diving and Tank Ha. Both were professional, had quality rental equipment, small groups of from 2 to 4 and their dive masters worked hard to find all sorts of marine life not easily seen. Most double tank dives cost in the $65 range and $12 for full equipment rental. An ATM was 2 blocks south on 10th Ave. Mega grocery store was an easy 5 block walk. The north beach clubs were less than a 10 minute walk. The downtown beach clubs at 8th were less than 15 minutes. Restaurants are everywhere. Try John Grays for taste and presentation. Fusion Beach Club had a great vibe. The Blue Parrot Beach Club had free lounges & umbrellas for a drink or 2 and the fire dances at 11:00 pm. The farther from 5th Ave., the better the prices and the sparser the English spoken. A used $2 English-to-Spanish pocket dictionary proved helpful. Cancun Maps is coming out with an updated Playa map in 2007. The older map helped but restaurants can change quickly and new construction is everywhere. Took the $8 per person one-way bus between Playa and the airport. It is a little walk from customs when arriving but stops right at the main terminal when leaving. Very easy, comfortable, air conditioned & cheap. No bathroom. Takes 45 minutes to an hour. If arriving by cab, be sure to specify the 24th St. main entrance instead of the 22nd St. restaurant access. Less luggage hauling.

Reviews.Title: “Charming environment, great location, but room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: adriem
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this property in a superior family double room with my spouse and 5 year old son. Overall, we were pleased with our choice. Pros: Location--this hotel is at the north end of town, off 5th--fewer tourists and much quieter. A 5 minute walk from the best overall beach area and a 5 minute walk from shops and restaurants on 5th. Decor--nicely furnished and decorated rooms--tasteful and soothing Breakfast--generous buffet breakfast available each day--rolls, fruit, eggs and side dish each day, fresh orange juice and coffee. Staff--friendly and available to help when approached. They stored our luggage for several hours after check-out, which was very helpful. Cons: Our room--if I'd been given a choice, I would have preferred one of the rooms with a balcony facing the courtyard/ pool area. Our balcony faced the street and was very narrow with uncomfortable chairs--just not that nice for sitting outside. The bathroom was very dark and small and didn't seem really clean. Pool--very small --my son enjoyed it but I had no desire to get in the water. The pool on the "adult side" of the hotel appeared bigger, and they also had hot tubs which would have been nice. Things that would improve this hotel: Small table and chairs in room--we had nowhere to set anything other than in the TV cabinet. Purified water in room, or at least for sale in the hotel reception area--we went through a lot and had to keep returning to the store for more. Not a necessity, but would be a nice touch. Softer mattresses, Better discount on the beach club. A binder of restaurant suggestions & menus would be nice for those unfamiliar with the town. When visiting Playa again, I will likely choose a different hotel--I'm not sure the room we had was worth $120 a night considering it was several blocks off the beach and had no usable balcony. I would probably not recommend this hotel for people with young kids, as there is a lot of walking (which is fine with me, but with our son we dealt with a fair amount of whining when walking to/from the beach and to/from dinner). I would recommend this property to those who want a quiet, simple retreat that is still close to the activity on 5th.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet get away”
Reviews.Author: atkinformexico
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a quiet, well run get away from the crowds and activity of Playa Del Carmen. Located just a half block from 5th Avenue shopping, it has Mexican style court yards and a great restaurant. As others have mentioned, the 4-7pm happy hour is a must. Our only complaint was having to wait until 8 am for coffee. Bring a coffee maker if wake up early and need some java. Coffee can be obtained at 7 am about a block away on 5th avenue.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Gr8lyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aventura over New Years and the first week of January. I enjoyed my stay and felt that the hotel was great for the price we paid. The staff - They are exceptional! Whenever we had a request or needed assistance we were able to get assistance and they always followed up and wanted to make sure that our need or request was satisfied. I was very pleased with all of the staff members that I interacted with. The rooms - When we first arrived we stayed in the small palapa, which was fun, however, they didn't have a mosquito net over the roof, which made it interesting because we had to battle with the mosquito's, however, we were only there for a couple of days before we were transferred to a regular room. The rooms were very clean, I personally didn't have any plumbing issues in the time that I was there. The food - I was impressed with the breakfast selection that was offered. The food was great; fresh fruit, juice, eggs, and a variety of other breakfast foods depending on the day. Location - Perfect! Safety- I am a woman, so I always think about how safe I feel at a hotel. I felt very safe here. There was a security guard up front after 11pm in the evening and the front doors were locked. This is not an American hotel nor is it a four or five star establishment, so make sure that your expectations are in check. It is a simple hotel that is a great place to stay if you are looking for somewhere safe, affordable and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Rik576
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Aventrura during Xmas break and had a very nice time.. Found the staff pleasant and helpful.. all you have to do is ask as they're not going to read your mind. They are multi lingual and I think conversing in Spanish if you know even a little goes a long way. Ricardo was always very helpful and friendly. This is a no frills hotel so be advised not to expect pampering if that's your thing. The breakfasts are great, the rooms are clean and well kept. The only issue I had was the plumbing was not always reliable and that is my only complaint. Otherwise, I would definitely stay here again. You can't beat the location ..minutes to the beach and off 5th Ave so it's nice and quiet. I would recommend to friends as well.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Aventura Mexicana
HotelInfo.Address: Calle 24 Nte Entre Av 5 y 10, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
